loans.name: Kanze

texts.en:
Kanze is a married mother of six children. She lives in Malindi and sells roofing materials, commonly referred to as ‘makuti’. These items are preferred for roofing in the Malindi area and on the coast in general, since they insulate from the heat mostly experienced on the coast during the daytime. Kanze has been running the business for two years.

Kanze was introduced to Milango by her friends and is applying for a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to purchase more coconut fronds and thread for sewing. Her main challenges are high inflation which has reduced the purchasing power of most customers and the lack of reliable customers.

Kanze will save the additional income from this loan.

loans.use: To purchase more coconut fronds and thread for sewing.

loans.name: Nuru

texts.en:
Nuru is a resident of Malindi, Kenya. She owns a café which has been in operation for ten years. Nuru sold some of her cattle to raise the capital in order to start the business. Nuru is also married and has three children.

She has been preparing buns locally known as ‘mahamri’ which are very popular for breakfast. Nuru is applying for a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to purchase cafe utensils.

The only challenges facing the business are the high cost of raw materials and some clients not paying on time. She will use the additional income from this loan to start up a firewood and charcoal shop.

loans.use: To purchase cafe utensils.

loans.name: Jannifer

texts.en:
Jannifer is married and has two children. She is a resident of Malindi, Kenya. She owns a grocery stall selling vegetables, cereals, fruits, and firewood, which she has been doing for three years. She was previously employed in the export processing zone. When she resigned, Jannifer received her dues, which formed the first capital for the business. 

Jannifer is requesting a loan for 20,000 KES, which she will use to purchase charcoal, cereals, and firewood. Jannifer’s business faces the challenge of high cost of raw materials and inflation.  She will use the additional income from this loan to complete the final payment on a plot she had purchased. She also looks forward to opening other branches in the future.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal, cereals, and firewood..

loans.name: Memuna

texts.en:
This is 41 year-old Memuna. She is married and has three children age 17, 13 and 2. She has no additional dependents.  

In 1992, Memuna established her Africana dress business. She began her business because just after she concluded her national primary school education, she lost her father and by then her mother was seriously sick so that she could neither look after her nor support her education. So therefore, she decided to assist neighbors in doing business with the intention that somebody would take care of her schooling, but unfortunately, that did not happen.

So she finally made up her mind to continue business and started to raise funds and started her own business. Working six days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about SLL 1,500,000 every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of SLL 5,000,000. Memuna requires a loan in order to buy 10 cartons of ladies' slippers @ SLL 250,000 and five dozen ladies' trousers @ SLL 420,000. 

She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately SLL 900,000. 

In the future, Memuna plans to rent a shop at the center of town and also hopes to see her children educated to higher levels. She is hard-working and very grateful. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy 10 cartons of ladies' slippers @ SLL 250,000 and five dozen ladies' trousers @ SLL 420,000.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a resident of Mariakani, Kenya. She owns a food café which has been operating for ten years. She is a married mother of three children. She started the business from a capital of $6. The business has now improved and has a daily turnover of that similar amount. She was introduced to Milango by her friends.

Esther is applying for a loan of 6,000 Kenya shillings to purchase additional stock of foodstuffs, e.g. rice, flour, milk, etc. She believes that the business has a better future and that she will be able to build another hotel from the proceeds of the current business. The only challenge is the overall inflation.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock of foodstuffs, e.g. rice, flour, milk, etc.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is a resident of Mombasa, Kenya. He is the father of one child. Samuel first applied for a loan of forty thousand Kenya shillings to purchase a motorbike. This is the business that has helped support his family for the past two years.

He was introduced to Milango last year and is applying for a loan of 65,000 Kenya shillings to purchase another motorbike. His future ambition is to acquire a ‘matatu’ - a van - in the future. Samuel is optimistic about overcoming the challenges of the high costs of fuel and the purchase of equipment/spares to achieve his goals.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more metal materials.

loans.name: Hanh

texts.en:
Hanh and her family live in Ho Chi Minh City. She is 38 and has three children.  

She and her husband have been earning a living by operating a food stall from the door of their house for the past fifteen years. They sell a variety of soft drinks and coffees. 

Hanh would like to borrow money to expand her current business by buying a greater quantity and variety of beverages to stock her store. She hopes that this will enable her to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a greater quantity and variety of beverages to stock her store

loans.name: Kim

texts.en:
Kim is a 49-year-old woman with three daughters. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City and makes money by selling coffees and soft drinks. Her husband earns a living working as a breakdown motocycle mechanic.

For the past six years, Kim has run a food stall to cover her family's daily living expenses and her children's education fees. The business is going smoothly and she would like a loan to buy many kinds of beverages to provide to her customers.

She hopes this will increase her income, help her to improve her living conditions, and allow her to set aside some savings.

loans.use: To buy many kinds of beverages to provide to her customers.

loans.name: Minh

texts.en:
Minh, 37, is married and has been supporting his family by operating a barber shop in the local community. His wife earns money with the business of selling breads. Minh lives with his children and wife in Ho Chi Minh City. 

Minh has been in business for fourteen years. He plans to use this loan to buy new tools amd accessories such as a hairdryer, razors and hair clippers. In the future, he would like to expand his business and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy new tools and accessories such as a hairdryer, razors and hair clippers

loans.name: Hien

texts.en:
Hien, 23, is married and has been supporting her family by operating a beauty shop in the local community. Her husband earns money by working as a driver. She lives with her son and husband in Ho Chi Minh City. 

Hien has been in business for ten years. She plans to use this loan to buy new hairdressing tools, cosmetics, and materials such as shampoo, dyes, and nail-polish. In the future, she would like to expand her business and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy new hairdressing tools, cosmetics, and materials such as shampoo, dyes, and nail-polish

loans.name: Abou Hamidou

texts.fr:
Abou Hamidou, âgé de 38 ans est un jeune commerçant qui vend des produits divers. Dans sa boutique il y a un peu de tout : des denrées alimentaires, du cosmétique et divers autre produit susceptible de générer un profil.
Il est marié et a 7 enfants qui sont de bas âge car l’ainé a 11 ans et le tout dernier n’a en que 6 mois. Ce qui fait qu’il a pas mal de charges car aucun d’eux n’est majeur. 
Il a un projet qui est sa seule préoccupation actuellement : celui de construire sa maison et d’y faire entrer sa famille.
texts.en:
Abou Hamidou, 38, is a young merchant who sells various items. In his little store, he has a bit of everything: foodstuffs, cosmetics, and whatever can be sold at a profit. 

He is married and has seven children who are still young. The oldest is 11 and the youngest 6 months old. This means that he has a lot of expenses to cope with as none of his children is grown-up. 

He has a dream which is his only preoccupation right now: to build a house and settle his family in it.

loans.use: to buy various foodstuffs (milk, sugar, etc.) and cosmetics and so on

loans.name: Mariatu

texts.en:
This is 34 year-old Mariatu. She is single and has no children but she does have two dependents who live with her because she is assisting the family for their schooling.  

In 2002, Mariatu established her textiles business. She began her business because, after the death of her mother there was no other person to take over her mother’s business. She had wanted to further her education after acquiring a diploma in business studies, but she just decided to implement what she had studied by taking over the business. 

With her experience, the business has improved gradually. Working seven days a week and 12 hours a day, she earns about SLL 1,200,000 every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of SLL 3,000,000 in order to buy 50 yards of lace @ Le 30,000, 10 bolts of printed cloth @ SLL 80,000 and 20 yards material @ SLL 25,000. Mariatu requires a loan in order to improve her business. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately SLL 900,000. 

In the future, Mariatu plans to expand the business to a higher level. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy 50 yards of lace @ SLL 30,000, 10 bolts of printed cloth @ SLL 80,000 and 20 yards of fabric @ SLL 25,000.

loans.name: Sosha P.

texts.en:
Sosha is 29 years old and lives in the Paynesville area. She is single with a 2-year-old child. She is a high school graduate.

For four years she has been operating a shop where she sells soft drinks, stout, malta (a non-alcoholic, carbonated malt beverage), tissue, soap and others items. She started this business with two thousand U.S. dollars given to her by her son's father, and she learned this way of running a shop from her mother.

She enjoys her business because it helps her to save and have money to spend. She is requesting a loan to purchase more soft drinks, malta, tissue, soap, and many other items for her business. In the near future, she wants to attend university and send her child to school.

loans.use: to purchase more soft drinks, stout, malta, tissue, soap, and many other items for her business,

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha is a resident of Malindi, Kenya. She is a married mother of four children. Martha runs a retail shop which has been in operation for the last three years. She began the business through the sale of secondhand clothes, from which she saved the profit to be used as the capital for this new business.

On learning of Milango from her friends, Martha decided to join in order to receive more credit for business expansion. She is applying for a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to increase the stock of retail items like cooking fat, salt, sugar, flour, etc.

Despite the challenges of the high cost of products and the overall inflation which has reduced the purchasing power of most customers, Martha’s ambition is to own a supermarket.

loans.use: To buy a stock of retail items like cooking fat, salt, sugar, flour, etc.

loans.name: Nhom

texts.en:
Nhom, 53, is married with two daughters and one son. She earns a living to support her family by sewing clothes. Her husband works as a mason. They live in Ho Chi Minh City. 

Nhom started her sewing business sixteen years ago. She would like to take a loan to expand the business. With the loan she intends to increase her working capital by buying good materials that will enable her to make better quality products for her customers. She hopes that this will generate more income and that she can save money for her children to go to school.

loans.use: To buy good materials for sewing

loans.name: Nu

texts.en:
Nu is a 42-year-old married woman. She has 3 children. Her husband earns a living working as a taxi driver. They live together in Ho Chi Minh City. For twenty years Nu has operated a food stall to sell meals to people in their community.

Nu would like a loan to purchase new furniture, good quality food and rice in bulk. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her customers and attract additional customers. 

She also hopes that through her loan she will be able to increase her income and save money for any future difficulties facing her family.

loans.use: To purchase new furniture, good quality food, and rice in bulk

loans.name: Trinh

texts.en:
Trinh is a 57-year-old married woman with three children. Her husband has been working as a hired labourer. Trinh lives with her family in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City. 

Trinh has run a food stall in front of their house for the past twenty-four years. She sells breads with pork cut into small peices.

She would like to receive a loan to expand her business by purchasing more furniture and good quality materials at a wholesale price. She hopes that this will enable her to increase the turnover of her business, earn a higher income, and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy more furniture and good quality materials at a wholesale price

loans.name: Aissata

texts.fr:
Aissata est une jeune dame qui s’est très vite responsabilisé car cela fait maintenant 12 ans qu’elle est entrée dans le commerce de légumes. Elle est mariée et prend en charges ses 6 enfants dont l’ainé a 14 ans et la dernière, 3 mois. 
Avec le crédit, elle va acheter des légumes au marché hebdomadaires de la ville.
Aissata rêve d’ouvrir une boutique quand elle aura une assise financière.
texts.en:
Aissata is a young lady who had to become responsible very early on. She got into selling vegetables 12 years ago. She is married and responsible for her six children, the oldest of whom is 14 and the youngest, three months old. 

With the loan she is going to buy vegetables at the weekly market of the city. She dreams of opening a store when she manages to be in a good enough financial situation.

loans.use: to buy vegetables for resale

loans.name: Loveltt T.

texts.en:
Loveltt lives in the Paynesville area. She is 44 years old, divorced and has a child who is 24 and lives on her own. Loveltt is a high school graduate.

For the past five years she has been running a shop where she sells soda drinks, chlorine, tissues, biscuits, juice, candy, batteries, alcoholic drinks, and many others items.

She started this business from her savings when she and her husband were together. She learned this way of running a business from her mother. 

Some problems she faces include electricity. She has to run a generator that is expensive. But she likes her business because it makes her popular and gives her enough money to spend daily.

She is requesting a loan to purchase more soda drinks, chlorine, tissues, juice, biscuits, candy, batteries, alcoholic drinks, and many other items for her business. Her plan is to expand her business even more.

loans.use: to purchase more soda drinks, chlorine, tissue, juice, biscuits, candy, batteries, alcoholic drinks, and many other items for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy raw materials like flour, fat, etc. and to build a larger business space.

loans.name: An

texts.en:
An, 64, is married and has eight children: four sons and four daughters. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband is retired. 

An supports her family by running a general store in front of her house. She started this business twenty-two years ago. She sells sugar, toys for kids, soft drinks, yogurt and other household items to people in her community. 

She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying a greater variety of products, in particular foods and beverages, to stock her store and better satisfy her customers. She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions and sending her children to school.

loans.use: To buy a greater variety of products, in particular foods and beverages, to stock her store

loans.name: Mai

texts.en:
Mai is a 53-year-old married woman living in Ho Chi Minh City. She has two children. Her husband works in a local company. Mai earns a living running a general store, which she has done for sixteen years. 

Mai would like to take out a loan to buy a greater variety and quantity of basic goods, such as snack foods and confectionery, to stock her general store. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her existing customers and attract additional customers. She also hopes that through the loan her business will generate a higher income and will help her to improve her family's living conditions and enable her to save money to meet any future difficulties.

loans.use: To buy a greater variety and quantity of basic goods, such as snack foods and confectionery

loans.name: Huong

texts.en:
Huong, a 41-year-old married woman, lives in Ho Chi Minh City. Huong's husband earns a living working as a computer technician. Huong runs a store that sells a variety of basic goods to people in the local community.

Huong requests a loan to purchase more products, such as stationery, candies, lighters, to stock her store. This will enable her to offer a better range of products to her customers. She hopes her business will run smoothly and she can earn additional income to reinvest in her shop and save for emergencies.

loans.use: To purchase more products, such as stationery, candies, and lighters, to stock her store

loans.name: Emmanuel 02 Group

texts.fr:
Mme CATHERINE  est la représentante du groupe EMMANUEL 02. Elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants. Le plus âgé a 08ans le moins âgé a 06mois. 02 vont à l’école et elle a 03 personnes à sa charge.

Mme vend des pagnes  depuis 05ans. Elle s’approvisionne au marché  de secteur 10 en ville. Ses clients sont les femmes et hommes.

Mme veut  s’acheter  10 complets pagnes et 20 complets habits pour enfants.

Elle  utilise ses bénéfices  pour renforcer son commerce. Mme ambitionne  agrandir son commerce et assurer la scolarité de ses  enfants.
texts.en:
Mme CATHERINE is the representative of the group EMMANUEL 02. She is married and the mother of three children. The eldest is eight years old and the youngest six months old. Two of them attend school and she is responsible for three persons. 

Mme Catherine has been selling African print cloth for five years. She buys her wares in the Secteur 10 market in town. Her clients are made up of both men and women.  She wants to buy 10 lengths of African print cloth and 20 outfits for children. 

She uses her profit to expand her business. Her ambition is to grow her business and ensure that she can pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy 10 whole lengths of African print cloth and 20 outfits for children.

loans.name: Hoa

texts.en:
Hoa is 44 years old and married. She lives with her daughters and husband in Ho Chi Minh City. For 17years she has operated a food stall selling meals to people in her community.

Hoa is requesting a loan, which she will use to purchase new furniture, good quality food, and rice in bulk. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her customers and attract additional customers. She also hopes that through her loan she will be able to increase her income and save money for any future difficulties facing her family.

loans.use: to purchase new furniture, food, and rice.

loans.name: Sonia Isabel

texts.es: Sonia Isabel habita en casa de su habitación junto con su grupo familiar el cual está integrado por su esposo y familia. Se dedica a la agricultura, además a la compra y venta de chatarra, plástico y aluminio. Tiene aproximadamente 10 años de dedicarse a la agricultura por lo que ya cuenta con mucha experiencia y reconocimiento en la zona donde habita. Ella es una mujer increíble, trabajadora, dedicada y sobre todo carismática. Su sueño es dar a su familia lo mejor que ella pueda dar. Todo lo anterior la ha hecho pensar mucho en la posibilidad de invertir más en su negocio por medio de préstamo. Evaluando la situación ha llegado a la conclusión que necesita de un crédito para poder invertir en su negocio. Es por eta razón que se dirige a INTEGRAL  para solicitar este crédito para invertir en la compra de los insumos básicos (abonos, venenos, semilla, etc.) de la agricultura ya que esto es lo que necesita para seguir  trabajando la tierra y sacando el pan de cada día para ella y su familia.  Tiene plena confianza que así será.
texts.en:
Sonia Isabel lives at home with her family, which comprises her husband and family members. She is a farmer and also buys and sells scrap metal, plastic, and aluminum. Since she has been farming for almost 10 years, she is very experienced and well known in the area where she lives. She is an incredible woman: hardworking, dedicated, and above all, charismatic. Her dream is to give her family the best that she can.

All this has made her think about the possibility of investing more in her business through a loan. Evaluating the situation has led her to the conclusion that she needs a loan to be able to invest in her business. Therefore, she came to INTEGRAL to ask for this investment loan to buy basic agricultural inputs (manure, poisons, seed, etc.), as she needs them to continue working the land and supporting herself and her family. She is fully confident that this will happen.

loans.use: to buy: manure, poisons, seed, etc.

loans.name: Anh

texts.en: Anh is 52 years old and married with 2 children - a son and a daughter. She and her husband support their family by running a pharmacy. Anh would like to take out a loan to increase the working capital for her business, which will enable her to buy additional nutrition supplements to sell. She hopes that through the loan she can improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy additional nutrition supplements to sell from her store.

loans.name: Lieu

texts.en:
Lieu is a 45-year-old married woman living in Ho Chi Minh City. She has 2 children. Her husband is a security guard for a bookstore. Lieu earns a living running a general store, which she has done for 10 years. 

Lieu would like to take out a loan to buy a greater variety and quantity of basic goods to stock her general store, such as sugar, cooking oils, rice and confectionery. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her existing customers and to attract additional customers. She also hopes that through the loan her business will generate higher income, help her to improve her family's living conditions and enable her to save money to meet any future difficulties.

loans.use: To buy a greater variety and quantity of basic goods, such as sugar, cooking oils, rice and confectionery.

loans.name: Phuoc

texts.en:
Phuoc is a 50-year-old married woman with 2 daughters. She lives in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City. 

Phuoc and her husband have run a food stall in front of their house for the past three years. They sell steamed rice pancakes and pork pies.

She would like to receive a loan to expand her business by purchasing more rice, cooking appliances and good quality food. She hopes that this will enable her to increase the turnover of her business, earn a higher income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase more rice, cooking appliances, and good quality food.

loans.name: Thanh

texts.en:
Thanh, 55 years old, is divorced and has one son. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City.

Thanh supports her family with the income that she earns from selling vermicelli made of rice flour with pork, cut into small pieces. She intends to use her loan to buy more good quality rice for her production of vermicelli, and to buy a greater quantity of boxes to package her food for her customers.

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will help her to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy more good quality rice for her production of vermicelli, and to buy a greater quantity of boxes for packaging.

loans.name: Chi

texts.en:
Chi, a 28-year-old married woman, lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband is a mechanic, while Chi has been earning a living by running a food stall from the door of their house for the past five years. She sells noodles and braised beef.

Chi would like to borrow money to expand her business by purchasing larger quantities of foods at wholesale prices. She hopes that this will enable her to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a greater quantity of foods at wholesale prices for resale.

loans.name: Phuong

texts.en: Phuong, a 43-year-old married woman with two sons, lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City, where she has been running a food stall for nearly ten years. Currently selling noodles to people in the local community, she is requesting a loan to buy a greater quantity and variety of food to meet customer demand. Phuong hopes that this loan will increase her business income and enable her to save additional amounts for reinvestment.

loans.use: to buy a greater quantity and variety of food to meet customer demand.

loans.name: Thinh

texts.en:
Thinh is 61 years old and has two children. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City and makes money by selling soft drinks, which she has been doing for 12 years. She is able to cover her family's daily living expenses and her children's education fees.  

Thinh is requesting a loan, which she will use to buy many kinds of beverages to provide to her customers.  She hopes this will increase her income, help her to improve her living conditions, and allow her to set aside some savings.

loans.use: to purchase beverages.

loans.name: Luz

texts.en: Luz, 53 years old and married, is a farmer from Trinidad, Bohol who has been growing and selling rice for 30 years, earning 6000 PHP per month.  She works hard to keep her farm productive and is now requesting a loan to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs. Luz hopes to start another business as  an extra source of income for her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Nam

texts.en:
Nam, 46 years old, is married and has two children. Nam and his wife support their family through the income they earn from selling plastic appliances and household products. They have operated this business for 10 years. They live in Ho Chi Minh City. 

Nam intends to take a loan to increase his working capital and buy different plastic products for selling. The additional products will enable him to increase his sales. He hopes his business runs smoothly and will help him to improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to increase his working capital and buy different plastic products for selling.

loans.name: Nham

texts.en:
Nham is 40 years old and married with two children. She lives with her family in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband earns income as a worker in a local company. Nham runs a general store to earn a living. 

She started her business 10 years ago. She intends to take a loan to expand her business by buying a variety of different beverages to sell to her customers from her store. 

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to expand her business by buying a variety of different beverages to sell for her customers.

loans.name: Ha

texts.en:
Ha, 36, is married and has two children. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband is a bricklayer.

Ha has been running a business making clothes in front of her house for 2 years. She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying different materials and fabric to better satisfy her customers.

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions and sending her children to school.

loans.use: to buy different materials and fabric to better satisfy her customers.

loans.name: Huyen

texts.en:
Huyen, 42, is married and has one son and one daughter. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband works as a security guard. She earns an income running a general store in front of her house. 

She started this business two years ago. She sells sugar, toys for kids, soft drinks, yogurt and other household items to people in her community. She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying a greater variety of products, in particular foods and beverages, to stock her store and better satisfy her customers.

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy foods and beverages to stock her store and better satisfy her customers.

loans.name: Lang

texts.en:
Lang is 55 years old and is married. Her husband is a driver for hire. She has been running a general store in front of her door for 6 years. They live in Ho Chi Minh City.

Lang is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying a greater quantity and variety of basic products, such as foods and beverages, to stock her general store. She hopes that by offering more products for sale she will be able to increase the turnover of her business. 

She hopes that through the loan she will be able to expand her business, and have money to reinvest to her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy a greater quantity and variety of basic products to stock her general store

loans.name: Carmen Yolanda

texts.es:
Yolanda tiene 43 años de edad, es madre soltera y con mucho esfuerzo ha sabido sacar adelante a sus hijos, los cuales actualmente tienen 20, 16 y 3 años, se convirtió en madre muy joven razón por la cual tuvo que dejar sus estudios por dedicarse a ellos y a su pareja, un tiempo después descubrió que su pareja la engañaba y decidió separarse de él y continuar su camino sola, gracias al amor que les tiene ella supo trabajar muy duro y luego de mucho sacrificio y ahorro logro tener su negocio de venta de comida desde hace un año, al principio le fue un poco difícil pero con el tiempo logro organizarse, a Yolanda le gusta mucho  cocinar, por ello ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque le gusta lo que hace y porque tiene buena sazón.

Yolanda esta muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias al apoyo que le han brindado ella podrá comprar mesas, sillas ya que actualmente solo tiene una meza y seis sillas y en algunas oportunidades los clientes se van porque no hay lugar donde sentarse; además también podrá realizar un mantenimiento, arreglo y pintado del local, lo que le permitirá darle más comodidad a sus clientes y poder aumentar sus ingresos y seguir luchando por cumplir su gran sueño: “Darle una profesión a sus hijos y tener un local mas grande”.
texts.en:
Yolanda is 43 years old and a single mother. With great effort, she has learned to provide for her children, who are 20, 16 and 3 years old. Because she became a mother at a young age, she had to give up her studies to dedicate herself to them and her partner. Some time later, she discovered that her partner was cheating on her. She decided to separate and go on by herself. Because she loves her children, she learned to work very hard. A year ago, after much sacrifice and saving, she managed to open her own business selling food. At first it was a little difficult for her, but over time she has managed to get organized. Yolanda loves to cook. She thinks her business is going well because she loves what she does and is a good cook.

Yolanda is very grateful to the Kiva lenders. With the help they have offered her, she will be able to buy tables and chairs. She only has one table and six chairs. At times customers leave because there is no place to sit. She will also be able to do maintenance, fix up, and paint the space, which will allow her customers to be more comfortable. She will be able to increase her income and continue fighting to achieve her great dream: "Give her children a profession and have a larger space."

loans.use: to buy tables, chairs, to do maintenance of the space, paint, among other things

loans.name: Omar

texts.fr: Omar est un homme marié, père de trois enfants. Il tient dans son quartier un magasin d'alimentation dans lequel il a aménagé un espace de vente de produits cosmétiques.Il a une large clientèle et génère des revenus qui lui permettent d'entretenir sa famille.Pour continuer à satisfaire  cette clientèle qui augmente de jour en jour,il a décidé de renforcer son fonds de commerce.Il sollicite ainsi un pret de 500000f pour acheter des denrées alimentaires et des produits cosmétiques.Il envisage d'ouvrir une seconde boutique.
texts.en:
Omar is married and father of three children. He runs a food store in his neighborhood, and within his store he has also set up an area for selling cosmetics. He has a large customer base and generates enough  income to support his family.

To continue to satisfy his customer base, which is growing bigger each day, he decided to strengthen his business. Therefore, he is asking for a loan of 500,000f to buy foodstuffs and cosmetics. He plans to open a second shop.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs and cosmetics

loans.name: Gai

texts.en:
Gai is a 48-year-old married woman. She lives with her two children and husband in Ho Chi Minh City. For ten years, she and her husband have run a food stall and sell beef and noodles to people in their community.

Gai would like a loan to purchase better beef and other ingredients to make better quality food. She hopes this will enable her to better serve her customers and attract additional customers. 

She also hopes that through her loan she will be able to increase her income and save money for any future difficulties facing her family.

loans.use: to purchase better beef and other ingredients to make better quality food.

loans.name: Abdou

texts.fr: Abdou est un photographe qui exerce ce métier depuis plus de 10 ans.Il fait des reportages photos dans les différentes cérémonies familiales et les rencontres officielles qui se passent dans sa localité.Il entretient sa famille avec les revenus tirés de cette activité qui marche assez bien. Devant toujours se déplacer à travers la ville, il a acheté une motocyclette qui est malheureusement tombé en panne.Il sollicite ainsi un pret de 50000f pour acheter des pièces de rechange afin de répare sa moto. Son ambition est d'acheter une moto neuve.
texts.en:
Abdou has been working as a photographer for over ten years now. He creates photo documentaries for various family ceremonies and official meetings that occur in his town. He supports his family with the income generated from this business, which is going rather well.

Having to constantly go around town from place to place, he bought a motor bicycle, which unfortunately has broken down. He is asking for a loan of 50,000f to buy spare parts in order to repair his motor bicycle. His goal is to buy a new motor bicycle.

loans.use: to buy spare parts in order to repair his motor bicycle

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
As a married parent of 8 children, Gemma works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Gemma is borrowing PHP 30000 through NWTF to purchase additional fishing nets and other fishing equipment for her fishing business.

Gemma has been sustaining her business activities through her past 7 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional fishing nets and other fishing equipment

loans.name: Phuong

texts.en:
Phuong is 27 years old and married. He has two children and lives with them and his wife in Ho Chi Minh city. His wife runs a general store in front of their house and helps him to sell mobile phone cards.

Phuong has been in the business of selling mobile cards for three years. Now he would like to take a loan to buy a greater quantity of mobile phone cards and accessories to sell to his customers. He hopes that through the loan he will be able to generate a higher income and save money to further expand his business.

loans.use: To buy a greater quantity of mobile cards and accessories to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Edilberto

texts.en:
Edilberto is a seaweed farmer from Bien Unido, Bohol. He is 53 years old, married with a 3-year-old child. Edilberto earns 10000 PHP per month doing this seaweed farming. He said he hopes for his income to be stable as he is saving for his child's future education.

Edilberto is requesting a loan to purchase seaweed seedlings, straw and other materials. Edilberto hopes for his business to grow and for his family to experience progress in life.

loans.use: to purchase seaweed seedlings, straw and other materials

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is 49 years old, married, and has six children. Betty works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store (general store) in the Philippines and requested a 19,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more inventory to sell.

Betty has borrowed and paid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 15 years and also earns an income from trucking services and selling gasoline. Betty aspires to save enough money so she can send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy inventory

loans.name: Irma Yolanda

texts.es: Irma Yolanda de 38 años de edad, habita en casa propia junto con su grupo familiar el cual está integrado por su esposo de 44 años y sus tres hijos de 18,13 y 5 años de edad, dos de los cuales se encuentran estudiando.  Irma  se dedica  al comercio de tienda en la cual ofrece variedad de productos tales como: frijoles, arroz, café, aceite, detergente, papel, golosinas, condimentos, etc. Ya tiene mucho tiempo de dedicarse al negocio y muchas personas la prefieren por ser una mujer honesta, trabajadora y sobre todo carismática. Ella tiene muchas ideas de negocio que poco a poco va poniendo en marcha. Gracias a su creatividad en los negocios ha sabido mantener activo su negocio por muchos años.  Es una mujer digna de confianza de la cual los vecinos dan muy buenas referencia. Últimamente Irma  ha estado pensando en la posibilidad de surtir su negocio con variedad de productos de tienda  con el fin de atraer a más clientes y cubrir una mayor demanda. Esto la hizo tomar la decisión de solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para comprar variedad de productos de tienda tales como: pan dulce, aceite, leche, arroz, café, frijoles, golosinas, detergente y de más artículos que sean atractivos para los clientes. De esta manera espera lograr su sueño de poder dar a su familia una mejor oportunidad de vida.
texts.en: Irma Yolanda, 38, lives in her own house with her family. Her husband is 44 and of her three children aged 5, 13 and 18, the two eldest are in school. Irma works in retail, selling a variety of products like beans, rice, coffee, oil, detergent, paper, candy, condiments, etc. She has lots of time to dedicate to her business and many people prefer her store because she is honest, hard working, and most of all, charismatic. She has many ideas for her business that’s she’s been implementing little by little. Thanks to her creativity in business, she’s been able to keep her business active for many years. She’s a very dignified, confident woman and her neighbors give her good references. Lately, Irma has been thinking about stocking up her store with a bigger variety of products in order to attract more customers and fill demands. This idea was the impetus to request a loan with INTEGRAL to buy a variety of products like sweet buns, oil, milk, rice, coffee, beans, candy, detergent and other articles that would bring in the customers. This is how she hopes to achieve her dream of improving her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: sweet buns, oil, milk, rice, coffee, beans, candy, detergent, etc.

loans.name: Quyen

texts.en:
Quyen is 37 years old, married with three children, and lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. She supports her family through the income she earns from making clothes. She started this business over four years ago. Her husband is also involved in this business.

She intends to take a loan to buy fabric and materials to make a greater range of clothing to better meet her customers' needs. 

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will help her to improve her living conditions and enable her to set aside some savings for family emergencies.

loans.use: to buy materials to make a greater range of clothing to better meet her customers' needs.

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en:
Annabelle works hard to support her family. Annabelle is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Annabelle requested a PHP 21,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional fish to sell.

Annabelle has been in this business for four years now.

In the future, Annabelle would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to sell

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 23000 through NWTF to purchase spare parts for motorcycle maintenance.

Norma has been in this business for 15 years. Norma earns more income from buying and selling bags.

Norma has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to build a house for her family in the future.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for motorcycle maintenance

loans.name: Maricor

texts.en:
Maricor is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to purchase additional equipment for her fishing business.

Maricor has been in this business for 2 years. Maricor earns additional income from buying and selling frozen products.

Maricor has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She hopes to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional equipment for her fishing business

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en: Lolita is 60 years old, married, and has four children. Lolita is in the agricultural business of farming rice in the Philippines. Lolita requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase fertilizers and other farm equipment. Lolita has been farming rice for 20 years now, and has borrowed 20 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her farming activities. In the future, Lolita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and other farm equipment

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en: Marilyn is 42 years old, married, and has five children. With two children in school, Marilyn works very hard to provide for them. Marilyn runs a direct sales business selling Avon and Natasha products in the Philippines. She has requested a 30,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more inventory to sell. Marilyn has been in this business for seven years and sells a variety of items such as pants, shoes, shirts, lotions, perfumes, etc. In the future Marilyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory to sell

loans.name: Nenive

texts.en:
Nenive is 27 years old, married, and has two children. She works very hard to provide for them. Nenive runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 18,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell.

Nenive has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, detergent, canned goods, and other groceries. In the future Nenive would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell.

loans.name: Floro

texts.en: Floro is a 44-year-old married man with six children between the ages of 7 months and 23 years. Floro has a "habal-habal" (motorcycle taxi) business in Trinidad, Bohol. He has had this business for almost seven years. Floro earns about 3,000 PHP per month doing the "habal-habal" business. Floro is requesting a loan to purchase spare parts and gasoline. He hopes to expand his business and buy additional motorcycles in the future.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and gasoline

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en: Francisca, a 49-year-old married mother of five, lives in the Philippines where she has been operating a retail shop selling canned goods, snacks and beverages for 10 years. A member of HSPFI since 2010, she is requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP to buy more stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages. In the future, Francisca hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Las Ovejitas Blancas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LAS OVEJAS BLANCAS” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Santiago II.  Está compuesta por siete integrantes y cuentan con una mesa directiva a la cabeza de la misma se encuentra  la señora Daniela. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: papelería, venta de cordero, venta de chinelas y zapatillas, venta de humintas, tienda de abarrotes, venta de artículos de regalo.

La señora Daniela, indica que forma parte de una asociación comunal por primera vez y que en la actualidad ella cuenta con un negocio tienda en general, que viene trabajando hace años. El crédito de este ciclo es para ampliación de su mercadería (compra de víveres) este producto lo comprará de las ferias paceñas y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite apoyar a su familia pues ella no es casada y tiene dos hijos.

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud por el consultorio.
texts.en:
The "Ovejas Blancas" communal bank will begin its first loan cycle at Pro Mujer, through the Santiago II regional office. It is made up of seven members, with a board of directors headed by Daniela.  

The members of the communal bank carry on a variety of businesses selling such things as stationery, lambs, sandals and sport shoes, humintas (baked corn tamales), groceries, and gift items. 

Daniela says that this is the first time she has been part of a communal bank, and that currently she has a general store business that she has been working in for years. 

This loan is for expanding her merchandise through the purchase of food products. She will buy these products at street markets in La Paz, and later sell them at her stand. This form of work will allow her to support her family, as she is not married and has two children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the health clinic.

loans.use: To buy food products to sell.

loans.name: Sergio Victor

texts.es:
Sergio vive en la ciudad de Camaná, ciudad que se caracteriza por su agricultura, en especial por el cultivo del Arroz, el cual es muy conocido a nivel internacional, así como también se le conoce por sus hermosas playas y la generosidad de sus pobladores. Sergio es un hombre muy trabajador y entusiasta pero en sus tiempos libres le gusta jugar futbol con sus amigos así como también disfruta de comer un riquísimo “pescado Frito” ya que es su plato favorito. 

Con mucho trabajo Sergio tiene su negocio de carpintería, se dedica a su trabajo alrededor de 10 horas al día según el tipo de trabajo que sus clientes le pidan, el cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy amable con los clientes por ello el cree que le va bien en su negocio.

Sergio está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias al apoyo que le han brindado el podrá hacer un piso de concreto en su vivienda ya que actualmente solo es de tierra, así podrá tener una mejor calidad de vida y seguir luchando para poder cumplir su gran sueño:”Ser un gran microempresario”
texts.en:
Sergio lives in Camaná, a city characterized by its agriculture, especially the production of its rice, which is internationally known. The city is also well known for its beautiful beaches and the generosity of its people. Sergio is a very enthusiastic and hard-working man who also enjoys playing soccer with his friends in his free time. His favorite dish is the delicious, “pescado frito,” or fried fish.

Through great effort, Sergio has built his own carpentry business, and works about 10 hours per day fulfilling the work orders of his clients. He believes that his business is going so well because he is very kind to his clients.

Sergio is very grateful to Kiva lenders for their support, as it will allow him to put in a concrete floor in his home to replace the dirt floor currently there. This new floor will allow him to improve his quality of life and continue working towards his dream of becoming a great small businessman.

loans.use: to put in a concrete floor.

loans.name: Cordillera Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “CORDILLERA” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Santiago II.  Está compuesta por once integrantes y cuentan con una mesa directiva a la cabeza de la misma se encuentra  la señora Mercedez. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: lavado de autos, venta de antenas, venta de medias y ropa de niños, confección de calzados, venta de refrescos, venta de ropa interior, venta de bisutería, cristalería, venta de cerveza.

La señora Mercedez, indica que forma parte de una asociación comunal por primera vez y que en la actualidad ella cuenta con un negocio de lavado de autos, que viene trabajando hace años, aprendiendo el mismo de sus vecinos. El crédito de este ciclo es para ampliación de su negocio (compra de máquina de lavado de autos) este producto los comprará de las empresas distribuidoras y posteriormente lo instalará en su espacio de trabajo. Esta forma de trabajo le permite apoyar a su familia pues ella no es casada y tiene cuatro hijos.

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones del área de salud y de crédito.
texts.en:
The “Cordillera” communal bank will start its first cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Santiago II Focal Center.  It has 11 members and a governing board headed by Mercedez.  The members of this communal bank carry out a variety of businesses among which we have: car washing, antenna sales, stockings and children’s clothes sales, shoe making, soft-drink sales, underwear sales, costume jewelry sales, glassware and beer sales.

Mercedez indicates that she’s participating in a communal bank for the first time and she currently has a car washing service that she’s had for several years having learned it from her neighbors.  The loan this cycle is to expand the business.  

She will buy a car washing machine from distributors and then will install it in her workplace.  This way of working allows her to support her family for she’s unmarried and has four children.  When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answer that she likes training in health and credit.

loans.use: to buy car washing machine.

loans.name: Reyna Isabel

texts.es:
Reyna Isabel tiene 37 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene 6 hijos  entre 18 y 5 años de edad de los cuales solo los tres menores estudian, y vive en el progreso Yoro.
Reyna se dedica a un negocio donde la actividad que realiza es la elaboración de tabletas de todo sabor. (Elaborados con dulce, azúcar, leche, coco y otros ingredientes). Y las vende en bandejas empacadas ofreciendo a sus clientes producto de calidad que vende en un local ubicado en su misma casa o también de manera ambulante.  Ella inicio este negocio hace 8 años en el cual manifiesta ha ido creciendo poco a poco. Logrando sacar los ingresos que le han permitido salir con su familia adelante. Ella le dedica todo el día a su actividad. 
En la actualidad solicita un préstamo con ODEF de 15,000 lempiras y lo quiere para comprar una maquina (molino) para moler coco y otra parte para mejorar el local donde hace sus ventas. 
Su meta es poder construir un punto de venta donde sus productos puedan ser mejor vendidos y le genere el capital para poder terminar de construir su casa.
texts.en:
Reyna Isabel, 37, is a single mother; she has six children whose ages range between 18 and 5 years.  The three youngest ones attend school and she lives in El Progreso, Yoro.

Reyna has a business where she makes tablets in assorted flavors. (They are made with sugar, milk, coconut and other ingredients).  She sells them  packed in trays offering her customers a quality product that she sells from a home-based locale or also in an ambulatory fashion.  She started the business 8 years ago and states that it’s been gradually growing.  She manages to earn income from it that’s allowed her to get ahead with her family.  She spends all day in her activity.

She is currently asking ODEF for a 15,000 lempira loan to buy a machine (mill) to grind the coconut and also to use part of it to do some improvements to the locale where she does her sales.  Her goal is to be able to build a sales point where her products can be better sold and that generates capital to finish building her house.

loans.use: to buy a machine to grind the coconut and to make improvements to her locale.

loans.name: Jhason Victor

texts.es:
Jhason es un joven muy entusiasta y trabajador, vive en la ciudad Camaná, ciudad que se caracteriza por su agricultura, en especial por el cultivo del Arroz, el cual es muy conocido a nivel internacional, así como también se le conoce por sus hermosas playas y la generosidad de sus pobladores. En su tiempo libre disfruta de salir a correr ya que siempre es bueno hacer un poco de ejercicio, asimismo como buen peruano le gusta mucho la comida típica de nuestro país, por ello uno de sus platos favoritos es el riquísimo “Lomo Saltado”.

Con mucho esfuerzo logro estudiar un curso de reparación y mantenimiento de computadoras y gracias a ello pudo tener su negocio reparación y mantenimiento de computadoras, instalación de antivirus e internet, es muy trabajador, le dedica a su negocio alrededor de 10 horas al día, el cree que le va bien en su negocio porque ofrece un buen trato a sus clientes y sobre todo porque es muy responsable y cumplido con ellos.

Jhason está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar herramientas como alicates, desarmadores, entre otros para poder realizar mejor su trabajo y brindar un mejor servicios, así seguirá trabajando para cumplir su gran sueño:” Estudiar la Carrera de Ingeniería de Sistemas”.
texts.en:
Jhason is a very enthusiastic and hardworking young man who lives in the city of Camaná, a city characterized by its agriculture, especially the production of its rice, which is internationally known. The city is also well known for its beautiful beaches and the generosity of its people. In his free time, he likes to go running, since it is always healthy to get exercise. Like a good Peruvian, he enjoys the typical foods of his country, and one of his favorites dishes is the delicious, “Lomo Saltado,” or hind steak.

Through great effort, Jhason was able to take a course in computer maintenance and repair. This course has enabled him to open a business in computer maintenance and installation of antivirus and internet software. He is very hardworking, and works about 10 hours per day. He believes that his business is going so well because he offers good deals to his clients, and is very responsible and courteous with them.

Jhason is very grateful to Kiva lenders for their support, as it will allow him to purchase additional tools for his business, including pliers, screwdrivers and other implements. These tools will allow him to do his job more effectively and provide better services for his clients, enabling him to continue working towards his dream of studying a career in system engineering.

loans.use: to purchase tools (pliers, screwdrivers, etc).

loans.name: Saltanat

texts.ru: Салтанат 44 года, воспитывает двух детей.   В 2003 году, в поисках источника дохода для своей семьи,  Салтанат начала свой бизнес в торговле продуктами питания. Благодаря настойчивости  и упорному труду,  Салтанат сумела развить свой бизнес  с ежемесячным доходом  в 10,000 сом (KGS). На сегодняшний день ассортимент товаров не представлен в изобилии, и по этой причине Салтанат  обратилась  в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на расширение  ассортимента.  Доходы от кредита Салтанат  планирует частично вложить в закуп стройматериалов для постройки дома, и часть – в развитие бизнеса.
texts.en: Saltanat is 44 years old and raising two children.  In search of a source of income for her family, she started her own business in selling food products in 2003.  Thanks to to her persistence and hard work, Saltanat was able to grow her business to have a monthly income of 10,000 som (KGS).  Today, her product offering is still limited, and this is why she requested a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to expand her product assortment.  Saltanat plans to invest the earnings from the loan partially into a purchase of construction materials to build a house and partially into developing her business.

loans.use: to broaden an assortment of goods

loans.name: Arturo

texts.es:
Arturo tiene 53 años de edad,  vive en unión libre, y tiene 5 hijos de 32, 31, 27, 20, 22, y todos son independientes y trabajan, él vive con su compañera de hogar y un hijo en el Municipio de Cofradía, Cortes.
Don Arturo debido  a su situación por falta de una oportunidad de trabajo. Decidió establecer por sus propios medios y con capital que obtuvo en la liquidación de su trabajo anterior. Estableció hace 20 años un negocio de venta de relojes de mano y venta de lentes de toda clase. Su puesto lo tiene en un lugar del centro de la comunidad donde hay afluencia de personas y por lo tanto le va bien en sus ventas.
El solicito su primer financiamiento con ODEF de 5,500 lempiras para comprar lentes de sol aprovechando la temporada del verano y aumentar su inventario para seguir trabajando. 
Su meta es ser cliente a largo plazo en ODEF para seguir obteniendo la oportunidad de financiamientos que le ayuden a seguir surtiendo su negocio.
texts.en:
Arturo, 53, has a spouse and five children who are 32, 31, 27, 20 and 22 years old; they are all independent and work.  He lives with his spouse and one son in the town of Cofradía, Cortes.

Because of Arturo’s situation lacking employment opportunities, he decided to use his own means and capital he got from his severance pay in his previous job to start a business twenty years ago selling wristwatches and sunglasses of all types.  His stand is in a spot in the center of the community where there are many passersby so he does very well with his sales.

He requested his first loan from ODEF in the amount of 5,500 lempiras to buy sunglasses taking advantage of the summer season and increase inventory to in order to stay in business.  His goal is to be a long-term client of ODEF to continue receiving financing opportunities that will help him continue to stock his business.

loans.use: to buy sunglasses.

loans.name: Marli Araceli

texts.es:
Marli tiene 39 años de edad, es casada con 5 hijos, vive en una aldea de Choloma, Cortes.
La señora Marli  trabajaba  como operaria en una maquiladora allí obtuvo mucha experiencia y al no tener empleo decidió establecer en su casa su propio negocio donde ahora confecciona  y vende cortinas, sabanas y forros de baño. Le dedica 8 horas diarias a su negocio.
Solicita un préstamo a ODEF para comprar materiales para la confección de cortinas, sabanas y forros de baños, como ser telas, hilos, agujas y otros. Del cual obtendrá los ingresos del hogar. Ella tiene planeado expandirse a otras ciudades para aumentar las ventas y generar mas ingresos para el hogar.
texts.en:
Marli, 39, is married and has five children; she lives in a village in Choloma, Cortes.  Marli used to be employed at an assembly plant and she acquired quite a bit of experience.  When she was unemployed, she decided to set up a business at home where she now makes and sells curtains, sheets and toilet seat covers.  She spends 8 hours daily at her business.

She is asking ODEF for a loan to buy sewing supplies to make curtains, sheets and toilet seat covers like fabric, thread, needles and others.  She will earn household income from them.  She plans to expand into other cities to increase sales and generate more household income.

loans.use: to buy sewing supplies.

loans.name: Lidien

texts.es: Lidien de 43 años, vive en una vivienda familiar, el municipio de Malambo con sus esposa y dos hijos que tienen  4 y 7 años de edad; estudió Mecánica en el Servicio Nacional de aprendizaje “SENA” y empezó a trabajar durante 5 años en empresas  como técnico en una buena temporada, pero su espíritu emprendedor lo llevó a aventurarse, hace 6 años y emprender su propio  negocio , un taller donde ofrece los servicios de reparación de motocicletas y vende repuestos para este mismo vehículo;  accediendo a dinero de crédito de particulares a un alto costo y también acudiendo a tarjetas de créditos pudo impulsar su negocio y capitalizarse un poco. En su trabajo ha persistido para salir adelante y generar ingresos para lograr aumentar el bienestar de su familia, por eso tiene muchos sueños con su negocio, como el de capitalizarse aun mas y adquirir un lote para construir un local con las especificaciones que requiere y su gran desafío es tener su vivienda propia. Cuando se enteró de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, lo hizo a través de su vecina, pero solo hasta cuando llegó la unidad móvil a su barrio, inscribiendo directamente, decidió de manera práctica vincularse. Hoy está recibiendo su primer financiamiento de esta organización y es justamente un credikiva, con el cual comprará empaquetaduras,  balineras, rodamiento y repuestos en general , pues necesita tener un inventario que le permita fortalecer su demanda y ofrecer productos y servicios muy solicitados, con este crédito logrará vencer el desafío de tener un capital de trabajo disponible, para comprar directamente y con los requerimientos de su mercado y esto es justamente el éxito de su inversión.
texts.en:
Lidien, 43, lives in the family home in Malambo with his wife and two children, who are four and seven.  He studied mechanics at the "SENA" National Service apprentice program and then worked for five years as a technician, but his enterprising spirit lead him to strike out on his own six years ago and start his own business, a workshop where he offers motorcycle repair services and sells spare motorcycle parts.  Agreeing to provide credit to individuals at a high cost and also accepting credit cards could energize his business and help finance it a bit.  He has persisted in his work so as to get ahead and so as to generate income to support his family. He has lots of dreams for his business, such as financing it more adequately and acquiring a lot on which to build a workshop to the specifications he requires.  His big goal is to have his own house.  

When he joined the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, he did so through his neighbor, but only when a mobile unit came to his neighborhood did he enrol directly.  Today, he is receiving his first loan from this organization, which he will use to buy gaskets, ball bearings, and other spare parts, as he needs to have an inventory that will allow him to strengthen demand and to offer much needed products and services.  This credit will help him meet the challenge of having working capital available so that he can buy directly from suppliers and according to the needs of his market and thereby make a success of his investment.

loans.use: to buy gaskets, ball bearings, and other spare parts.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy furniture, equipment and raw materials to increase production.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Luz Vivinda

texts.es: Luz de 32 años de edad y tienen 2 hijos en las edades de 9 y 4 años. Como comerciante inició hace 12 años en un municipio ubicado a 30 minutos de la ciudad de Barranquilla; apoyada por su suegra se trasladó a esta ciudad  y ha logrado hacer un pequeño capital con el que trabaja y  junto a su esposo, logran el sustento de sus hijos. Su actual negocio consiste en la venta de productos de aseo, aunque también ha adicionado gran variedad de mercancías y artículos de belleza, los cuales son  promocionados mediante guías especializadas o catálogos. Como es una mujer trabajadora también genera ingresos adicionales con la venta de comida especialmente de pescado. Su empeño de crecimiento, la llevan a decidir acceder a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo,  con el cual comprará productos de aseo, como detergentes, desinfectantes, traperos, escobas, inversión que supone un éxito, porque está fundamentada en pedidos de sus clientes y así rotará mas rápidamente sus inventarios. Su meta mas adelante,  es tener un local comercial para vender los productos de aseo al por mayor y continuar vendiendo al detal,  persona a persona como hasta ahora lo hace.
texts.en: Luz, 32, has two children, who are four and nine.  She started working as a merchant 12 years ago in a town located 30 minutes from Barranquilla; with the assistance of her mother in law, she moved to this city and built up a little money with which to work and, together with her husband, to support their children.  Her current business consists of selling cleaning products, although she has also added a great variety of merchandise and beauty products, which she promotes through specialized guides and catalogs.  As she is a hardworking women, she also generates additional income by selling food, especially fish.  Her desire to expand has led her to seek a Kiva loan, her first financing with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  She will use the money to buy cleaning products, such as detergents, disinfectants, washcloths, and brushes, and she expects the investment to be a success, since it is based on orders from her clients and will allow her to rotate her inventory more rapidly.  Her dream to get ahead is to have a shop selling cleaning products by wholesale, as well as selling them retail, person to person, as she has done up to now.

loans.use: to buy cleaning products, such as detergents, disinfectants, washcloths, brushes, etc.

loans.name: Gumercinda Isabel

texts.es: Gumercinda vive con su hija de 22 años, en el municipio de Soledad  y se dedica a la elaboración la venta de tapetes y limpiones industriales, que fabrica con retazos de telas, adquiridas  en las confecciones del centro de la ciudad de Barranquilla a 20 minutos de su municipio; en su casa tiene todo el proceso que realiza ella sola y los arma y  vende al detalle principalmente en locales minoristas, que son su principal mercado.  Con su negocio le ha ido muy bien, pero su capital de trabajo no es suficiente para expandirse en su mercado,  incrementar sus ventas y responder al gran desafío de su competencia, que es su mayor desafío y es lo que Gumercinada quiere lograr. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace ala Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará tela en retazos en mayor volumen, con ello ganará descuentos que trasladará muy seguramente al costo de la operación y aumentará la oferta y su número de clientes, allí es justamente donde se justifica el éxito de su inversión.
texts.en:
Gumercinda lives with her 22 year old daughter in the town of Soledad; she makes and sells mats and industrial cleaning rags that she makes out of fabric remnants that she buys from clothing manufacturers in downtown Barranquilla 20 minutes away from her town. 

She has the entire process installed at home and she works it alone.  She assembles them and sells them mainly to local retailers who are her main market.  She’s done very well with her business but her working capital is insufficient to expand in her market, increase sales and respond to her great challenge which is competition; this is what Gumercinda wants to accomplish and the reason behind her Kiva loan request, her first financing from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo that she’ll use to buy fabric remnants in larger amounts.  She will thus qualify for volume discounts which she will most assuredly pass on to operational costs and will increase supply and number of customers which is precisely where she justifies her investment’s success.

loans.use: to buy fabric remnants.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es: Mercedes de 66 años de edad, vive con su esposo y tienen 2 hijos en las edades de 29 y 30 años. Ella es comerciante desde el año 2004, cuando vendía mercancía variada, la cual distribuía a crédito entre amigos y vecinos de su propio barrio. Con el correr del tiempo ahorró para comprar una vitrina, ordenar y exhibir sus productos y poco a poco su negocio se fue convirtiendo en una miscelánea que creció, como hasta hoy, en la que ofrece un diverso surtido de ropa, calzado y variedades, en un punto comercial en su propia casa. Su sueño es continuar consolidándolo para que su hija lo herede y lo perfeccione. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará una vitrina,  para modernizar su negocio y darle una mejor presentación, así como también invertirá en mercancía para surtirla y ofrecer nuevas mercancías; así su experiencia y su potencialidad en el mercado, hacen de esta inversión todo un éxito.
texts.en:
Mercedes, 66, lives with her husband and they have two children who are 29 and 30 years old.  She’s been a merchant since 2004 when she started selling assorted merchandise on credit among her friends and neighbors in her own neighborhood.  As time went by she saved up to buy a display case to arrange and display her wares and gradually her business became a general store that grew into what it is today.  She sells a wide selection of clothes, footwear and miscellany in a sales point in her own house.  Her dream is to continue consolidating so that her daughter can inherit it and perfect it.

She is currently requesting a Kiva loan, her first financing with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo that she’ll use to buy a display case to modernize her business and give it a better appearance; she will also buy merchandise to stock it and offer new items.  Her experience and market potential insure this investment’s success.

loans.use: to buy merchandise and a display case.

loans.name: Anarkul

texts.ru:
Анаркуль родилась в селе Ак Торкой (Чуйская область, Кыргызстан). Замужем, воспитывает троих детей. 
Анаркуль родилась в 1955 году, в простой многодетной семье: отец-фельдшер, мать-швея. Будучи старшей в семье, она с детства помогала родителям по хозяйству, нянчила шестерых братьев и сестер. Анаркуль закончила Орловскую среднюю школу в родном селе и пошла по стопам отца,поступив после школы в медицинский колледж в г.Бишкек.  В 1975 году, закончив медицинский колледж,она устроилась медсестрой в Сокулукскую районную больницу. В этом же году Анаркуль вышла замуж и родила дочь и сына. В 1978 году Анаркуль с мужем переехали в с.Алексеевка (Жайылский район, Чуйская область), где купили земельный участок. Анаркуль устроилась фельдшером в Алексеевский фельдшерско-амбулаторный пункт, супруг устроился в Жайылскую районную прокуратуру ведущим специалистом. В 1980 году Анаркуль устроилась преподавателем в Карабалтинский медицинский колледж и в 1986 году родила младшую дочь. В годы перестройки Анаркуль с мужем начали строить большой дом. Так как деньги обесценились, зарплаты не хватало даже на нормальное питание, из-за этого Анаркуль пришлось выходить на рынок, где она перепродавала фрукты и овощи. Благодаря упорному  труду, настойчивости и взаимной поддержке, Анаркуль с мужем построили хороший большой дом, вырастили и выучили детей. В 2002 году Анаркуль получила звание «Отличника здравоохранения».  
В данное время Анаркуль работает преподавателем в Карабалтинском медицинском колледже, кроме этого она занимается животноводством. Начав этот бизнес с суммы в 30,0000 сом, Анаркуль смогла развить хозяйство с ежемесячной прибылью в сумме 15,000 сом. На данный момент, в хозяйстве есть одна телка и десять овец. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Анаркуль обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 135,000 сом (KGS) на покупку пяти голов бычков.  Доходы от кредита Анаркуль планирует вкладывать в дальнейшее развитие бизнеса.
texts.en:
Anarkul was born in the Ak Torkoi village (Chuyskaya region, Kyrgyzstan).  She is married and raising three children.  Anarkul was born in 1955 into a simple family with many children.  Her father was a paramedic, and mother was a seamstress.  Being the oldest in the family, Anarkul helped her parents with the household since childhood and took care of her six brothers and sisters.  She graduated from the Orlovskaya secondary school in her native village and followed her father's footsteps by going to a medical college in Bishkek after school.  In 1975, after finishing college, she got a job as a nurse at the Sokulukskaya district hospital.  This same year, Anarkul got married and gave birth to a daughter and son.  In 1978, Anarkul and her husband moved to the Alekseevka village (Jayl district, Chuyskaya region), where they bought a plot of land.  Anarkul got a job as a paramedic at the Alekseevka paramedic-ambulatory site, and her husband got a job as a leading specialist at the Jayl district prosecutor's office.  In 1980, Anarkul got a job as a teacher at the Karabalta medical college, and gave birth to her youngest daughter in 1986.  During the years of perestroika, Anarkul and her husband started to build a large house.  Because the money lost its value, their salaries were not enough to cover even regular food.  This is why Anarkul had to go a market, where she resold fruits and vegetables.  Thanks to their hard work, persistence and mutual support, Anarkul and her husband built a good, large house, raised and educated their children.  In 2002, Anarkul received a title of "Excellent Healthcare Professional."

Currently, Anarkul works as a teacher at the Karablta medical college and is also involved in animal husbandry.  Having started this business with an amount of 30,000 som, Anarkul was able to grow her business to have a monthly profit of 15,000 som.  At the present time, her business has one heifer and ten sheep.  In order to further develop her business, Anarkul requested a loan in the amount of 135,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to buy five heads of bulls.  She plans to invest the earnings from the loan into a further development of her business.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Yenis

texts.es: Yenis Invirtió su credikiva anterior en bisutería, cacharrería y juguetería, productos con los que le fue muy bien,  pues aprovechó la temporada precisa para hacer su gran venta. En la actualidad planea recibir un nuevo credikiva, con el cual comprará útiles escolares, cosméticos, bisutería, y papelería en general. Tendrá éxito su inversión, porque las mercancías que comprará son justamente las que necesita para cubrir la demanda de su clientela. Su mensaje a los financiadores de Kiva es el siguiente: “Muchas gracias, a todas las personas que contribuyen con su dinero para que todas las personas que lo necesiten se vean beneficiadas y puedan surgir en sus vidas.”
texts.en:
Yenis used her previous Kiva loan to buy costume jewelry, low-cost novelty items and toys, products she did very well with because she took advantage of the right season to make her big sales.  She currently plans to get a new Kiva loan to buy school supplies, cosmetics, costume jewelry and stationery items in general.  Her investment will be successful because the merchandise she’ll buy is precisely what she needs to meet customer demand.  

Her message to Kiva lenders is the following:  “Many thanks to all the people who contribute their money so that people who need it will be benefitted and can surge forward in their lives.”

loans.use: to buy school supplies, cosmetics, costume jewelry and stationery items.

loans.name: Ludis Isabel

texts.es: Ludis de 52 años de edad vive en el municipio de Malambo a 20 minutos de la ciudad de Barranquilla con su cónyuge y tiene 4 hijos en las edades de 15 a 23 años. Ella estudió en una escuela técnica confección hace 30 años y con ello empezó a trabajar sobre medidas, posteriormente y de manera simultanea trabajó en empresas de la Zona franca de Barranquilla, hasta que se independizó hace 7 años, emprendiendo su taller en su propia casa, donde construyó  una clientela doméstica, conformada por su familia y sus vecinos, la cual poco a poco fue creciendo y extendiéndose. Ella cuenta en su infraestructura tiene 3 máquinas y alquila  una más,  para responder a su producción usual y esta es su necesidad. Por eso cuando una microempresaria, que tiene 17 años de estar vinculada a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, le habló de esta organización no lo dudó y por eso hoy está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a esta empresa, con la cual comprará una máquina plana y una fileteadora, ya que básicamente su línea es maquilarle a empresas mas grandes y requiere mayor calidad en la prenda, para ofrecer un mejor producto al mercado y potencializar el incremento de sus clientes. Su éxito en la inversión radica en el conocimiento y en la experiencia que tiene en el mercado y en su objetivo de avanzar en su negocio con el fin de sacar adelante a sus hijos en los estudios.
texts.en:
Ludis, 52, lives in the town of Malambo 20 minutes from the city of Barranquilla with her spouse; she has four children whose ages range from 15 to 23 years.  She studied dressmaking at a technical school thirty years ago and started making clothes to order.  Later on and simultaneously she worked in firms in Barranquilla’s Free Zone until she became independent seven years ago setting up her own workshop at home where she established a domestic clientele composed of her family and neighbors which has gradually grown and expanded.

Her infrastructure consists of three machines that she owns and another one she leases that she needs to meet current production demand.
