When a micro businesswoman who has been associated with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo for 17 years spoke to her about this organization she had no doubts about it and today she’s applying for a Kiva loan, her first financing from this firm, that she’ll use to buy straight stitch and overlock sewing machines since basically her line of work is to assemble for larger firms so the quality of her articles of clothing must be higher to offer a better product to the market and potentially increase her clientele.  Her investment’s success resides in her knowledge and the experience she has in the market and in her goal to get ahead with her business in order to provide schooling for her children.

loans.use: to buy straight stitch and overlock sewing machines.

loans.name: Zaripakhon

texts.ru: Зарипахон 52 года, имеет 3 детей. В качестве источника дохода для семьи, Зарипахон занимается животноводством.  Начатое в 2000 году с 5,000 сом (KGS)  хозяйство  на сегодня приносит около 7,000 сом (KGS) в месяц от продажи молока и молочных продуктов. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Зарипахон обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота. Доходы Зарипахон планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение поголовья скота.
texts.en: Zaripakhon is 52 years old and has three children.  She is involved in animal husbandry to provide a source of income for her family.  The business, started in 2000 with 5,000 som (KGS), today yields about 7,000 som (KGS) per month from sales of milk and milk products.  In order to further develop her business, Zaripakhon requested a loan in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to buy livestock.  She plans to invest the earnings into a further increase of livestock headcount.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Dennis Mauricio

texts.es:
Dennis Mauricio, de 28 años de edad, tiene siete años de casado con su esposa con quien tienen dos hijas de 7 y 3 años de edad, vive en una Aldea de Tela, Atlántida.
Dennis, hace 3 años que estableció su propio negocio con fondos propios, ya que anteriormente trabajaba en una empresa privada y al quedar sin empleo,  decidió por este negocio, que además le dedicara más tiempo a su familia. En el negocio vende productos alimenticios, abarrotes y otros, como ser granos básicos, lácteos, carnes, verduras, frutas, pastas, útiles escolares, etc. 
Es su primer préstamo que solicita, el cual lo va invertir en varios productos para surtir el negocio y mantener en existencia para atender mejor al cliente, algunos de los productos que necesita son, verduras, frutas, utensilios plásticos, útiles escolares.etc.
Su meta es hacer crecer el negocio, agregando productos nuevos para surtir y mantener la clientela, así lograra obtener los ingresos para cubrir la educación de sus hijas.
texts.en:
Dennis Mauricio is 28 years old and married. He and his wife have two daughters, ages 7 and 3. They live in the neighborhood of Tela, Atlántida.

Three years ago, Dennis established his business using his own funds. He previous worked at a private company. When he lost his job, he decided to go into business. This has also allowed him to spend more time with his family. In his business, he sells food products, groceries, and other items such as basic grains, dairy products, meats, vegetables, fruits, pasta, school supplies, and other items.

This is the first loan he is requesting. Dennis will invest in various products to restock his business so that he can stay in operation and provide better service to his customers. Some of the products that he needs include vegetables, fruits, plastic utensils, school supplies, and other items. His goals include growing his business, acquiring new products for his inventory, and maintaining his customer base. This will generate income to cover the educational expenses for his daughters.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, fruits, plastic utensils, school supplies, and other products.

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.es: Benjamín fabrica calzado en las líneas femeninas e infantiles y los distribuye directamente en pequeños negocios,  misceláneas ubicados muy cerca a su taller, individualmente a quien le solicite y directamente en la puerta de un escenario deportivo en la ciudad, con su actividad ha logrado el sostenimiento de su hogar conformado por su cónyuge y su pequeña hija de 1 año de edad. Benjamín tiene planea de crecimiento, pero debe organizarse mejor, aumentar su capital de trabajo, para dar respuesta oportuna a su potenciales clientes y  tecnificar un poco, este es justamente su gran desafío. En la actualidad vende de contado y a crédito y necesita comprar una máquina industrial y materiales de producción; esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo; su éxito en esta inversión  radica en que obtendrá mejoramiento de los tiempos productivos, aumento de la calidad del  producto y en lograr descuentos por compras de contado y en mayor volumen.  Su sueño es generar empleos y aumentar cada día mas sus ingresos para aumentar el bienestar de su familia y potencializar el éxito futuro de su hija
texts.en:
Benjamín manufactures women’s and children’s shoes that he sells directly to small businesses and general stores located near his workshop, to individuals who place orders and directly at the entrance to a sporting venue in the city.  With his activity he’s managed to support his home consisting of his wife and one year old daughter.

Benjamín plans to grow but must organize himself better, increasing working capital to respond in a timely fashion to his potential customers and to become a little more up to date technologically; this is precisely his great challenge.

He currently sells both in cash and on credit and needs to buy an industrial sewing machine and production raw materials.  This is the reason he’s calling on a Kiva loan, his first financing from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  

This investment’s success resides in that he will attain improvements in productive time, increase quality of products and will attain discounts for paying cash and for volume purchases.  His dream is to create jobs and increase income daily to increase his family’s wellbeing and make his daughter’s future success a reality.

loans.use: to buy an industrial sewing machine and raw materials.

loans.name: Uulkan

texts.ru:
Уулкан 57 лет, замужем, имеет двоих детей.  Уулкан на протяжении 15 лет занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы в 4,000 сом (KGS).  Благодаря упорному труду Уулкан в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний  день имеется  2 коровы,  также семья Уулкан ежегодно обрабатывает  0,06 га земли, где выращивает хлопок. 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Уулкан обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 65,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку скота и семян для засева.  Доходы от кредита Уулкан планирует вложить в дальнейшее расширение деятельности.
texts.en: Uulkan is 57 years old, married and has two children.  She has been involved in animal husbandry for 15 years, after starting this business with an amount of 4,000 som (KGS).  Thanks to Uulkan's hard work, today her business contains two cows.  Uulkan's family also annually works on 0.06 hectares of land, where they grow cotton. In order to further develop her business, Uulkan requested a loan in the amount of 65,000 som (KGS) to buy livestock and seeds for sowing.  She plans to invest the earnings from the loan into a further development of her business.

loans.use: to purchase livestock and seeds

loans.name: Damas Del Futuro  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Damas del Futuro está formado por 14 socias, quienes laboran diariamente en diferentes actividades económicas las que les permiten solventar los gastos de sus hogares y sacar adelante a sus familias, se caracterizan por ser personas amables y gentiles. Viven en diferentes lugares de la ciudad de Cuenca, ciudad que es la tercera ciudad más importante del país y desde Diciembre de 1999 es Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad, esta ciudad tiene una belleza natural y cultura la cual enamora a sus visitantes, su gastronomía es muy variada, su gente aún conservan la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Rebeca, tiene 32 años, es soltera y ha concebido 2 hijos de 9 y 2 años de edad, su primer hijo está estudiando en una escuelita de la ciudad. No tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.
 
Doña Rebeca labora como empleada privada en una lavadora de vehículos desde hace 3 años, trabaja de lunes a sábados desde las 8 de la mañana hasta  las 6 de la tarde. Los domingos se dedica a la venta de ropa negocio en el que se encuentra desde muy joven.

Es socia del banco comunal hace 5 años y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir  en la compra de ropa para crecer más en el negocio.
 
Su sueño es tener su casa propia.

Los dos niños de la foto son hijos de una de las socias.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank "Damas del Futuro" (Women of the Future) consists of 14 members who work every day in different activities in order to pay for their household expenses and help their families get ahead. They are known for being friendly and gentle individuals. All of them live in different places around the city of Cuenca. Cuenca is the third largest city in the country and was recognized as a World Heritage Site in December 1999. This city is known for its natural beauty and its culture, since it is enamored by visitors. There are various types of cuisine that are served and the people have preserved their culture and traditions.

One of the members of this group is Sra. Rebeca. She is 32 years old, single, and has two children (ages 9 and 2). Her oldest child attends an elementary school in the city. She does not own a home, so she lives in a rental property.

Doña Rebeca has been employed at a car wash for three years. She works Monday through Saturday from 8am to 6pm. On Sundays she sells clothing. She has been in this business since she was a young woman.

Rebeca has been a member of her Communal Bank for five years. Her new loan will be invested in the purchase of clothing so that she can grow her business even more. Her dream is to have a house of her own.

The two children who appear in the photo belong to one of the members.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Anvar

texts.ru: Anvar uje jivet v Baku regione vmeste so svoim bratom. On ne jenat i ne imeyet detey. Anvar 24 qoda. On ranshe pradoval rasteniya no seychas uje  qod kak on nachal zanimatsya transpartirovkoy. Seychas on transportiruyet razniye pisheviye produkti (naprimer: kak vi videte na fotografii eto kuricci). Eto uje vtoraya ssuda,  Anvar ochen on blagodaren vsem lenderam kto pomog yemu sobrat ssudu, takje on blagodarek organizacii Kiva. Anvar seychas nujdayetsya v 1600 AZN chtobi kupit nujniye zapchasti chtobi pochinit svoyu mashinu,tak kak on ne mojet seychas rabotat i poluchat svoi doxodi.
texts.en: Anvar already lives in the Baku region with his brother.  He is not married and has no children.  Anvar is 24 years old.  He previously sold plants, but has since been involved in transportation for a year.  Currently, he transports various food products (for example, as you can see on the photograph, these are chickens).  This is his second loan.  Anvar is very grateful to all the lenders, who helped him with the loan, and he is also grateful to the Kiva organization.  Anvar currently needs 1600 AZN to buy necessary spare parts in order to repair his vehicle because he is unable to work and earn money now.

loans.use: to buy spare parts

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy wood, cutting tools, and nails, etc.

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es:
Luis es un joven de 25 años el cual vive en la ciudad de chincha, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido, playas hermosas y sobre todo porque sus pobladores tienen una buena sazón para la preparación de platillos, por ello uno de sus paltos favoritos es el riquísimo “Arroz con pato” por ello su pasatiempo favorito es cocinar y tambien le gusta escuchar musicaescuchar música, actualmente se encuentra estudiando gastronomía.

Con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación Luis logro tener su negocio de venta de ropa para bebes, trabaja alrededor de10 horas diarias y atiende alrededor de 25 clientes en el día, le gusta mucho su negocio porque se siente una alegría especial cuando los padres van a comprar ropa para sus bebes es tan tierno ver como se aprecia esa alegría y esa emoción y como se ven los bebes una vez que usan sus productos, por ello el cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es amable y sobre todo tiene paciencia con los clientes, además que ofrece productos de calidad.

Luis está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a su ayuda el podrá comprar mercadería de estación es decir para el invierno y poder tener más variedad de productos, lo que le permitirá que los clientes se sientas satisfechos y que sus ingresos mejoren para seguir luchando cada día y lograr su gran sueño:” Crecer en su negocio y poder ofrecer otros tipos de productos”.
texts.en:
Luis is a 25 year old young man who lives in the city of Chincha.  The city is known for having a warm climate and beautiful beaches.  It is mostly known because the population has a talent for good seasoning when preparing dishes.  One of his favorite dishes is the delicious “Arroz con pato” (rice with duck).  Therefore, his favorite pastime is cooking.  He also likes to listen to music.  He is currently studying gastronomy.

With a lot of effort and dedication Luis managed to have his own business selling baby clothes.  He works around ten hours a day, and he tends to about 25 customers a day.  He really likes his business because he feels a special joy when parents come to buy clothes for their babies.  It is so tender to see how this joy and this emotion is valued and how the babies look once they use his products.  He believes that his business is going well for him because he is kind, and, above all, he has patience with the customers.  He also offers quality products.

Luis is very grateful to the Kiva lenders.  Thanks to your help he will be able to buy seasonal merchandise, which is to say baby clothes for the winter.  He will have a greater variety of products, which will satisfy his customers.  His income will improve in order to continue his daily struggle to achieve his big dream:  To grow in his business and to be able to offer other types of products.

loans.use: to buy baby clothes for winter.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is 52 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. Rosemarie has a beauty salon that provides hair cutting and re-bonding. She has had this business for 15 years. She has requested a loan for 10,000 PHP to buy materials needed for the salon.

Rosemarie has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her salon.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en: Lilian is a 25-year-old married woman. She has a child who is four years old and is enrolled in school. Lilian operates a shop which sells second-hand clothes. She's worked in this business for three years and was previously employed as a fruit juice seller. Her primary customers are community members. Lilian's other source of income includes her husband's earning. She explains that her greatest business challenge is seasonality and her highest monthly expense is food. She rents a house that has both electricity and piped water. Lilian will use the loan of Kes 40,000 to purchase bundles of clothes for resale. Lilian aspires to establish another business in the future. She joined Yehu because of the low interest rate.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Lagon Group

texts.fr:
Mme CHANTAL  est la responsable du groupe LAGON. Elle est mariée et mère de 02 enfants. Le plus âgé a 13ans le moins âgé a 04ans. Les 02 vont à l’école et elle a 04 personnes à sa charge.

Mme vend des gâteaux  depuis 09ans. Elle s’approvisionne dans une boutique au secteur 17 en ville. Ses clients sont ses amis et voisins.

Mme veut  s’acheter  01 sac du sucre pour la fabrication de ses gâteaux car elle a déjà la farine de blé et d’huile.

Elle  épargne ses bénéfices  et aide à la scolarisation de ses enfants. Mme ambitionne  agrandir son activité commerciale.
texts.en:
Mrs. CHANTAL is the head of the LAGON group. She is married and the mother of two children aged 4 and 13 who both attend school. She has four dependents.

Mrs. Chantal has been selling cakes for nine years. She buys her merchandise in a shop located in Sector 17, in the city. Her client base consists of friends and neighbors. 

Mrs. Chantal wants to buy one bag of sugar to make the cakes. She already has the necessary wheat flour and oil.  

She saves her profits and provides for her children’s education. Her goal is to expand her business activity.

loans.use: to buy one bag of sugar.

loans.name: Olga Mercedes

texts.es:
Olga mercedes tiene 31 años de edad es soltera no tiene hijos vive con los padres en guaranda provincia de Bolívar.

Es integrante de la Vrc Nuevos Horizontes, la comunidad se encuentra a unos 40 minutos en la comunidad santa Martha perteneciente al Cantón Guaranda.

Olga se dedica  a la agricultura a la siembra de mora además vende leche  y tiene ganado.

Solicita el crédito para poder comprar semillas, insumos, fertilizantes, urea, líquidos para la maleza. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar  los insumos e incrementar la producción de la mora.

Las compras y las ventas lo hace en Guaranda semanalmente.

El sueño es poder comprar una granja. Los desafíos a los que se enfreta es el mal tiempo.En el tiempo libre le gusta descansar y pasar con la familia.
texts.en:
Olga Mercedes, 31, is single and lives with her parents in the guaranda province of Bolívar. 

She’s a member of Vrc Nuevos Horizontes, association found 40 minutes away in the community of Santa Marta, which is part of the region of Guaranda. 

Olga is a farmer, she grows blackberries and sells milk and cattle. 

She’s requesting a loan to buy seeds, supplies, fertilizers, urea and liquid herbicide. With the help of the loan, she’ll be able to buy the supplies she needs and increase the production of blackberries. 

Every week, she buys and sells in Guaranda.

The dream is to buy a farm. An obstacle she faces is bad weather. In her spare time, she likes to relax and spend time with her family.

loans.use: buy seeds, supplies, fertilizers, urea and liquid herbicide.

loans.name: Ma. Purissa

texts.en:
39-year-old Ma. Purissa is a married woman from Trinidad, Bohol. She has three children, ages 13, 7, and 2.

Ma. Purissa has been a seaweed farmer for 10 years. She earns about 3000 PHP per month with her business. Ma. Purissa's husband works as a fisherman. She does her best to support her husband in providing for their needs and sending their children to school.

Ma. Purissa is requesting a loan of 7000 PHP to purchase seaweed seedlings and straws. She hopes to earn better and pay for her children's school expenses.

loans.use: to purchase seaweed seedlings and straws.

loans.name: Furry

texts.en:
Furry is a married man. He has three children between the ages of 2 and 9, and two of them are enrolled in school. His wife's name is Agnes and she works as a shopkeeper. 

Furry operates a retail shop and sells his goods from home. He has worked in this business for three years and was previously employed as a charcoal seller. His primary customers are neighbors and passersby. Furry's other source of income is his wife's earnings. He describes his greatest business challenge as market price fluctuations and his highest monthly expense is food. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

Furry will use the KES 20,000 loan to establish a water selling business. Furry aspires to establish a wholesale shop in the future. He joined Yehu to access capital.

loans.use: to establish a water selling business.

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila is 50 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is separated and has two children.

Leonila has a retail shop where she sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of PHP 16,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages. Leonila has been a member of HSPFI since 2010.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
Roselyn is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has five children.

Roselyn has a shop that sells fish such as sardines and mackerel by the kilogram. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy stocks of fish to sell. Roselyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of fish to sell.

loans.name: Murodjon

texts.ru: Муродчон трудолюбивый и целеустремленный человек. Имеет большую дружную семью. Жена занимается домохозяйством. Более 2-х лет он занимается купле- продажей крупного рогатого скота. Данный бизнес приносит ему хороший доход, который помогает ему  содержать семью. Весной можно хорошо заработать занимаясь этим видом бизнеса. Муродчон запрашивает займ для покупки крупного рогатого скота.
texts.en: Murodjon is a hardworking and purposeful man. He has a big and friendly family. His wife is a homemaker. Murodjon has been buying and selling large horned cattle for more than two years. This business brings him good income which helps him to support the family. During the spring it's a good time to make money doing this business. Murodjon is asking for a loan to buy large horned cattle.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Martha

texts.es: Martha de 60 años de edad es una mujer casada que tiene 3 hijos en las edades de 34 a 39 años. Ella es la propietaria de un negocio de variedades, punto de ventas en el que exhibe mercancías como accesorios, papelería y artículos varios. Cuando se inició como comerciante, lo hizo vendiendo cerveza hace 20 años, luego por problemas de salud cambió de negocio y empezó a vender  toda clase de mercancía, entre un mercado pequeño y muy doméstico que le hacia pedidos, que debía conseguir para satisfacerlo;  pero poco a poco fue instalando un punto comercial en su propia casa,  para vender artículos que usualmente necesita la población de un barrio en todo momento, como lápices, cartulina, hojas, accesorios para damas, colonias etc. Con su negocio le ha ido muy bien, pues ha logrado sacar a sus hijos adelante y mejorar su calidad de vida. Su credikiva es el crédito # 21,  que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, organización que le ha apoyado su crecimiento, pues con sus financiamientos pasó de vender mediante el sistema distribución entre sus clientes a tener una miscelánea o punto comercial donde ofrecer articulo de mucha necesidad para jóvenes, niños y adultos. Su sueño de crecimiento es tener más prosperidad que la actual y aumentar su inventario y su número de clientes, esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva con el que comprará una vitrina y mercancía para surtirla actualizando inventario e incluyendo  papelería, con la que actualmente no cuenta. La experiencia de Martha es su mejor aliada y le augura una inversión exitosa que muy seguramente veremos reflejada en sus estados financieros.
texts.en:
Marta, age 60, is married and has three children ranging in ages from 34 to 39.  She has a retail business.  At her sales location she displays merchandise like accessories, stationery, and various items.  When she started as a merchant 20 years ago she did so by selling beer.
	
Due to health problems she later changed her business and started to sell all types of merchandise.  It was a small and very domestic market that gave her orders that she needed to fill.  However, little by little she was setting up a sales location in her own house.  She did so in order to sell items like pencils, cardboard, paper, women’s accessories, and cologne, etc. that the neighbors need all of the time.  The business has gone very well for her.  She has managed to get her children ahead and improve their quality of life. 

Her Kiva loan is the 21st loan she has with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  This organization has supported her growth.  Through their loans she went from selling through a customer distribution system to having a general store or sales location where she can offer items that are greatly needed by children, adolescents, and adults.

Her dream for growing is to have more prosperity than she currently has, to increase her inventory, and to have more customers.  This is the reason that she turns to a Kiva loan.  She will use it to buy a display case and merchandise to stock her business.  She will update her inventory and include stationery, which she does not now have.

Martha’s experience is her greatest ally.  It assures a successful investment, which we will very surely see reflected in her financial statements.

loans.use: to buy a display case and to stock up on merchandise.

loans.name: Zoila Rosa

texts.es:
Zoila Rosa  tiene 29 años de edad es madre soltera a pesar de cerlo ha podido salir adelante, tiene un hijo, vive con el hijo de 10 años de edad en Guaranda provincia de Bolívar.

Es integrante de la Vrc Nuevos Horizontes, la comunidad se encuentra a unos 40 minutos en la comunidad santa Martha perteneciente al Cantón Guaranda.

Zoila se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de mora, además cría pollos para poder venderlos.

Solicita el crédito para poder comprar abonos, fertilizantes, balanceado, urea, abono orgánico. Las compras y las ventas lo hace en Guaranda cada 15 días. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar los insumos y la comida para los pollos.

Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta es el mal clima y las plagas. El sueño es poder comprar tierras y mas animales. En el tiempo libre le gusta descansar.
texts.en:
Zoila Rosa, 29, is a single mother but that hasn't stopped her from working hard to get ahead.  She and her 10-year old son live in Guaranda, a town in Boliva province.  

Zoila is a member of the Nuevos Horizontes community bank.  Her town is about 40 minutes from Santa Martha in Guaranda canton.  

Zoila is a farmer.  She grows blackberries and raises chickens.  

Zoila is applying for a loan that she will use to buy manure, fertilizers, feed, urea, etc.  She goes to Guaranda every 15 days where she buys and sells everything she needs.  The challenges she faces include weather and insects.  Your loan will allow her to continue her business.  

Zoila wants to buy more land and more animals.  In her spare time, she likes to rest.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her farming business.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is 23 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single.

Mercy has a shop that sells frozen foods such as hotdogs and dressed chickens. She has had this business for two years. She requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy stocks of frozen foods to sell. Mercy has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of frozen foods to sell.

loans.name: Freddy Hernan

texts.es:
Freddy Hernan tiene 31 años de edad vive en unión libre tiene un hijo, vive con la conyugue y con el hijo de 12 años de edad en Guaranda provincia de Bolívar.

Es integrante de la Vrc Nuevos Horizontes, la comunidad se encuentra a unos 40 minutos en la comunidad santa Martha perteneciente al Cantón Guaranda.

Freddy se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de mora y naranjilla, además cría pollos y cerdos. Solicita el crédito para comprar insumos, abonos,  líquidos para la maleza, balanceado, polvillo.

Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar los insumos, abonos y fertilizantes. Las compras y las ventas lo hace en Guaranda cada 15 días.

El sueño es poder comprarse una camioneta. En el tiempo libre le gusta jugar cartas y disfrutar de las festividades del carnaval.
texts.en:
Freddy Hernan, 31, and his partner have one child.  They live in Guaranda, a canton in Bolivar province.  

Freddy is a member of the Nuevos Horizontes community bank.  His town is about 40 minutes from Santa Martha in Guaranda.  

Freddy is a farmer.  He grows blackberries and oranges.  He also raises chickens and pigs.

Freddy is applying for a loan that he will use to buy manure, fertilizers, feed and other supplies.  He goes to Guaranda every 15 days where he buys and sells everything he needs.  Your loan will allow him to continue operating his business.  

Freddy wants to buy a truck.  In his spare time, he likes to play cards and go to Carnaval.

loans.use: to buy supplies for his farming business.

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana is 26 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. Ana has a shop that sells spices, food seasonings, and noodles. She has had this business for three years. She has requested a loan for 10,000 PHP to buy stock of spices, food seasonings, and noodles.

Ana has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Ana hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of spices, food seasonings, and noodles.

loans.name: Pedro Nestor

texts.es: Pedro de 45 años de edad vive al sur de la ciudad y es comerciante de artículos de cacharrería con los que trabaja puerta a puerta y diariamente por más de 8 horas. Su negocio lo inició hace 20 años,  aprendió de éste por tradición de sus padres, pero se dedicó al este por necesidad, pues no encontró oportunidades de empleo en empresas, llevándolo   a comercializar al detal mercancía variada y cliente a cliente, en los diferentes barrios de la ciudad, por los que camina apoyado por su ayudante. Con su negocio tiene la posibilidad de sostener a su familia, conformada por su esposa y sus tres hijas en las edades de 13 a 19 años. Su sueño familiar es que cada uno tenga su propia casa y logren tener un esposo trabajador y responsable. Su sueño empresarial de crecimiento, es tener un capital de trabajo para lograr mejores negociaciones con la compra de sus mercancías, esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará, productos de aseo personal y artículos para el hogar. Su potencialidad de éxito radica en su capacidad de trabajo y el conocimiento del mercado, que lo llevan a hacer una inversión ajustada a la demanda y con ello incrementa su potencial de ventas.
texts.en:
Pedro, 45, lives in the southern part of the city and sells housewares door-to-door for more than eight hours daily.  He started his business 20 years ago.  He learned it from his parents but he did this work out of necessity because he did not find employment opportunities in business.  This led him to sell a variety of merchandise retail, from customer to customer in the various neighborhoods in the city, through which he walks, helped by his assistant.

With his business he has the possibility of supporting his family, made up of his wife and their three daughters, who are from 13 to 19 years old.  His dream for his family is that each one will have her own house and manage to have a hardworking and responsible husband.  His dream for his business growth is to have working capital to be able to have better negotiations with the purchase of his merchandise.

This is why he is coming for a Kiva loan, the first financing he is getting from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, with which he will buy personal care products and household items.  His potential for success lies in his capacity to work and his knowledge of the market, which lead him to make an investment in accordance with the demand, with which his sales potential increases.

loans.use: to buy personal care products and household items.

loans.name: Luis Fausto

texts.es:
Luis Fausto tiene 30 años de edad es casado tiene 4 hijos, vive con la esposa y con los hijos de 12, 10, 8 y 6 años de edad en Guaranda provincia de bolívar.

Es integrante de la VCR Nuevos Horizontes, la comunidad se encuentra a unos 40 minutos en la comunidad santa Martha perteneciente al Cantón Guaranda.

Luis se dedica  a la agricultura a la siembra de mora y naranjilla, además cría pollos, cerdos y ganado.

Solicita el crédito para poder comprar semillas, abonos, líquidos para la maleza, urea, abonos orgánicos y comida para los animales como el balanceado.

Las compras y las ventas de los productos agrícolas lo hace en Guaranda. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta son las plagas y el mal clima.

El sueño es poder comprarse una finca para criar a los animales y poder sembrar mucho más.
En el tiempo libre le gusta  jugar naipe y el carnaval.
texts.en:
Luis Fausto, 30, and his wife have 4 children who are 12-, 10-, 8- and 6-years old, respectively. They live in Guaranda, a canton in Bolivar province. 

Luis is a member of the Nuevos Horizontes community bank. His town is about 40 minutes from Santa Martha in Guaranda. 

Luis is a farmer. He grows blackberries and oranges. He also raises cattle, chickens and pigs.
 
Luis is applying for a loan that he will use to buy manure, fertilizers, feed and other supplies. He buys and sells everything he needs in Guaranda.  His biggest challenges are insects and climate.  Your loan will allow him to continue operating his business. 

Luis wants to buy a larger farm. In his spare time, he likes to play naipe (a card game) and go to Carnaval.

loans.use: to buy supplies for his farming business.

loans.name: Jose Manuel

texts.es:
Jose Manuel tiene 34 años  es casado tiene tres hijos, vive con la esposa y con los hijos de 12, 8 y 1 años de edad en Guaranda provincia de Bolívar.

Es integrante de la Vrc Nuevos Horizontes, la comunidad se encuentra a unos 40 minutos en la comunidad santa Martha perteneciente al Cantón Guaranda.

Jose se dedica  a la agricultura a la siembra de mora y naranjilla, vende mora, leche y naranjilla, además cría pollos y ganados.

Solicita el crédito para comprar semillas, abonos,  fertilizantes,  urea, balanceado. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar los abonos y mejorar la producción.

El sueño es poder comprar un vehículo para transportar los productos para poder venderlos.En el tiempo libre le gusta jugar boly.
texts.en:
Jose Manuel, 30, and his wife have 3 children who are 12-, 8- and 1-year(s) old, respectively. They live in Guaranda, a canton in Bolivar province. 

Jose is a member of the Nuevos Horizontes community bank. His town is about 40 minutes from Santa Martha in Guaranda. 

Jose is a farmer. He grows blackberries and oranges. He also raises cattle and chickens.  
 
Jose is applying for a loan that he will use to buy seeds, fertilizers, animal feed and other supplies. Your loan will allow him to continue operating his business. 

Jose wants to buy a vehicle for transporting the products he sells. In his spare time, he likes to play "boly" (volleyball?).

loans.use: to buy supplies for his farming business.

loans.name: Kenanga Indah Group

texts.en: The Kenanga Indah group is continuing to take out a loan to increase their business. Now they have 10 members. The loan will be used to purchase superior piglets and feed. Ni Komang, the head of the group, is feeling the benefits of joining the program. The result of this business has helped her family income. She hopes with the benefit of this next loan, her business will grow rapidly and she can succeed like her friends have.

loans.use: To purchase superior piglets

loans.name: Tohir

texts.ru: Тохир женат и на воспитании имеет 8 детей. Более 3-х лет Тохир занимается купле- продажей крупного рогатого скота. Имеет все возможности по уходу и откорму скота. Имеет богатый опыт в этой сфере бизнеса. Тохир хотел бы получить займ для покупки крупного рогатого скота с целью расширения бизнеса. Он надеется на вашу помощь и доброту.
texts.en: Tohir is married and has eight children. Tohir has been buying and selling large horned cattle for more than three years. He has all the conditions to take care and feed the cattle. He has a rich experience in this type of business. Tohir wants to get a loan to buy large horned cattle with the purpose to expand his business. He is hoping for your help and support.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Ma Famille Group

texts.fr:
Mme BOUSSIRATOU  est la responsable du groupe MA FAMILLE. Elle est célibataire  sans  enfant et  elle n’a  personne  à sa charge.

Mme vend des mèches  et des sacs à main depuis 15ans. Elle s’approvisionne au marché de secteur 10 en ville. Ses clients sont ses voisins  et les clientes qui viennent de partout.

Mme veut  s’acheter  10 sachets de mèche  et 10 sacs à main.

Elle utilise ses bénéfices  pour renforcer son activité. Mme ambitionne  ouvrir sa propre boutique et voyager à Lomé pour acheter en gros.
texts.en:
Miss BOUSSIRATOU is the leader of the group called MA FAMILLE. She is single with no children and is not responsible for anyone else. She sells hair extensions and handbags and has been doing this for 15 years. She buys her wares in the Secteur 10 market in town. Her customers are her neighbors and others who come from all around. 

She wants to buy 10 bags of hair extensions and 10 handbags. She will use her profit to grow her business. Her ambition is to have her own little store and to travel to Lomé to buy wholesale.

loans.use: to buy 10 bags of hair extensions and 10 handbags

loans.name: Gilberth Julian

texts.es:
Gilberth Julian tiene 23 años de edad es casado tiene 2 hijos, vive con la esposa y los hijos de 6 y 2 años de edad en Guaranda provincia de Bolívar.

Es integrante de la Vrc Nuevos Horizontes, la comunidad se encuentra a unos 40 minutos en la comunidad santa Martha perteneciente al Cantón Guaranda.

Gilberth se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de mora y naranjilla, además tiene pollos y ganado. Solicita el crédito para poder invertir en la agricultura comprando los insumos, fertilizantes, urea, líquidos para la maleza, insecticidas, vacunas y vitaminas para los animales.

Las compras y las ventas lo hace en Guaranda semanalmente. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar  los insumos para poder mejorar la producción.

El sueño es tener casa y finca propia. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta son las malas vías de acceso y mal clima. En el tiempo libre le gusta jugar naipe.
texts.en:
Gilberth Julian, 23, and his wife have 2 children who are 6- and 2-years old, respectively. They live in Guaranda, a canton in Bolivar province. 

Gilberth is a member of the Nuevos Horizontes community bank. His town is about 40 minutes from Santa Martha in Guaranda. 

Gilberth is a farmer. He grows blackberries and oranges. He also raises cattle and chickens. 

Gilberth is applying for a loan that he will use to buy seeds, fertilizers, animal feed and other supplies. He buys and sells everything he needs in Guaranda.  His biggest challenges are weather and bad roads.  Your loan will allow him to continue operating his business. 

Gilberth wants to buy a house and farm of his own. In his spare time, he likes to play naipe (a card game).

loans.use: to buy supplies for his farming business.

loans.name: Mariposas De Collpani Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “MARIPOSAS DE COLLPANI” iniciará el cuarto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Collpani.  Está compuesta por ocho integrantes y cuentan con una mesa directiva a la cabeza de la misma se encuentra  la señora Sonia. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: tienda de internet, tienda, venta de ropa, venta ropa y producción de papas fritas, venta de polera, venta de té y café, artesano.

La señora Sonia, indica que forma parte de una asociación comunal desde hace dos años atrás y que en la actualidad ella cuenta con un negocio tienda de abarrotes, que viene trabajando hace años, aprendiendo el mismo de su mamá. El crédito de este ciclo es para ampliación espacio de comercialización (compra de muebles y enseres) estos artículos lo adquirirá de las ferias paceñas y posteriormente lo implementará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite apoyar a su familia pues ella vive en unión libre y tiene un hijo.

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones y la atención en salud.
texts.en:
The A.C. “Mariposas de Collpani” (butterflies of Collpani) will begin their 4th loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Collpani Communal Bank. It’s made up of 8 members and a group of directors, of which, Sonia is the head. The members of our community have various businesses and lines of work like internet café, store, clothing sales, making and selling french fries, sweater sales, coffee and tea sales and crafts.

Sonia indicates to us that she has been a member of the Communal Bank for 2 years and she has a grocery store business that she’s been running for years, something she learned from her mother. The loan for this cycle is to expand her commercial space (buy furniture and fixings). She’ll buy these articles in the fairs in La Paz and then she will sell them in her space. This line of work helps her to support her family – she’s in a common-law relationship and has one child. 

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the training and the attention put on health.

loans.use: buy furniture and fixings.

loans.name: Rhina Jaqueline

texts.es: La Sra. Rhina se dedica a la confección de ropa interior de bautizo para niñas;  indica que  tiene experiencia de 10 años en esta actividad su taller se encuentra en su domicilio donde realiza los trabajos a pedido como también para comercializarlos en los distintos Mercados de la ciudad de La Paz viaja los fines de semana y es en la madrugada donde realiza las ventas en docenas y por mayor; vive en casa propia su domicilio se encuentra en el sud de la ciudad de Cochabamba es una zona alejada, tiene 1 hijo su esposo se encuentra enfermo con diabetes en etapa terminal por lo que ella es la única que con su actividad genera ingresos para su familia; indica que el dinero que se le otorga es para la compra de una maquina para costura recta que le permitirá realizar la confección con mas eficiencia y mejor calidad, es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz u agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Ms. Rhina devotes herself to creating baptismal undergarments for girls. She indicates that she has ten years of experience in this business. Her workshop is in her home, where she does her work filling special orders as well as for selling in the different market of the city of La Paz. She travels on weekends and in the early morning hours makes her sales by the dozens or wholesale. 

She lives in her own home. Her household is located in the southern part of the city of Cochabamba which is a remote area. She has one child. Her husband is ill from terminal-stage diabetes and so she is the only one who, with her business, generates income for her family. 

She indicates that the money being granted her is for the purchase of an industrial sewing machine which will allow her to sew her products more efficiently and at higher quality. She is a very hardworking person. She feels happy with and grateful to the institution for all of its support.

loans.use: buy an industrial sewing machine for double stitching.

loans.name: Mekar Sandat Group

texts.en: Feeling the benefit from this business, the Mekar Sandat group decided to continue taking out a loan from MUK. The business helps to increase their family income. This loan will use to purchase more superior piglets, feed for them, and to renovate the barn. Ni Made will use her loan to purchase more superior piglets and feed. She has a plan to keep fattening pigs. Now the price is normal, but she hopes when she sells them, the price will be high. Ni Made dreams of repairing her house using the profit from this business.

loans.use: To purchase more superior piglets and feed for them, and renovate the barn

loans.name: Boniface

texts.en: Boniface is a 36-year-old married man. He has a child who is three years old. His wife's name is Dorothy. Boniface operates a poultry farm and sells his goods from home and door to door. He's worked in this business for a year. His primary customers are neighbors and passersby. He describes his greatest business challenge as market fluctuations and his highest monthly expense is food. He rents a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Boniface will use the Kes 50000 loan to purchase poultry feed and medicine. Boniface aspires to establish a big poultry farm in the future. He joined Yehu to access capital.

loans.use: to purchase poultry feed and medicine.

loans.name: Imee

texts.en:
Imee is 35 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Imee has a shop that sells rice by the sack. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy sacks of rice to sell.

Imee has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Imee hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Raisa

texts.ru:
Предыдущий кредит КИВА помог Раисе и ее семье. Получив дополнительную прибыль, Раиса направила ее в развитие бизнеса: она практически в два раза увеличила место торговли. Благодаря полученным средствам, семья смогла себе позволить оплатить образование одной из дочерей на платный стационаре одного высшего учебного заведения.
Раиса хочет вложить полученный от КИВА кредит в приобретение семян для продажи на фермерам-сельскохозяйственникам, так как сезон вот-вот начнется, а также хочет оплатить аренду торгового помещения.
texts.en:
The previous loan from Kiva has helped Raisa and her family. By getting an additional profit Raisa directed it towards developing of her business. She practically twice increased the size of her vendor location. Thanks to the financial means the family was able to pay for the education of one of the daughter's in a higher education institution.

Raisa wants to invest the loan from Kiva to buy seeds for sale to the agricultural farmers as the season is about to start and also to pay for the rent of her vendor space.

loans.use: to buy seeds and pay for rent.

loans.name: Abduvahob

texts.ru: Абдувахоб добрый и честный человек. Он женат и на воспитании имеет троих детей. Более 20 лет он занимается купле- продажей скота, а также выращиванием сельхозпродуктов. В бизнесе помогает жена. От ранее полученного займа в «ИМОН Интернешнл» получил хороший доход и улучшил свое домохозяйство. Абдувахоб запрашивает займ в размере 3500 Сомони для покупки семян лука, пшеницы и ячменя. Он надеется на вашу помощь и доброту.
texts.en: Abduvahod is a kind and honest man. He is married and has three children. He has been buying and selling cattle for more than twenty years as well as cultivating crops. His wife helps him in this business. From the earlier loan from IMON International he received a good profit and improved his home conditions. Abduvahod is asking for a loan in the amount of 3,500 to buy onion seeds, wheat and barley. He hopes for your help and kindness.

loans.use: to buy seeds.

loans.name: Julian

texts.es:
Julian tiene 38 años de edad es casado tiene 5 hijos, vive con la esposa y con los hijos de 18, 16, 14, 10 y 7 años de edad en  Guaranda provincia de Bolívar.

Es integrante de la Vrc Nuevos Horizontes, la comunidad se encuentra a unos 40 minutos en la comunidad Santa Martha perteneciente al Cantón Guaranda.

Julian se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de mora y naranjilla y a la cría de pollos y cerdos.

Solicita el crédito para poder comprar los abonos orgánicos, urea,  y fertilizantes, insecticidas para mejorar la producción. Las compras y las ventas los hace en Guaranda.

Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar los insumos. El sueño es poder comprarse un carro para transportar los productos.
En el tiempo libre le gusta jugar indor y  disfrutar del carnaval.
texts.en:
Julian, age 38, is married and has five children.  He lives with his wife and children, ages 18, 16, 14, 10, and 7 in Guaranda in the Bolívar province.

He is a member of the Nuevos Horizones communal bank found 40 minutes away in the community of Santa Marta, which is part of the region of Guaranda. 

Julian devotes himself to growing blackberries and “naranjillas” (a native fruit).  He also raises chickens and pigs.

He is requesting the loan to buy organic fertilizers, urea, fertilizers, and insecticides to improve his production.  He will make his purchases and sales in Guaranda.  With the help of the loan he will be able to buy the supplies.

His dream is to be able to buy a car to transport his products.

In his free time he likes to play indoor soccer and enjoy the carnival.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizers, urea, fertilizers, and insecticides to improve his production.

loans.name: Gloria Maria

texts.es: Gloria Maria tiene 47 años de edad, la actividad a la que se dedica es a un comedor donde vende todo tipo de comida corriente y a la carta, este negocio lo aprendió de un familiar que tenía el negocio y lo heredo y ahora se dedica a este negocio. Esta emprendedora actualmente está solicitando financiamiento para comprar arroz, frijoles, carne, verduras, entre otros productos para el comedor y poder ofrecerle a sus clientes.
texts.en: Gloria Maria, 47, runs a cafeteria business where she sells all kinds of foods a la carte. She learned this business from a family member who owned it, and then, she inherited it and has dedicated herself to this line of work. This entrepreneur is requesting a loan  to buy rice, beans, meat, and vegetables, among other products, to offer her clients in her cafeteria.

loans.use: buy rice, beans, meat, and vegetables, among other products, to offer her clients in her cafeteria.

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Marlyn is 53 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is separated with one child. 

Marlyn has a retail shop that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for three years. She requested a loan for 21,000 PHP to buy stock of canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

Marlyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2010.  In the future, Marlyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages for sale.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is 38 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. 

Mary Jane has a retail shop that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for six years. She requested a loan for 20,000 PHP to buy stock of canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

Mary Jane has been a member of HSPFI since 2008.  In the future, Mary Jane hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages for sale.

loans.name: Furaha

texts.en:
Furaha is a 31-year-old married woman. She has a child who is one year old. Her husband's name is John and he works as a security guard. Furaha operates a greengrocery business and sells her goods from home. She's worked in this business for one year. Her primary customers are neighbours and passersby. 

Furaha's other source of income includes her husband's contributions. She describes her greatest business challenge to be market price fluctuations and her highest monthly expense is food. She rents a house that has electricity but no piped water. 

Furaha will use the Kes 10,000 loan to purchase tomatoes and onions. Furaha aspires to establish a grocery stall in the future. She joined Yehu to access capital.

loans.use: to purchase tomatoes and onions.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is 56 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. 

Lydia has a retail shop where she buys & sells canned goods, snacks, vegetables like tomatoes & beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy canned goods, snacks, vegetables & beverages to sell.

Lydia has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Lydia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, vegetables & beverages to sell

loans.name: Fatma

texts.en:
Fatma is a 32-year-old married woman. She has a child who is four months old. Her husband's name is Athman. 

Fatma operates an ice and lollipops selling business and sells her goods from home. She has worked in this business for two years. Her primary customers are neighbours and passersby. Fatma's other source of income includes her husband’s contributions. She describes her greatest business challenge to be the high cost of transportation and her highest monthly expense is food. She rents a house that has electricity but no piped water.
 
Fatma will use the KES 40,000 loan to purchase sugar and flavors for making lollipops for sale. Fatma aspires to establish an ice-pop stall in the future. She joined Yehu to access capital.

loans.use: to purchase sugar and flavors for making lollipops for sale.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 45 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has four children. 

Evelyn has a shop that sells gasoline by the liter. She has had this business for ten years. She requested a loan of PHP 14,000 to buy gallons of gasoline for resale.

Evelyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy gallons of gasoline for resale.

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline is a 28-year-old single lady. She is blessed with three children, whom she supports. She has been a maize farmer for the last five years and earns a monthly income of KES 9,000. 

With a first loan of KES 20,000 from KADET LTD, she plans to buy farm inputs for preparation and planting her farm. 

The anticipated profits will be reinvested. Her future plans are to improve her family's living standards and to have a successful future.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs.

loans.name: Boubacar

texts.fr: Boubacar est un jeune célibataire qui tient une boutique de vente de produits cosmétiques au marché central de sa localité. Il a démarré cette activité après avoir arrêté ses études au collège.Selon lui, cet abandon est dû aux mauvaises conditions d'hébergement et de vie dans la ville où se trouvait son école et qui est distante de sa localité de quelques 80 kilomètres.Aujourd'hui, il est le principal soutien de sa famille à laquelle il assure l'essentiel des dépenses d'alimentation, de santé...Il parvient aussi à subvenir à ses propres besoins. Afin de renforcer son fonds de commerce, il sollicite un pret de 250000f pour acheter du lait de beauté, des crèmes, des mèches,des chaussures. Son ambition est d'agrandir sa boutique.
texts.en:
Boubacar is a young single man who runs a shop at the local market where he sells cosmetic products. He started this business after leaving college, a decision he made due to the poor lodging and living conditions in the city where his school was located, some 80 kilometres away. 

He is currently the primary financial support of his family and provides for most of their food and healthcare expenses. He also supports himself. 

In order to strengthen his working capital, he is seeking a loan of 250,000F to buy beauty lotions, creams, hair extensions, and shoes. 

His goal is to expand his activity.

loans.use: to buy beauty lotions, creams, hair extensions, and shoes.

loans.name: Melecia

texts.en:
Melecia is 55 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed with three children. She has a retail shop that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for 18,000 PHP to buy stock of canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

Melecia has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Melecia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages for sale.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca is 44 years old, married, and has six children. With five children in school, Rebecca works very hard to provide for them. Rebecca runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 29,500 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more inventory to sell. Rebecca has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as soy sauce, eggs, spices, sugar, milk, noodles, etc. In the future Rebecca would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy more inventory

loans.name: Moussa

texts.fr: Moussa est un homme marié, père de cinq enfants. Il vend des produits agricoles tels que le mil, l'arachide...Il achète ces produits et les stocke en attendant les périodes de forte demande pour les revendre à de bons prix.Cette activité lui permet d'entretenir sa famille et d'épargner un peu d'argent. Il sollicite un pret de 200000f pour acheter de l'arachide, du haricots et du mil afin de renforcer son stock.Son ambition est de construire son propre magasin de stockage.
texts.en: Moussa is a married man and the father of five children. He sells agricultural produce such as millet, peanuts, etc. He buys this produce and warehouses it, waiting for periods of heavy demand to sell the produce at a good price. This business allows him to support his family and put aside a little money in savings. He is asking for a loan of 200,000 francs to buy peanuts, dried beans, and millet to bolster his stock. His ambition is to build his own warehouse.

loans.use: to buy peanuts, dried beans, and millet to expand his stock

loans.name: Racheal

texts.en: Racheal is a 28-year-old married woman. She has two children, ages of 3 and 5, and two are enrolled in school. Her husband's name is Rashid and he works as a gardener. Racheal operates a food stall and sells her goods from home. She's worked in this business for one year. Her primary customers are neighbours and passersby. Racheal's income also includes her husband's contribution. She describes her greatest business challenge to be low customer purchasing power and her highest monthly expense is food. She rents a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Racheal will use the Kes 15,000 loan to purchase sacks of rice, beans, sugar, and wheat flour. Racheal aspires to establish a restaurant business in the future. She joined Yehu for the availability of sustainable financial services.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of rice, beans, sugar, and wheat flour.

loans.name: Pin

texts.en:
Pin lives with her husband and three single children in Prey Chor district of Kompong Cham Province. Her family's main business for over 15 years has been rice cultivation, from which Pin earns a suitable annual income to satisfy the family’s needs. She grows rice alongside her spouse, a supportive man who manages the maintenance of the rice field.

Pin would like to acquire a loan through HKL, a partner of Kiva, to buy some poultry, especially ducks, to raise for meat and eggs. This loan will enable Pin to operate her business well and thereby increase her household income.

loans.use: to buy some poultry to raise.

loans.name: Ousmane

texts.fr: Ousmane est un mécanicien. Il tient un garage mécanique à côté de gare routière de sa localité.Il est marié et père de trois enfants. Afin de diversifier ses sources de revenus, il vend en même temps des pièces détachées. Il parvient à obtenir des revenus assez subexponentiels qui lui permettent de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille. Afin de faire face à la forte demande , il sollicite un pret de 150000f pour acheter un lot de pièces détachées. Il ambitionne d'implanter une boutique aux abords de la gare routière.
texts.en: Ousmane is a mechanic. He has a garage near the bus and taxi station in his locality. He is married and the father of three children. So as to diversify his sources of income, he also sells spare parts. He manages to make a rather substantial income which goes to support his family. In order to meet the considerable demand, he is requesting a loan of 150,000 francs to buy a batch of spare parts. His ambition is to set up a shop near the bus and taxi station.

loans.use: to buy a batch of spare parts

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
Adelaida is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. 

Adelaida has a retail shop that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. She has requested a loan for 17,000 PHP to buy stock of canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

Adelaida has been a member of HSPFI since 2010.  In the future, Adelaida hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages for sale.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia is 54 years old, a widow, and has four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Patricia has a salt/"guinamos" retail business in the Philippines. Patricia requested a PHP 29,500 loan amount through NWTF to buy more stocks of salt and fermented fish to sell.

She has been in this business for seven years. Patricia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of salt and fermented fish to sell.

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en:
Sophia is a 30-year-old married woman. She has a child who is 11 years old and is enrolled in school. Her husband's name is Mathias and he works as a businessman. 

Sophia operates a firewood selling business and sells her goods from home and door-to-door. She's worked in this business for three years. Her primary customers are neighbours and passersby. 

Sophia's other source of income includes her husband's contributions. She describes her greatest business challenges to be transportation and theft and her highest monthly expense is food. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Sophia will use the Kes 40,000 loan to purchase sacks of firewood and charcoal. Sophia aspires to establish a charcoal-selling stall in the future. She joined Yehu to access capital.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of firewood and charcoal.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase bundles of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 53 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Gloria has a shop that sells rice & rice hay per kilogram. She has had this business for six years. She requested a loan of 11,000 PHP to buy sacks of rice & rice hay to sell.

Gloria has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Gloria hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice & rice hay to sell

loans.name: El Hadji Babacar

texts.fr: El Hadji est un homme marié, père de quatre enfants dont les trois vont à l'école. Il s'est reconverti depuis un an au commerce d'articles de mercerie au grand marché de sa localité. Il achète en gros dans la capitale et revend en détail aux tailleurs.Son commerce commence à être rentable et lui permet de prendre en charge une bonne partie des dépenses d'entretien de sa famille. Il sollicite un pret de 250000f pour acheter des articles de mercerie afin de renforcer son fonds de commerce.
texts.en:
El Hadji is a married man and father of four children, three of whom go to school. He started selling haberdashery items at the main market of his neighborhood a year ago. 

He buys his merchandise wholesale in the capital, and sells to tailors at retail. His business is now profitable and allows him to take on a large portion of the family’s household expenses. 

He is seeking a loan of 250,000F to buy haberdashery items, which will help to strengthen his working capital.

loans.use: to buy haberdashery items for resale.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 37 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has seven children. 

Elizabeth is making and peddling snacks like tikoy (a type of rice cake made from glutinous rice flour and sugar) and kutsinta (a sweet made from rice flour, brown sugar, and coconut). She has had this business for ten years. She requested a loan of PHP 12,000 to buy raw ingredients for making snacks.

Elizabeth has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making snacks.

loans.name: Koem

texts.en:
Koem, age 65, is a humble resident from the Baray district of Kompong Tom province, Cambodia. She is married and has been blessed with six children. Presently they are married and live independently around the province. Koem is a proud farmer who owns a seven-hectare plantation for farming productivity. Her spouse works in the same type of business as her. They cultivate rice, potatoes and vegetables, from which they can earn a good income.

As of now, Koem is asking for a loan from HKL to pay for local laborers to harvest her potato crops on the plantation. Koem hopes to gain success in her business activities one day as she works harder and gets the support from our lenders.

loans.use: to pay for local laborers to harvest her potato crops

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy more fish to sell. She has been in this business for three years. Alma earns more income from food vending.

Alma has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to school in the future.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie works hard to support her family. She is married and has a pottery  business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy materials needed for her pottery. She has been in this business for seven years.

Rosalie would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her pottery.

loans.name: Momar Talla

texts.fr: Depuis qu'il a arrété ses études au lycée il y'a trois ans, Momar s'est lancé dans le commerce de produits alimentaires. Il a ainsi ouvert une alimentation dans sa localité avec l'aide de ses parents. La bonne localisation de sa boutique lui assure une grande clientèle. Il arrive ainsi à prendre en charge ses deux parents et à aider ses petits frères qui sont encore des élèves.Afin de renforcer son fonds de commerce,Momar sollicite un pret de 500000f pour acheter des caisses d'eau minérale, de boisson, des détergents et du lait. Son ambition est d'agrandir son alimentation.
texts.en:
When he stopped attending high school three years ago, Momar got into selling foodstuffs. He opened a grocery store in his locality with the help of his parents. The good location of his store assures him a big clientele. In this way he manages to support his parents and help his younger brothers who are still at school. 

In order to bolster his working capital, Momar is asking for a loan of 500,000 francs to buy cases of mineral water, other drinks, detergents, and milk. His ambition is to expand his store.

loans.use: to buy cases of mineral water, other drinks, detergents, and milk.

loans.name: Marcelina Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “MARCELINA” iniciará el decimo tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Collpani.  Está compuesta por siete integrantes y cuentan con una mesa directiva a la cabeza de la misma se encuentra  la señora Nancy. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son dos y ellos son: venta de fruta y artesanos.

La señora Nancy, indica que forma parte de una asociación comunal desde hace cinco años atrás y que en la actualidad ella cuenta con un negocio de venta de fruta, que viene trabajando hace años, aprendiendo el mismo de su mamá. El crédito de este ciclo es para ampliación de su mercadería (compra de fruta) estos productos los adquirirá de las ferias comunales y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite apoyar a su familia pues ella vive en unión libre y tiene cuatro hijos.

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones.
texts.en:
The “MARCELINA” Communal Bank will start its thirteenth loan cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Collpani Regional Office. It is made up of seven members and has a board presided over by Sra. Nancy. The members of the bank engage in two businesses: they are fruit sellers and artisans.

Nancy has belonged to a communal bank for five years and currently has a fruit selling business that she has worked at for years, learning the trade from her mother. The loan from this cycle is to expand her merchandise (by buying more fruit). She will acquire these products at community fairs and subsequently sell them in her retail space. This kind of work enables her to support her family for she lives in a common law marriage and has four children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she replies that she enjoys the training workshops.

loans.use: to purchase fruit.

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es: La señora lidia  es cliente antigua dentro de la institución, la Sra. Lidia vive en la ciudad de la paz, en la zona de El Tejar,  tiene dos hijos que se encuentran en  edad escolar,  la Sra. Lidia se dedica  a la venta de carne seca Charque y  moldes de grasa y vende en una localidad de la ciudad de La Paz batalla,  el préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de carne por mayor para charquear. Ya que se acercan las ferias en las distintas localidades ya la Sra. Lidia tiene que ir a vender y el proceso de charquear la carne toma su tiempo, esto este proceso es el de hacer secar la carme con sal y limón, ella es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por la oportunidad que le dan para crecer en su negocio, se siente agradecida con la institución, ya que esta es su única actividad para mantener a su familia.
texts.en: Lidia is a longstanding client of the institution. She lives in La Paz, in the area of El Tejar. Lidia's work is selling dried meat charque (jerky) and containers of fat. She sells her goods in Batalla, a locality of the city of La Paz. She will invest the loan in buying meat on a wholesale basis to make charque. Since the festivals are coming up soon in various areas, Lidia needs to attend and sell her goods. and the process of making charque takes time. The process involves letting the meat dry with salt and lemon. Lidia is a very hard-working person. She feels happy about the opportunity given to her to grow with her business. She is grateful to the institution, since this is the only activity she has to maintain her family.

loans.use: to buy meat on a wholesale basis to make charque (jerky).

loans.name: Roberosa

texts.en:
Roberosa is married with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Roberosa is 44 years old. All of her children are in school.

Roberosa has a seafood retail business in the Philippines. Roberosa requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to buy more seafood to sell in the market.

Roberosa has been in this business for five years. In the future, Roberosa would like to save enough money to continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more seafood to sell in the market.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en: Caroline is 38 years old and a mother of one child. She sells second-hand clothes to earn a living. She has been in the business for six years and has employed one person. She describes her business environment as busy because she is visited regularly by her customers. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to improve her living standards and hopes to expand her business in the future. She has applied for 100,000 KES to buy second-hand clothes to sell.

loans.use: To buy second-hand clothes to sell

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
Rosie is married with two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Rosie is 36 years old and both her children are in school.

Rosie has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. Rosie requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish to sell in her food stall.

Rosie has been in this business for nine years. In the future, Rosie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah works hard to support her family. Sarah is widowed and has a variety store business in the Philippines.

Sarah requested a PHP18,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items like sugar, groceries, etc., to sell in her variety store.  She has been in this business for 20 years.  In the future, Sarah would like to save enough to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items like sugar, groceries, etc. to sell in her variety store.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 38 years old. She is married and has 2 children. With 1 child in school, Susan works very hard to provide for them.

Susan runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.  She has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items, such as detergent, snack foods and other miscellaneous items.  Susan would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Las Divas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LAS DIVAS” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Juan Pablo.  Está compuesta por seis integrantes y cuentan con una mesa directiva a la cabeza de la misma se encuentra  la señora Angélica. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de deportivos, venta ropa americana, tienda de barrio.

La señora Angélica, indica que forma parte de una asociación comunal por primera vez y que en la actualidad ella cuenta con un negocio de venta de ropa americana, que viene trabajando hace años, aprendiendo el mismo de una amiga. El crédito de este ciclo es para ampliación de su mercadería (compra de ropa americana) estos productos los adquirirá de las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite apoyar a su familia pues ella es soltera y tiene tres hijos.

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud por el consultorio.
texts.en:
The Divas Group will begin its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Juan Pablo Focal Center. This group is made up of six members who have a board of directors. At the head is Mrs. Angélica. The group members work in a variety of businesses: selling sporting goods, selling American clothing, and in a neighborhood store.

Mrs. Angélica shares she is joining a communal bank for the first time and that she currently has an American clothing business. She has done this work for many years, and learned it from a friend. This loan is to expand her merchandise (buy more American clothing) from the markets in the city of El Alto. She will later sell the clothing from her sales space. This work allows her to support her family. She is single and has three children. When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answered that she likes the health department for its doctor's office.

loans.use: buy American clothing

loans.name: Dekhale Thiossane De Kahone Group

texts.fr: Le groupement "DEKHALE THIOSSANE de Kahone" se compose de cinq femmes qui sont toutes mariées. Elles sont membres d'une tontine qui se réunit chaque mois pour rassembler les cotisations et financer ses membres. Du fait de la faiblesse de ces financements, elle ont ouvert un compte pour épargner et bénéficier de crédit.Elles exerce un commerce de produits alimentaires à domicile pour les unes et au marché pour les autres. La présidente du groupe ( main levée) est mère de 4 enfants dont les deux vont à l'école.Son commerce lui permet de s'occuper de leurs frais de scolarité et d'appuyer également son mari dans la prise en charge des dépenses d'entretien de la famille. Afin de renforcer leurs fonds de commerce, le groupe sollicite un pret de 500000f pour acheter des denrées alimentaires.
texts.en:
The group called "DEKHALE THIOSSANE de Kahone" is made up of five women who are all married. They are members of a revolving savings association ("tontine) which gets together each month to collect dues and finance its members. Due to the fact that this revolving amount is small, they opened an account to save and take advantage of loans. 

They sell foodstuffs, out of their homes in the case of certain of the women and at the market in other cases. The president of the group (who is raising her hand) is the mother of four children, of whom two are attending school. Her business allows her to cover their school fees and to help her husband with expenses for the family. In order to bolster their small businesses' working capital, the group is requesting a loan of 500,000 francs to buy foodstuffs.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy products for her store.

loans.name: Las Chicas Superpoderosas Group

texts.es:
Este grupo solidario se llama Las chicas súperpoderosas, está conformado por la señora María Concepción va a comprar con su préstamo maíz, azúcar, manteca, verduras, carnes, La señora Marcelina va a comprar arroz, carnes frías, verduras, masa, tortillas, aceite, la señora María Teresa va a comprar sal, suavitel, aceite, leche, azúcar, huevo, arroz, canela, café,  la señora Leticia va a comprar abono, fertilizantes y semilla, la señora Deisy va a comprar pollo, guajillo, olores, aceite, la señora Margarita va a comprar pan, mayonesa, jamón, salchicha, longaniza, queso, verdura, zanahorias, betabel. 
La señora Deisy tiene 30 años de edad, ella es casada, ella tiene 4 hijos varones 3 estudian la primaria y el pequeño esta en preescolar, ella vende barbacoa de pollo, ella solicito su préstamo para comprar pollo, chile guajillo, clavo, pimienta, cominos, canela, semilla de cilantro.
Ella inicio su negocio hace 8 años, es herencia de la abuelita de su esposo ella les enseño a preparar la barbacoa, ella sale a ofrecer sus productos en las calles de su comunidad, su negocio es importante porque es una tradición de familia y le gusta elaborar la comida, ella se siente orgullosa cuando le dicen que la comida está muy rica, su negocio es popular por el sabor de la barbacoa. Sus sueños y esperanzas son  estar mejor económicamente que sus hijos tengan mejor calidad de vida y que logren tener una carrera. Los integrantes de grupo quieren decirle a Kiva y a Fundación  Realidad “estamos agradecidas con ustedes por confiar en nosotros y ayudarnos con sus prestamos a crecer los negocios y las familias".
texts.en:
This loan group is called The Superpowerful Girls, and includes Mrs. María Concepción, who will use her loan to buy corn, sugar, lard, vegetables, and meat. Mrs. Marcelina is going to buy rice, cold meats, vegetables, dough, tortillas, and oil. Mrs. María Teresa is going to buy salt, fabric softener, oil, milk, sugar, eggs, rice, cinnamon, and coffee. Mrs. Leticia is going to buy fertilizer and seeds. Mrs. Deisy is going to buy chicken, peppers, spices, and oil. Mrs. Margarita is going to buy bread, mayonnaise, ham, sausage, cheese, vegetables, carrots, and beets.
