texts.en: Katia, 35, is married and has one son who is four years old. She makes decorative crafts and has a store in the city center where she sells her various products. This is her first loan with the institution, and Katia will use it to buy materials to make her crafts because Father's Day is coming up and that is a time of high demand for her goods. Her reason for asking for a loan is to have enough good quality materials for the work. She faces challenges in her business like how to increase sales in the market and use the profits to benefit her business. She wants to buy her own home. She is happy and grateful to the institution for their support because it allows her to grow her business and increase her income, and ultimately improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy materials to make crafts for Father's Day.

loans.name: Aubierge Sylvie Alice

texts.fr:
cliente âgée de 44 ans, elle est mariée  est mère de 2 enfants dont l’âge varie entre 10 et 17 ans. Ayant considère les charges de sa famille  en 2007, elle ouvre une petite unité de production de  fabrique de jus naturel.
A l’octroi de son prêt, elle avait acheté des bouteilles vides, des marmites, des étiquettes, des bouchons, 50 kg de sucre et des fruits comme des mangues, de la bar badine, des oranges…

Elle a une capacité de fabrication de 1000 litres de jus frais par semaine. Elle a une forte clientèle,
Avec ce nouveau prêt, elle veut acheter une centrifugeuse, un appareil pour pasteuriser les bouteilles et renforcer le stock des bouteilles.
Elle a pour projet un jour d’ouvrir une grande unité de production de jus et elle continue a épargner et avec ses bénéfices pour réaliser ses  projets.
texts.en:
At 44 years old, the entrepreneur Aubierge Sylvie Alice is married and the mother of two children whose ages range from 10 to 17 years. Having considered her family's expenses in 2007, she opened a small production unit making natural juices.

When her loan was granted, she purchased empty bottles, pots, labels, caps, 50kg of sugar and fruits such as mangoes, granadillas, oranges, etc.

She has a production capacity of 1,000 liters of fresh juice each week, and has a strong customer base.

With this new loan, she wants to purchase a juice extractor, a machine to pasteurize the bottles, and to increase her stock of bottles.

She plans to open a large juice production unit one day, and continues to save and put her profits toward the realization of her plans.

loans.use: To purchase empty juice bottles, sacks of sugar, labels and fruits.

loans.name: Djatougbé

texts.fr:
Djatougbé est une femme âgée de 32 ans. Elle est mariée å un retraité. Elle n’a pas d’enfants. 
Djatougbé travaille comme revendeuse depuis 2009. Elle est revendeuse de mèches pour tous clients dans sa boutique. Elle achète les produits à Lomé. Elle travaille seule. Au moment, sa difficulté principale est de ne pouvoir satisfaire toutes les demandes.
Djatougbé a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des mèches. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Djatougbé voudrait ouvrir une autre boutique. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Djatougbé is a 32-year-old woman. She is married to a retiree and has no children.

Djatougbé has been working as a retailer since 2009. She is a retail seller of hair extensions for every customer in her shop. She purchases the products in Lomé. She works alone. At the moment, her primary difficulty is not being able to keep up with demand.

Djatougbé has requested her first WAGES loan in order to purchase hair extensions. She wants to reinvest in the business.

In the coming years, Djatougbé would like to open another shop. She says that with the profits, she plans to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase hair extensions.

loans.name: Seydou

texts.fr:
Seydou est un jeune célibataire de 30 ans qui fait de la vente d’accessoires de portables, et cela depuis 6 ans. Il commence sa journée à 8 h pour la terminer à 18h. Il est à son second crédit  et n’a besoin présentement que de 100000F CFA. Avec cet argent, il va acheter des accessoires comme des chargeurs, des écouteurs, des habillages...
Vu que son stock n’est pas aussi fourni, il projette dans l’avenir d’agrandir son magasin mais aussi il voudrait ouvrir une boutique de prêt à porter.
texts.en:
Seydou is a young, 30-year-old single man who has been selling cell phone accessories for six years. His day begins at 8am and finishes at 6pm. This is his second loan and he only needs 100,000 CFA francs at the present time. With this money, he will purchase accessories such as chargers, earphones, cases, etc.

Given that his stock is not extensive enough, he plans to expand his store in the future, but he would also like to open a ready-to-wear boutique.

loans.use: To purchase cell phone accessories to sell.

loans.name: Long

texts.en:
Long is thirty-six years old and is married to Sem, forty. Together they have four children. They live in their own home in Prey Chor district of Kompong Cham province. Long is kind and friendly to local people around her commune. She has been involved in the agriculture business for over twenty years. She began this work alongside her spouse in order to provide for their family's basic necessities, particularly to feed and educate her school-age children. 

Long is applying for a loan to buy cows to work on her farmland as well as for breeding. This loan will contribute to improving her farming business and she hopes to get good harvests in the future. This will be her fifth loan with HKL, and she is committed to repaying it on time.

loans.use: to buy cows to work on her farmland and to use for breeding.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen lives in Yei. She runs a food stall, and has been in business for three years. She is twenty-nine years old, married, and has three children; all of them are still in school. 

Helen heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer, and this is her forth loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 3,000 SDG in order to purchase beans and rice. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase beans and rice to sell.

loans.name: Adjo

texts.fr:
Adjo est une femme âgée de 34 ans. Elle est mariée å un enseignant. Elle a 3 enfants, qui vont à l’école. Le premier a 8 ans et le dernier a 4 ans.
Adjo travaille comme revendeuse depuis 1997. Elle vend du yaourt mélangé à du mil, du couscous et de l’eau pour tous clients en ville. Elle achète les produits à Lomé. Elle travaille seule. Au moment, sa difficulté principale est de ne pouvoir satisfaire toutes les demandes.
Adjo a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter du couscous, du sucre, de l’eau et un congélateur. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Adjo voudrait industrialiser son activité. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Adjo is a 34 year old woman. She is married to a teacher. She has 3 children, who all attend school. the eldest is 8 years old, and the youngest 4. Adjo has been working as a reseller since 1997. She sells yoghurt blended with cornmeal, couscous and water for her customers in the city. She buys her raw materials in Lomé. She works on her own. Currently her biggest difficulty is not being able to keep up with demand. 
Adjo is seeking her first loan with WAGES in order to buy couscous, sugar, water and a freezer. She wants to invest in her business. In the coming years, she would like to industrialise her activity. She says that with her profits she intends to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, couscous and a freezer

loans.name: Cheikh

texts.fr:
Monsieur Cheikh est un jeune de 34 ans, marié et père de 2 enfants de 5 ans et 4 ans. Il loge en centre ville ou il exerce aussi son activité de vente d’habits prêts à porter (tee-shirt, casquettes, jeans, ensembles pour enfants). Métier qu’il exerce depuis 11 ans. Il possède un magasin  qu’il a ouvert avec ses propres moyens. Seulement là il a besoin d’un crédit de 400000F CFA pour compléter  quelques bagages manquants parmi ceux qu’il expose déjà.
Il gère les besoins de ses enfants et de sa femme.
Et comme projet futur, il veut agrandir son espace commercial.
texts.en: Cheikh is a young man of 34, married and the father of two children aged 5 and 4. He lives in the city centre, where he also carries out his business selling ready-to-wear clothing (t-shirts, caps, jeans, children's outfits). He has been doing this for 11 years. He has a shop which he opened with his own resources. He just needs a loan of 400,000 CFA to plug some gaps in his existing product range. He meets his childrens' and his wife's living expenses. In the future, he wants to increase the size of his shopfloor.

loans.use: to buy ready-to-wear clothing for sale in his shop

loans.name: Ama

texts.fr:
Ama est une femme âgé(e) de 33 ans. Elle est mariée å un  maraicher. Elle a 07 enfants, dont 05 à l’école. Le premier a 15 ans et le dernier a 8mois.  
Ama travaille comme revendeuse de pains depuis 2006. Elle étale son pain au bord de la route pour tous clients désireux de s’approvisionner pour leur famille. Elle est aidée par sa sœur et s’approvisionne dans une boulangerie de la place.
Ama a requis son second crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter plus de pains pour pouvoir satisfaire la demande de ses clients. Elle veut construire sur son terrain . 
Dans les prochaines années, Ama voudrait devenir une boulangère. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, Elle prévoit d’assurer les meilleures conditions à ses enfants.
texts.en:
Ama is a 33 year old woman. She is married to a market gardener. She has 7 children, 5 of whom are in school. The eldest is 15, and the youngest 8 months old. Ama has been working as a bread seller since 2006. She displays her bread on the roadside for her customers wishing to buy for their family. She is assisted by her sister, and buys her bread from a local baker. Ama is seeking her second loan from WAGES in order to buy more bread to meet her customers' demand.
She wants to build on her land. In the future, Ama would like to become a baker. She says that with her profits, she intends to assure the best possible living conditions for her children.

loans.use: to buy loaves of bread

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
La señora Julia desea iniciar un negocio de venta de comida para ayudar a su esposo en los gastos familiares, pero no cuenta con el dinero necesario para invertir en la compra de materia prima e inmueble para el negocio. Es por eso que solicita un préstamo y emprender su venta de comida en su propia casa y así también atender a su familia. 
Con una parte de las ganancias que obtiene su esposo de su taller de eléctrico automotriz planean pagar el crédito. 
Doña Julia trabajaba de ayudante en un puesto de comida y desea iniciar su propio negocio.
texts.en: Julia wishes to start a business selling food to help her husband with the family expense but she does not have the money necessary to invest in the purchase of ingredients and property for the business. It is for this that she is requesting a loan and to launch selling food in her own home and also attend to her family. They plan to pay the loan with a part of the earnings that her husband obtains from his automotive electrical workshop. Julia worked as an assistant in a food stand and wishes to start her own business.

loans.use: to start a business selling food.

loans.name: Tatiana Del Carmen

texts.es: Tatiana de 24 años de edad, es casada y madre de 2 hijos en las edades de 3 y 6 años; ella  es la propietaria de una peluquería ubicada en Puerto Colombia, un municipio del departamento del Atlántico muy cerca al mar. Allí en su cálida  orilla y bajo la constante brisa  producidas por los famosos vientos alisios,  comenzó su oferta de servicios de servicios de pedicure y manicure,  en un salón de belleza de un familiar; actividad que había  aprendido empíricamente, luego ofreció los servicios de belleza a amigos y vecinos de manera simultanea a su trabajo y posteriormente aprendió la técnica de belleza en una academia, donde permaneció preparándose  18 meses y   perfeccionó sus conocimientos. Sus  clientes empezaron muy pronto a pedirle servicios a domicilio, pero con la adecuación de un local empezaron a ubicarla y aunque hoy trabaja mediante los dos sistemas,  espera disminuir los domicilios gradualmente y aumentar la afluencia de su clientela en el local, identificado para ofrecer servicios de mejoramiento de imagen personal y profesional. Tatiana tiene su propia casa, que es amplia y ubicada en un sector muy popular del Municipio, donde no hay muchas peluquerías. En la primera habitación,  planea organizar aun más su local, equipándolo de todos los muebles necesarios para atraer su mercado potencial y acomodar su mercado real en un sitio muy confortable. En temporada alta, cuenta con el apoyo de su madre y de su hermana en la atención de sus clientes. En la actualidad está aplicando a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará equipos como sillas metálicas de peluquería y un lava cabezas. Su inversión proyecta ser exitosa porque goza de reconocimiento en su población y su equipamiento impulsará su efectivo trabajo.
texts.en:
Tatiana is 24 years old, is married and mother to two children who are 3 and 6 years old. She is the proprietor of a hair salon located in Puerto Colombia, a town in the department of Atlantico, very close to the sea. There on the warm shore and under the constant breeze produced by the famous tradewinds, she began to offer her pedicure and manicure services in a family member's beauty salon, an activity that she had learned by example. Then she offered her beauty services to friends and neighbors simultaneous to her job and later learned beauty techniques in an academy where she studied for 18 months and perfected her knowledge.

Very soon her customers began to request at home services but with the adequacy of a shop. They began to locate her and although today she works through the two systems she hopes to diminish gradually the home services and expand the flow of customers to the shop identified by offering services to improve one's personal and professional image.

Tatiana has her own house which is large and located in a very popular sector of the town where there are not a lot of hair salons. In the first room she even plans to organize her shop, equipping it with all the necessary furniture to attract her potential market and accomodate her actual market in a very comfortable place. In peak season, she has the support of her mother and her sister to attend to her customers. Currently, she is applying to CrediKiva, the first financing that Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo has made and with which she will buy equipment like metallic salon chairs and hair washers. Her investment is projected to be successful because she enjoys recognition in her community and her equipment will boost work effectively.

loans.use: to purchase equipment like metallic beautyshop chairs and hair washers.

loans.name: Pumamarca Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “PUMAMARCA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Emiliana; ella es casada y tiene 49 años y tiene 1 hijo; La socia trabaja con su negocio de agricultura, ella tiene un terreno de cultivo donde siembra verduras y hortalizas como repollo,cebolla,beterraga entre otras verduras, la socia también se dedica al negocio de crianza de animales como cuyes, tanto los animales como las verduras la socia vende en el mercado, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a su hijo, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar los negocios de venta de verduras y crianza de animales. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar abono, semillas y fertilizantes para las tierras de cultivo y también para comprar cuyes.
 Los otros socios  se dedican al negocio de venta de animales, negocio de taller de carpintería, negocio de venta de chicha, negocio de  venta de pollos, negocio de crianza de verduras.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the "Pumamarca" community bank. This bank is located in the district of Cusco, belonging to the province and department of Cusco.

The member is Emiliana. She is married and is 49 years old and has one son. The member works with her farming business. She has farmland where she plants vegetables like cabbage, onion, beets, among others. The member also is dedicated to a business raising animals like guinea pigs. The member sells as much animals as vegatables in the market. Through this business, the member will get her son ahead. She wishes to expand and improve the businesses selling vegetables and raising animals. The member is requesting the loan to purchase fertilizer and seeds for her farmland and also to buy guinea pigs.

The other members are dedicated to the business of selling animals, a carpenter shop, a business selling "chicha" (a drink), a business selling chicken, a business  producing vegetables. 

The member is thankful to those who form part of this dream in this manner and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and seeds for farmland and also to buy guinea pigs.

loans.name: Leonardo

texts.es:
El señor Leonardo y su esposo de dedican a la venta de ropa, juguetes, aparatos eléctricos y accesorios en diferentes partes de la ciudad de Nuevo Laredo. Están solicitando un préstamo para invertir en compro de mercancía y  compra de un vehículo y así poder mover en diferentes partes su mercancía sin problema, también desean invertir en un pequeño negocio de venta de dulces, frutas y raspas. 
Con las ganancias que obtiene de su negocio solventan los gastos familiares y los gastos escolares de sus tres hijas que estudian la primaria y secundaria.
Desean darles un mejor futuro y una carrera profesional.
texts.en:
Leonardo and his wife are dedicated to selling clothes, toys, electric appliances and accessories in different parts of the city of Nuevo Laredo. They are requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of merchandise and to buy a vehicle and thereby be able to move their merchandise in different parts without a problem. Also, they wish to invest in a small business selling sweets, fruit and "raspas" (snow cones). 

With the earnings that they obtain from their business, they will pay the family bills and education fees for their three daughters that study at elementary and secondary school. They wish to give them a better future and a professional career.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise and a vehicle for the business selling clothes.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice lives in Yei. She sells food from a stall and has been in business for three years. She is 29 years old, married, and has three children, all of whom are still in school. Alice heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer, and this is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of $500 in order to purchase beans and rice. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase beans and rice to sell.

loans.name: Aventura - 26 Group

texts.es: El banco de emprendimiento aventura esta compuesta por nueve integrantes, ocho mujeres y un varón,  La señora Gabriela es la presidenta de la banca tiene 43 años y es casada con 2 hijos que son de las edades de 13 y 21 años, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa y artículos varios ella vende en la localidad de Guanay, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la señora Gabriela utilizara  este préstamo para compra de ropa utensilios y otros por su negocio, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es para incrementar su capital de trabajo,  la señora Gabriela enfrenta retos en su negocio que son innovación de  nuevos productos, y utilizara los beneficios mejorando la calidad de vida de su familia,  sueña logar obtener un negocio fijo para ya no volver a viajar y así poder estar mas cerca de su familia, se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: The 'Aventura' community bank has nine members: eight women and one man.  Gabriela is the bank's president.  She is 43 years old, married, and has two children who are 13 and 21 years old.  Her business is selling clothing and a variety of other products.  She makes her sales in the town of Guanay.  This loan is her first with the institution.  Gabriela will use her loan to buy clothing, utensils and other products for her business.  Her reason for requesting this loan is to increase her working capital.  She faces challenges in her business such as the innovation of new products.  She will use the profits she makes to improve her family's quality of life.  Gabriela dreams of having a fixed business so that she no longer has to travel and can therefore be nearer her family.  She feels happy and grateful to the institution for the support they are providing.

loans.use: to buy clothing, utensils and other products

loans.name: Zoila

texts.es: Zoila de 58 años de edad vive desde hace 28 años  en el sur occidente de la ciudad, desde que procedente de Pedraza en el departamento del Magdalena, de donde es oriunda llegó a Barranquilla. Hace 16 años quedó viuda y se dedicó a la comercialización de queso para genera ingresos con los que apoyar su hogar. En la actualidad aun sigue vendiendo queso  y adicionó pescado, procedente de su tierra natal, lugar donde vive su hijo. Con su trabajo ha logrado progresar con sus 7 hijos, que  en este momento son profesionales y se encuentran en las edades de 24 a 38 años. Sus principales compradores son las panaderías, tiendas y familias  que conocen la calidad y la frescura de sus productos.  Su sueño es que sus hijos tengan su propia casa y ayudarlos a sacar adelante a sus nietos. En la actualidad esta aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará queso, en mayor volumen que el acostumbrado y que es el producto que mas vende y su clientela se ha incrementado. Su inversión será exitosa porque responderá a pedidos de sus clientes y con ella rotará rápidamente su cartera y esto hace que aumente su capital de trabajo y en consecuencia  sus utilidades
texts.en: Zoila, 58 years old, has lived for 28 years in the south west of the city from Pedraza in the department of Magdalena from where she is a native and arrived to Barranquilla. For 16 years she has been a widow and she dedicated herself to selling cheese to generate income to support her household. Currently, although she continues to sell cheese, she added fish, from her homeland a place where her son lives. With her work, she has been able to get her 7 children ahead who, at this moment, are professionals and are between the ages of 24 and 38 years old. Her main buyers are bakeries, shops and families who know the quality and freshness of her products. Her dream is that her children have their own homes and to help them get her grandchildren ahead. Currently, she is applying to CrediKiva, the first loan that the Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo has made, with which she will buy cheese in greater volume than usual since this is the product she sells the most and her customers have increased. Her investment will be successful because she will respond to her customers orders and she will quickly rotate her portfolio and this will increase her working capital and her utilities, as a consequence.

loans.use: to buy cheese in greater volume than usual.

loans.name: Andres Rodrigo

texts.es: El Sr. Andrés tiene 23 años y es Soltero no tiene hijos, se dedica  a la confección de deportivos, su taller  se encuentran en la zona de Alto Kupini, este  préstamo es la segunda secuencia que tiene dentro de la institución, el Sr.  Andrés utilizara este  préstamo de para compra de material de construcción para la remodelación de su taller por esta razón  solicita este préstamo es para agrandar su  taller de confección, el Sr.  Andrés enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la apertura de tiendas de venta de deportivos y utilizara los beneficios del crédito aumentara la producción, con el tiempo desea agrandar su taller y contratar mano de obra y así dar oportunidad a otras personas jóvenes y emprendedoras.
texts.en: Andrés is 23, single, and childless.  He makes sports clothing.  His workshop is located in the area of La Paz known as Alto Kupini. This loan is the second in a series that he has received from microfinance partner Emprender.  Andrés will use this loan to buy construction materials so he can remodel his workshop because he wants to make it bigger. It is a challenging time for his business because of the opening of sports stores, and he will use his loan to increase his production.  Over time, he wants to enlarge his workshop and hire workers and thereby give opportunities to other young and enterprising people.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Norma Alicia

texts.es:
La señora Norma Alicia desea empezar un nuevo negocio para el que necesita comprar lo que es el inventario que es accesorios para celulares, cargadores y equipos de celular, razón por la cual esta solicitando el crédito ya que no cuenta con el capital suficiente para iniciar su nuevo negocio.
Doña Norma Alicia tiene un negocio de preparación y venta de comida desde haces mas de 12 años ya tiene su propias clientes. Con las ganancias que obtiene de este negocio planea pagar el crédito y después es que su nuevo negocio tengas ya sus propios clientes y ganancias, tendrá dos ingreso para poder salir adelante con su familia ya que tiene dos hijos que actual mente están estudiando.
texts.en:
Norma Alicia would like to start a new business and needs to buy stock (cell phone accessories, chargers, cell phone equipment).  She is requesting this loan as she doesn't have enough capital to start her new business.

Norma Alicia currently has a business preparing and selling food which she has been working in for more than 12 years and she already has her own customers.  She plans to use her profits from this business to repay her loan and, after her new business has its own customers and profits, she will have two incomes so that she can provide for her family.  She has two children who are currently studying.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for a new business

loans.name: Phal

texts.en: Phal, 23, has been with HKL for a few years. She is an honest client of our firm. She is now requesting a new loan to purchase a secondhand motorcycle for home and business use. Due to the lack of a family-owned vehicle, there are some difficulties in traveling, and so her family has more expenses besides their daily needs. Phal is married and lives with her husband and a young kid in Prey Chor district, Kompong Cham province. She believes this loan will result in improving business productivity and help her family. For this reason, she hopes this new financing will bring better living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a secondhand motorcycle for home and business use.

loans.name: Las Palmeras Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LAS PALMERASI”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco. 
La socia es la Sra. Delia es la señora que aparece anexada a la foto grupal ; ella tiene  44 años de edad y es conviviente;  La socia tiene 2 hijos y ella es enfermera de profesión la socia es una mujer muy trabajadora y paralelamente a su trabajo en un hospital muy reconocido, ella brinda el servicio de enfermería particular y de servicios conexos; la socia esta en esta oportunidad requiriendo el préstamo para invertir en la compra de materiales para revestir su fachada en su propia vivienda, la socia desea poder mejorar su casa y en esta ocasión comprar materiales para invertir en la mejora de sus vivienda, en especial de su fachada. La socia comprar materiales como cemento, pintura, yeso para revestir su fachada. 
Los otros socios se dedican  a diferentes actividades como por ejemplo, a la atención de su tienda de abarrotes, a la venta de chicha. A prestar servicio de taxi, a trabajar en un hospedaje, a la artesanía, a la atención y venta de celulares.
La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos
texts.en:
The member belongs to the "Las Palmeras" community bank. The bank is located in the district of Huanchac, belonging to the province of Cusco and department of Cusco.

The member is Delia who appears attached to the group photo. She is 44 years old and lives with her partner. The member has two children and she is a nurse, by profession. She is a very hard-working woman and, parallel to her job in a very well known hospital, she provides special nursing and related service. The member, at this time, is requiring the loan to invest in the purchase of materials to redecorate the facade of her own house. The member wishes to be able to improve her house and, at this time, to buy materials to invest in the improvement of her house, especially the facade. The member will buy materials like cement, paint, plaster to redo the facade. 

The other members are dedicated to activities like, for example, attending a grocery shop, selling "chicha" (a drink), taxi service, lodging work, crafts, and selling cell phones. The member is happy for the loan and promises to make the repayments.

loans.use: to buy materials like cement, paint, plaster to redecorate the facade.

loans.name: Antony

texts.en:
Antony is 60 years old, and he does flower farming to earn a living. He has been in the business for 5 years and describes his business environment as good because there is limited competition. To earn extra income he does dairy farming. 

Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to improve his living standards and hopes to expand his business to large scale flower farming in the future. He has applied for 20,000 Kenya Shillings to buy flower seeds for planting.

loans.use: To buy flower seeds for planting.

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael is 40 years old and married with 2 children. He sells skirts, bags and sweaters to earn a living. He has been in the business for 13 years and describes his business environment as competitive because many people do the same business. To earn extra income he runs a cereals store. 

Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to finance his business and hopes to open a boutique in the future. He has applied for 40,000 Kenya Shillings to buy skirts, bags and sweaters for resale.

loans.use: To buy skirts, bags and sweaters for resale.

loans.name: Clemence

texts.en:
Clemence is a resident of Malindi, Kenya. She has four children, two of whom are in school. Clemence has a retail shop which has been in operation for one year. She was first employed as a salonist and saved some money which she used as capital to open her retail shop.

She was introduced to Milango and joined in order to access credit. She is applying for a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to purchase new stock of retail items, e.g. vegetables, onions, potatoes, etc.

Clemence intends to pay school fees and her house rent from the additional income obtained from this loan. She also intends to open a larger store in the next two years. The only challenges are the high cost of transport and the high cost of produce, which drives the prices beyond the reach of most of her customers.

loans.use: To purchase a stock of retail items, e.g. vegetables, onions, potatoes, etc.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Samuel is applying for his third loan from KADET LTD after repaying the previous loans successfully. He will use the loan to buy spare parts for his business. With the anticipated profit from the business he will educate his children. His hopes and dreams are to open a garage business which will help him improve the living standard of his family.

loans.use: To add stock of spare parts for sale.

loans.name: Kisarawe Group

texts.en:
Magreth, who is in her mid 30s, is married with three children who are still going to school.  She has been a tailor for three months now.  She works from 9:00 am to 9:00 pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit. 

This will be her 1st loan from Tujijenge Tanzania which she wants to use for buying more materials to make more dresses, and for more fabrics to resell.  Her dream is to one day be able to buy an overlapping machine.

She will share this loan with her loan group "Kisarawe", which has a total of 21 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: to buy more materials to make more dresses, and for more fabrics to resell.

loans.name: Salamata Samba

texts.fr:
Madame Salamata Samba qui est née en 1957, exerce le métier d’agriculteur depuis 22 ans. Elle possède des terres qu’elle exploite à moitié. Elle fait du maraichage et a besoin de ce crédit pour acheter des intrants agricoles (riz-oignons-choux).
Elle est mariée et c’est elle qui s’occupe de la dépense quotidienne. Avec  l’appui des préteurs, elle va réussir à augmenter son périmètre cultural. En dehors de cela, elle rêve d’ouvrir une boutique pour diversifier son activité.
texts.en:
Salamata Samba was born in 1957 and has been working as a farmer for the past 22 years.  She owns some land, half of which she exploits.  She grows garden vegetables and needs this loan to buy agricultural inputs (rice, onions, cabbage).
She is married and handles the daily expenses.  With support from her lenders, she will be able to exploit more land.  She also dreams of opening a shop in order to diversify her activity.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs: rice, onions, cabbage...

loans.name: Améléyassi

texts.fr:
Améléyassi est une femme âgé(e) de 34 ans. Elle est mariée à un enseignant. Elle a 02 enfants dont 01 scolarisé. L’ainé a 04ans et le dernier 02ans.
Améléyassi travaille comme revendeuse de pagnes depuis 2003. Elle vend des pagnes au marché à toutes personnes et s'approvisionne à Lomé.
Améléyassi a requis son pemier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des pagnes. Elle veut acheter un terrain
Dans les prochaines années, Améléyassi voudrait avoir une boutique de vente de pagnes. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, Elle prévoit d'assurer les meilleures conditions de vie à ses enfants.
texts.en:
Améléyassi is 34 years old. She is married to a teacher and has 2 children, one of whom attends school. The eldest child is 4, and the youngest 2.

Améléyassi has been selling pagnes (highly colourful and decorative West African sarong-like clothing) since 2003. She sells the pagnes at the market to all sorts of customers, and gets her supplies in Lomé.

Améléyassi has requested her first loan from WAGES in order to buy some pagnes. She would like to buy some land. In the coming years, Améléyassi would like to have her own shop selling pagnes. She plans to use her profits to improve her children's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy some pagnes.

loans.name: Abdrahmane

texts.fr:
Abdrahmane est un jeune qui vend des accessoires de portables. Il a une expérience de 4 ans dans ce domaine. Il est marié et père de 2 enfants. Abdrahmane est à sa 1ère expérience dans le crédit. Il a du recourir  à ce dernier  parce sa clientèle dés fois lui demande des  produits qu’il ne possède pas et c’est pour cette raison qu’il sollicite un crédit de 300000F CFA. 
Il s’occupe de la dépense quotidienne de son foyer grâce aux bénéfices de son activité .Il réussi aussi à mettre un peu d’argent de coté car il a comme projet d’aménager sa boutique.
texts.en:
Abdrahmane is a young man who sells mobile phone accessories. He has 4 years experience in this line of work. He is married and the father of 2 children.

This is Abdrahmane's first loan. He has had to ask for credit as his customers occasionally ask him for products that he does not have; this is why he is requesting a loan of 300 000 francs.

Abdrahmane is able to cover his household's daily expenses thanks to the profits from his business. He is also able to set a little money aside for the future refurbishment of his shop.

loans.use: to buy mobile phone accessories for resale.

loans.name: Sirajat

texts.fr:
Sirajat est une femme âgé(e) de 37 ans. Elle est mariée å un  tailleur. Elle a 01 enfant de 04ans.
Sirajat travaille comme revendeuse de produits d’alimentation générale depuis 1991. Elle exerce seule son activité dans une boutique et s’approvisionne à Lomé.
Sirajat a requis son second crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des produits d’alimentation générale. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Sirajat voudrait augmenter le niveau d’activité. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, Elle prévoit d’améliorer le niveau de vie de la famille.
texts.en:
Sirajat, 37, is married to a tailor. She has one child who is 4 years old. 

Sirajat has been working selling groceries since 1991. She works alone in a store and buys her wares in Lomé.

Sirajat has requested her second loan from WAGES to buy grocery stock. She wants to reinvest in her business. 

In the coming years, Sirajat would like to expand her business. She says that she plans to use the profit to improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her general store.

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en:
Mohammed is 32 years old, and he lives in Sana`a, Yemen. He is well-known in his area for his great charisma and good will in helping other people. He is married and the father of three children to whom he has always wish to give a good education, offering them the best he could. For many years he has been operating an optical business. He learned the trade while working with someone else in small optical shop, but since he felt his job was not well paid he decided to become independent and set up his own business. He is an enthusiastic man and a responsible hard worker who makes a living honorably. He considers it a profitable business because the profit that it earns permits him to maintain his family and to reinvest in his business, as well as due to the reception that his products continue to have.

As he is putting all of his efforts into developing this business in order to achieve success, he needs to increase the variety of inventory  in his shop to meet his clients' demands. So he is requesting a loan of 200,000 YER from AMB to buy lenses and glasses for his business so that he is able to cover his clients' needs.

In the future, Mohammed wants his children to have a better lifestyle and access to a university education.

loans.use: to buy lenses and glasses for his business so that he is able to cover his clients' needs.

loans.name: Anna Jean

texts.en:
Anna Jean is 36 years old and married. She has four children ages 1, 2, 12 and 15. She owns a passenger boat that transports people from her town, Sagasa Bien Unido, to the mainland town of Talibon, a town an hour and a half away from hers. Anna Jean hires a boatman to operate her boat. Anna Jean earns 8000 PHP per month with her business.

Anna Jean has requested a loan to purchase gasoline and paint for the boat. She hopes to earn better and save for her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase gasoline and paint for the boat

loans.name: Rougui

texts.fr:
Madame Rougui  est une femme de 49 ans qui fait de la vente de légumes depuis  20 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de  5 enfants dont l’ainé a 20 ans et le plus jeune, 10 ans.
Elle  est à son 1er crédit et voudrait augmenter son stock  c’est pourquoi elle sollicite un crédit de 100.000F CFA pour acheter des choux, carottes, navets... . Rougui est une brave femme qui appui son mari dans la gestion de la dépense quotidienne. Elle a comme projet d’avenir, l’ouverture d’une boutique.
texts.en:
Rougui is 49 years old and has been selling vegetables for 20 years. She is married and the mother of 5 children aged between 10 and 20.

This is Rougui's first loan and she would like to increase her stock, which is why she is requesting 100 000 francs with which to buy vegetables including cabbage, carrots and turnips.

Rougui is a good woman who supports her husband with the management of the daily expenses. In the future, she plans to open a shop.

loans.use: to buy vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Anite

texts.en:
Anite lives in Yei. She sells food out of a stall and has been in business for three years. She is 30 years old, married, and has four children; two of them are still in school. 

Anite heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer and this is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 SDG in order to purchase beans and tomatoes. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase tomatoes and beans for sale.

loans.name: Khim

texts.en:
Khim is a 30-year-old farmer from Dongkor commune, Phnom Penh city. He is married and lives with his wife and a lovely young child. The main source of income for the family is from construction and garment work. He has worked in the construction field for almost ten years, while his wife is a sewing staff person. This couple have tried hard in their physical work to make earnings for the family. Typically, Khim is able generate approximately USD 5.00 per day.

Khim requested credit from Kiva, through HKL, to purchase window frames and zinc to have his house constructed. Khim is very grateful for the funds that will enable his family to be in a comfortable house.

loans.use: to purchase window frames and zinc to have his house constructed.

loans.name: Rhodah

texts.en:
Rhodah is 27 years old and a mother of children between five and nine years. She is married to Richard, who is an artisan.

Rhodah sells green maize. She has been in this business for the last two years and is able to make a monthly income of KES 5,000. 

She is now taking her first loan from KADET Ltd., which she will use to buy a stock of green maize for sale. 

She will use anticipated profits to educate her children. Her dream is to own a big business.

loans.use: To buy a stock of green maize for sale.

loans.name: Peninah

texts.en:
Peninah has been in the cereals business in Nakuru town for the last three years. She is a 29-year-old single lady with one son.

She was introduced to KADET Ltd. by one of our field officers during awareness, and this will be her first loan. She plans to use the loan to buy more stock of cereals like green grams and maize for sale in her business.

In the future, Peninah hopes to expand her business and supply cereals to other parts of Nakuru.

loans.use: To buy more cereals for sale.

loans.name: Nura

texts.en:
Nura lives in Yei. She sells charcoal and has been in business for two years. She is 30 years old, married, and has five children. All of them are still in school. 

Nura heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer this is her third loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 1,500 SDG in order to purchase charcoal. 

She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian lives in Yei. She operates a food stall and has been in business for two years. She is 30 years old, married, and has four children. All of them are still in school.
 
Vivian heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer, and this is her second loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 800 SDG in order to purchase beans and rice. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase beans and rice for sale.

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.fr:
Adjoa est une femme âgé(e) de 38 ans. Elle est mariée å un conducteur de taxi-moto. Elle a 03 enfants, dont 02 à l’école. Le premier a 10 ans et le dernier a 02 ans.  
Adjoa travaille comme revendeuse de teck et de claies depuis 2002. Elle sert ses nombreux clients à la maison.
Adjoa a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des tecks. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Adjoa voudrait élargir l’activité dans la vente de charbons de bois et de céréales. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, Elle prévoit assurer l’éducation de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Adjoa, 38, is married to a motorcycle taxi driver. She has three children, of whom two are in school. The oldest is 10 and the youngest two years old. 

Adjoa has been selling teak and reeds since 2002. She serves numerous clients out of her home. 

Adjoa has requested her first loan from WAGES to use to buy teak. She wants to reinvest in her business. In the coming years, Adjoa wants to expand into selling charcoal and cereals. She says that she plans to use the profit for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy teak and reeds.

loans.name: Tom

texts.en:
Tom is 24 years old. He does drawing and painting to earn a living. He has been in the business for six years and has employed one person. He describes his business environment as favorable because there is limited competition. To earn extra income he sells timber. 

Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to improve his living standards and hopes to expand his business in the future. 

He has applied for 30,000 KES to buy drawing materials and color paint.

loans.use: To buy drawing materials and color paint.

loans.name: Simon Maina

texts.en:
Simon is 32 years old from Ndunyu and is married to Teresia. They have two children who are both in school.

Simon has been farming for the past three years. He has applied for his third loan from KADET Ltd. to enable him to buy fertilizers, seedlings and spraying chemicals and to pay for labor.

He hopes to diversify into cattle rearing in the future.

loans.use: to buy more retail products such as rice, sugar and bar soap.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en: Hellen is 47 years old and married with four children. She runs a photocopy shop to earn a living. She has been in the business for 10 years and has employed one person. She describes her business environment as competitive because many people do the same business. To earn extra income she does maize farming. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to educate her children and hopes to own a big photocopy shop in the future. She has applied for 90,000 Kenya Shillings to buy a photocopy machine.

loans.use: To buy a photocopy machine.

loans.name: Apayi

texts.en:
Apayi lives in Yei. She sells fish and has been in business for two years. She is 29 years old, married, and has three children. All of them are still in school. 

Apayi heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer this is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 SDG in order to purchase fish. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase fish for sale.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is a 28-year-old lady from Kisumu County in the West of Kenya. She is married to John and they have three children, age 10, 8 and 5 years.

Irene is a fish monger, a business she has been doing for the last two years. She makes a monthly income of KES 10,000. She is now taking her first loan from KADET Ltd., which she will use to buy a stock of fresh fish for sale. Her profits will be used to stock more fish and also to provide the basic needs of her family.

Her dream is to own a big fish business in Kisumu town.

loans.use: To buy fresh fish for sale.

loans.name: Senderu

texts.en:
Senderu lives in Yei. She sells fish and has been in business for two years. She is 29 years old, married, and has three children. All of them are still in school.
 
Senderu heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer and this is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 700 SDG in order to purchase fish. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase fish for sale.

loans.name: Jenifer

texts.en:
Jenifer lives in Yei. She sells charcoal and has been in business for one years. She is 42 years old, married, and has four children; all of them are still in school. 

Jenifer heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer and this is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 SDG in order to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty lives in Yei. She sells fish and has been in business for two years. She is 30 years old, married, and has four children; all of them are still in school.
 
Betty heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer and this is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 SDG in order to purchase fish. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase fish for sale.

loans.name: Augustina

texts.en: Augustina is 54 years old and a mother of five children. She runs a medical clinic to earn a living. She has been in the business for five years and has employed one person. She describes her business environment as good because she has many clients. She sells cereals to earn extra income. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to educate her children and hopes to expand her business to a nursing home in the future. She has applied for 70,000 Kenya Shillings to buy medicine and furniture.

loans.use: To buy medicine and furniture.

loans.name: Tintina

texts.fr:
Madame  TINTINA est âgée de  57 ans, mariée et mère de 3 enfants,  et  vit seule avec  son mari et ses enfants  dans  la ville de koutiala.  
Madame TINTINA n’a pas fréquenté l’école, elle est  victime de l’époque où les filles n’avaient pas le droit d’aller à l’école, raison pour laquelle elle s’est intéressée au commerce qu’elle apprit auprès de sa maman.  Elle exerce cette activité  il y a  plus de 10 ans. Sa notoriété est bonne, car le Sounbala est l’un des condiments le plus  prisé par les femmes,  pour  cela cette  activité lui procure de bénéfice.  
Pour augmenter son fonds de commerce afin d’élargir son activité, TINTINA intégra l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso depuis 6 ans.   Elle a pris 6 prêts dans un groupe ( prêt solidaire ) tous  remboursés  correctement  et elle est à son 5e  prêt individuel et quatre précédents ont été  correctement remboursés. Avec ce prêt, elle compte acheter 10 sacs de noix de néré  auprès des stockeurs de Koutiala qui seront transformés en Sounbala et vendus à Bamako et à Kayes à une clientèle constituée  de femmes, en détail, en gros et  au comptant.  Elle compte sur un bénéfice mensuel de 120.000FCFA qu’elle envisage utiliser pour le  remboursement des taux d’intérêts de Soro et contribuer à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille. Dans ses perspectives, Madame TINTINA  compte élargir son activité dans l’avenir.
texts.en:
Tintina is 57 years old, married and mother to three children. She lives alone with her husband and children in the town of Koutiala. Tintina did not go to school; she was a victim of the time when girls did not have the right to go to school, and for this reason she became interested in the business which she learnt from her mother. She has been carrying out this business for more than ten years now and has a good reputation, because "sounbala" (a condiment made from pounding and fermenting "néré" nuts) is one of the most popular condiments with women, and thus she can make good money from this business. 

In order to grow her business, Tintina joined the microfinance institution, Soro,Yiriwaso, six years ago. She has participated in six group loans (solidarity loans) which have all been repaid in full, and she is now on her fifth individual loan, the previous four having also been repaid in full. With this loan, she is planning to buy 10 sacks of "néré" nuts from stockists in Koutiala and these will be made up into "sounbala" and sold on a retail and wholesale basis and for cash in Bamako and Kayes to a customer base made up of women, 

She is expecting to make a monthly profit of 120,000FCFA, which she is planning to use to repay interest to Soro and to contribute to improving her family's living conditions.  In this context, Tintina is planning to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy  "néré" nuts

loans.name: Malkia Group

texts.en:
Tea, who is in her early 20s, is married.  She has been a tailor for three years now.  She works from 6:00 am to 9:00 pm daily and is able to make a very good monthly profit.

This will be her 2nd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loan to buy materials, fabrics, and sarongs and has paid back her loan successfully. She wants a loan to buy sewing products, more materials and fabrics. Her dream is to one day be able to build her own house. 

She will share this loan with her loan group "Malkia" which has total of 19 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: to buy sewing products, more materials and fabrics.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret, age 38, operates a tailoring business. She has been engaged in this work for nine years and makes a monthly income of Kes 15,000. She lives in the town of Kisumu and is the single mother of six children, aged between five and 20 years old.

She recently joined KADET Ltd and is now taking out her first loan, which she will use to buy a stock of textile material to be used in tailoring. Her profits will be used to supplement her business with additional stock textile materials.

Her dream is to own a tailoring school.

loans.use: to buy a stock of textile materials

loans.name: Reida

texts.en:
Reida, age 30, lives in Yei. She prepares and sells food items at a food stall and has been in business for two years. She and her husband have four children, three of whom are still in school. 

Reida heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer, and this is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 700 in order to purchase beans and maize flour. 

She will use the extra income generated from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase bean and maize flour

loans.name: Viwalo

texts.fr:
Viwalo est une femme âgé(e) de 33 ans. Elle est célibataire. 
Viwalo travaille comme revendeuse de produits congelés depuis 2005. Elle vend à la maison et s’approvisionne dans une société de vente de produits congelés de la place.
Viwalo a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des produits congelés. Elle veut épargner.
Dans les prochaines années, Viwalo voudrait ouvrir une boutique d’alimentation générale.  Elle dit qu’avec les profits, Elle prévoit payer les frais de scolarité de ses frère et sœur.
texts.en:
Viwalo, 33 years old, is single. She has been selling frozen foods since 2005. She sells out of her home and buys her wares from a local frozen food company.  

Viwalo requested her first loan from WAGES to buy frozen foods. She would like to put aside savings. 

In the coming years, Viwalo would like to open a general store. She says that with the profit she intends to pay school fees for her brothers and sisters.

loans.use: to buy frozen foods

loans.name: Zapatito Veloz Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ZAPATITO VELOZ” iniciará el decimo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Collpani.  Está compuesta por ocho integrantes y cuentan con una mesa directiva a la cabeza de la misma se encuentra  la señora Filomena. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de cocinas, venta de papas fritas, costura de busos, venta de plásticos en general, costura de chamarras.

La señora Filomena, indica que forma parte de una asociación comunal desde hace seis meses atrás y que en la actualidad ella cuenta con un negocio de venta de mantas, que viene trabajando hace años aprendiendo el mismo de su mamá. El crédito de este ciclo es para ampliación de su mercadería (compra de lana) que adquirirá con la finalidad de elaborara las mantas, este producto lo comprará de las ferias paceñas y posteriormente lo comercializará en su puesto de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite apoyar a su familia pues ella es soltera y tiene dos hijos.

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones y la unidad de su grupo.
texts.en:
The Zapatito Veloz communal bank will start its tenth cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Collpani communal center.  It is comprised of eight members.  They have a board of directors, and Filomena is the head of the board.  The businesses that the members of the community bank are engaged in are varied and include: selling stoves, selling French fries, sewing sweatshirts, selling general plastic products, and sewing jackets.

Filomena says that she has been part of the communal bank for six months.  She currently has a business selling blankets.  She has been working this way for years, and she learned how to do so from her mother.

The loan for this cycle is to increase her merchandise.  She will buy wool to make the blankets.  She will buy this product at the market in La Paz, and she will later sell them at her sales location.  This way of working allows her to support her family; she is single and has two children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer she answered that she likes the trainings and the unity of her group.

loans.use: to buy wool.

loans.name: Alberto

texts.es:
Alberto tiene 37 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos en el distrito de Tambogrande, un distrito dedicado principalmente al cultivo de frutas, las cuales son procesadas para ser exportadas a otros países. Pertenece a la provincia de Piura, en la región del mismo nombre, ubicada a más de tres horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Cuenta con 1.0 ha de terreno agrícola, en el cual ha sembrado limón, el cual cosecha semanalmente. Paralelamente se dedica a labores asociadas a la ganadería, cría ganado ovino.  Las ovejas son criadas para ofrecerlas en venta cuando ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo Con estos ingresos ayuda a su pareja en el sostenimiento diario de la economía familiar.

Alberto, desea que su cultivo tenga una buena producción, por ello trabaja arduamente para lograr su objetivo. Actualmente desea adquirir abonos y pesticidas para brindar mantenimiento a su cultivo y para ayudarse, ha decidido  solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.

Alberto es alguien conocido en la zona, sus vecinos le consideran una persona trabajadora y responsable. Su mayor anhelo es tener éxito en su actual cosecha y en las cosechas futuras para sacar adelante a su familia.
texts.en:
Alberto is 37 years old. He is in a common law marriage and has 3 children in the district of Tambogrande, a district where they mainly grow fruit, which is processed for export to other countries. It belongs to the province of Piura, in the region of the same name, located more than three hours from the city of   Chiclayo.

He has an acre of cropland and has planted lemons, which he harvests every week. He also works raising cattle and sheep. He raises his sheep to sel them when they reach a good size. With this income he helps his spouse with the daily family expenses. 

Alberto wants his crop to have a good yield. That is why he works hard to meet his goal. Right now he wants to acquire fertilizer and pesticides to maintain his crop and for help he decided to ask Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1500 nuevos soles.

Alberto is someone who is known in the area. His neighbors consider him to be a hardworking and responsible person. His greatest wish is for his present crop to be successful and to get his family ahead.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticide for his crop.

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary is a 37-year-old lady from Kisumu City. She is married to Geoffrey and they have five children aged between seven and 19 years old.

Rosemary operates a salon business and has been doing this for the last 11 years, making a monthly income of KES 10,000. She is taking a first loan from KADET LTD which she will use to buy a blow dryer, hair extensions and shampoos. 


She will use her profits to buy more cosmetics. Her dream is to own a big salon.

loans.use: To buy a blow dryer, hair extensions and shampoos.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty lives in Yei. She sells charcoal and has been in business for three years. She is 29 years old, married, and has three children; all of them are still in school. 

Betty heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer and this is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 SDG in order to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Exedina

texts.es:
Exedina tiene 37 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos menores de edad, vive junto a su familia en casa propia, ubicada en el distrito de Olmos, perteneciente a la provincia de Lambayeque, se encuentra ubicado a 2 horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Exedina ha decidido apoyar a su conviviente en el sostenimiento de su familia incursionando en la venta de cosméticos y productos de belleza vía catálogo desde hace 1 año. Ella se esfuerza por mantener su actividad, siempre buscando nuevos clientes a los cuales ofrecerles sus productos.

En los últimos meses su negocio está gozando de muy buena acogida por parte de sus clientes, por lo que está pensando implementar el espacio en su domicilio donde ofrece a sus clientes un stock permanente, de modo que no tengan que esperar siempre por su producto hasta fin de mes, que es cuando llega el pedido. Para lograr su objetivo ella se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Exedina es una madre bastante luchadora y que gusta mucho de sentirse activa. Ella ha sabido ganarse a sus vecinos, los cuales la respetan y estiman mucho.
texts.en:
Exedina, age 37, is in a common-law marriage and has three minor children.  She lives with her family in her own house in the Olmos district, Lambayeque province.  It is located two hours from the city of Chiclayo.

Exedina has decided to help her life partner support their family.  One year ago she started selling cosmetics and beauty products by catalog.  She puts forth a lot of effort to maintain her business activity.  She is always looking for new customers in order to offer them her products.

In the last few months her business has been enjoying a very good reception on the part of her customers.  Therefore, she is thinking of setting up a space in her home where she could offer her customers stock that she has on hand.  That way they will not have to always wait until the end of the month to receive their products, which is when the order arrives.

In order to achieve her objective she has seen the need to request a loan for 1,500 soles from Edpyme Alternativa.  

Exedina is a very tenacious mother, and she really likes to be active.  She has known how to win over her neighbors.  They respect her and hold her in high esteem.

loans.use: to buy beauty products for her stock.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es:
Maribel tiene 32 años y reside junto a su pareja en el distrito de Mochumí, lugar que se encuentra situada a más de veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes en una bodega instalada en uno de los ambientes de su domicilio. Ella suele ofrecer estos productos a los vecinos de la zona, los que siempre acuden a su establecimiento para agenciarse de productos de uso diario. Los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad le sirven para ayudar a su conviviente, quien trabaja en una mototaxi, con el sostenimiento de la economía de su familia.  Paralelamente se dedica a la venta de ganado ovino y caprino.

Maribel desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más productos de modo que pueda responder de mejor modo a la demanda que posee y a la vez arreglar los corrales para poder criar a su ganado.  Es por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Maribel is 32 years old and lives with her spouse in the district of Mochumí, located more than twenty minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

She sells basic necessity products and groceries in the store set up in her house. She offers these products to the area residents, who always go to her store to get the products they use daily. The income she makes from this activity serves to help her spouse, who works driving a motorcycle taxi, with the family expenses. She also sells sheep and goats. 

Maribel wants to enlarge her business by buying more products so she can better respond to demand and also fix the pens where she raises her animals.  That is why she has decided to ask Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1500 nuevos soles.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to stock her store and to improve the pens for her sheep and goats.

loans.name: Abass

texts.en:
Abass is a 34-year-old married man, father of two children. Abass has been working in furniture-making and painting since 1999; he is specialized in painting furniture.

Abass is a hard-working man, with special talents in  his field. Abass is a hardworking man; he is trusted & supported by most of his customers because of his good quality products.

Abass is applying for a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, in order to buy necessary updated tools and machines for his business. Abass has been an Al Majmoua borrower for two cycles; his previous loan helped a lot in improving his business, and it reflected positively on both his social & financial situations.

He hopes to keep on improving his business as much as he can, maybe through future loans that might help a lot in buying updated machines and might open a new branch for special furnished apartments.

loans.use: To buy necessary updated tools and machines for his business

loans.name: Dolgor

texts.en:
Mrs. Dolgor, 53, is seller of building materials in a bazaar in a suburban district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She has been running her sales-point for over 14 years non-stop. Dolgor lives with her husband in the "ger" district, living in a Mongolian traditional nomadic tent. 

She has many permanent customers and has gained a lot of experience from her business. Her credit history is a good and she always repays her loans on time successfully. This time she is requesting a loan to purchase building materials from her supplier to increase her working capital for bigger sales volume. Let’s help her to improve her business and better her life!

loans.use: To purchase building materials from her supplier to increase her working capital for bigger sales volume.

loans.name: Andina

texts.en:
Andina lives in Yei. She sells charcoal and has been in business for two years. She is 29 years old, married, and has two children; both of them are still in school. 

Andina heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer and this is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 SDG in order to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Batsukh

texts.en:
Mr. Batsukh, age 37, runs a clothes-selling business with his wife in the bazaar of Darkhan, the second largest city in Mongolia. He and his wife live with their two children in the suburban district of the city. He has successfully operated his business since 1999. 

He is requesting a loan in order to increase his working capital for bigger sales volume. He and his wife realize that is important to raise their business earnings and expand their family income in the future. 

The loan he is taking out will be used to purchase a large number of clothes from his supplier so as to expand his inventory and grow his business.

loans.use: to purchase a large number of clothes from his supplier so as to expand his inventory

loans.name: Peregrina

texts.es:
Peregrina tiene 56 años de edad, es casada y tiene 2.  Vive en el distrito de Tambogrande, una zona agrícola de regular movimiento comercial que se encuentra situada en la provincia de Piura, a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.


Tiene instalada una pequeña bodega en su vivienda, en ella Peregrina ofrece a sus clientes productos de primera necesidad. Ella nos comenta que su negocio nació ante la necesidad de contar con un ingreso adicional que le permitiera sacar adelante a su familia, ya que también se dedica a la agricultura contando con 2.5 ha de terreno sembrados de limón y maíz que cosecha semanalmente.

Peregrina desea ampliar su negocio para mejorar su servicio.  Asimismo desea comprar fertilizantes y pesticidas para su cultivo, es por ello se encuentra solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a conseguir su objetivo propuesto.

Peregrina es una mujer honorable y muy estimada en la zona donde vive.
texts.en:
Peregrina is 56 years old, married and has 2 children. She lives in the district of Tambogrande, an agricultural zone with a regular amount of business, located in the province of Piura. It is more than four hours from the city of Chiclayo.


She has a small store set up in her home. There Peregrina offers her customers basic necessity products. She tells us that her business was born from the need to have additional income to allow her to get her family ahead. She also farms and has 2.5 hectares of land planted with lemon trees and corn, which she harvests weekly. 

Peregrina wants to enlarge her business to improve her service. She also wants to buy fertilizer and pesticide for her crops. That is why she is asking Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 2000 nuevos soles which will help her meet her proposed objective.

Peregrina is an honorable and respected woman in the area where she lives.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland.

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.es:
A la vivienda de la señora Guadalupe le esta haciendo falta el barda al frente, pero no cuenta con el dinero necesario para comprar el material. 
Solicita el préstamo ya que tiene que comprar el block, cemento, arena y varilla, su esposo se encarga de realizar la mejora en horario adicional a su trabajo.
Doña Guadalupe se dedica al comercio tiene un negocio de venta de ropa nueva y usada, su esposo es empleado de una agencia aduanal, estos son los ingresos que tiene para su familia y con el cual planean pagar el crédito. 
Desean mejorar el patrimonio y la calidad de vida de su familia, para brindarles un seguridad y protección en su casa.
texts.en:
Guadalupe's house is lacking a wall, but she doesn't have enough money to buy the materials. She is asking for the loan to buy the blocks, cement, sand and rods. Her husband will take care of making the wall i his spare time after work. 

Guadalupe is a merchant. She sells new and used clothing. Her husband is an employee at a customs agency. These are their family's income with which they plan on paying the loan.
 
She wants to improve her property and her family's quality of life to offer them saftey and protection at home.

loans.use: to put up a wall in front of her house.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce lives in Yei. She sells from a food stall and has been in business for three years. She is 29 years old, married, and has four children, all of whom are still in school. 

Joyce heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer and this is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of $200 in order to purchase tomatoes and onions. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase tomatoes and onions to sell.

loans.name: Dao

texts.en:
Dao is 42 years old. She lives in her own house with her husband and two sons in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband earns money by making iron doors. 

Dao supports her family by making garments. She started her business over three years ago. She intends to take out a loan to invest in both her own business and her husband's business by buying a greater quantity of cloth, fabrics, and metal to increase their production. 

Dao hopes that through the loan she and her husband can earn more money and can save enough for the education of their children.

loans.use: To invest in both her own business and her husband's business by buying a greater quantity of cloth, fabrics, and metal to increase their production.

loans.name: Kieu

texts.en:
Kieu is a 60-year-old married woman with five daughters. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. She and her husband have been running a general store for the past three years and also sell beverages and coffee to people in their community.
  
Kieu would like a loan to buy new products such as many kinds of cakes, green tea, milk and beverages to sell in her store to better meet her customers' needs. She hopes that she will be able to increase her income and set aside some savings.

loans.use: To buy new products such as many kinds of cakes, green tea, milk and beverages to sell in her store.

loans.name: Alou

texts.fr:
Agé de 29 ans, Alou a une épouse, est père de 3 enfants et  vit dans une famille traditionnelle dans la ville de Koutiala (Région de Sikasso). 
Parallèlement à ses activités d’enseignant dans une école privée à Koutiala, il mène des activités de commerce notamment la vente d’articles divers de boutique depuis 10 ans. Cette activité lui procure assez de revenus, sa demande est souvent très grande, car il reçoit beaucoup de clients par jour. 
Pour la bonne satisfaction de sa clientèle et l’agrandissement de son activité,  Alou a fait recours à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso  et est à son premier prêt individuel. 
Ce prêt sera  utilisé pour l’acquisition des stocks de  diverses marchandises : thé, sucre, savon, céréales, lait en poudre, et des biscuits. Il s’approvisionne auprès  des grossistes de Koutiala et effectue sa vente dans sa boutique à Koutiala à une clientèle mixte, en espèce et en détail. 
Alou espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 90.000 FCFA  qu’il utilisera pour le remboursement des taux d’intérêts de Soro, satisfaire aux besoins de sa famille et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Alou is 29 years old, married, and father of three children. He lives in a traditional family in the city of Koutiala (in the region of Sikasso).

Besides his work teaching in a private school in Koutiala, he has been working in commerce, particularly selling various store items, for ten years now. This business provides him with a sufficient level of income. His demand is often very high, because he receives many customers each day.

To grow his business and ensure that his customers are well satisfied, Alou turned to the microfinance institution, Soro Yiriwaso, and is on his first individual loan.

This loan will be used to buy stocks of various goods: tea, sugar, soap, cereal, powdered milk, and cookies. He stocks up from the wholesalers in Koutiala and sells the products on a retail basis in his shop in Koutiala for cash to a mixed customer base.

Alou hopes to earn monthly profits of 90,000 FCFA, which he will use to pay back Soro's interest and cover the needs of his family. He will invest the rest in his business.

loans.use: to buy various store items

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy plastic plates and basins

loans.name: Erfat

texts.en: Erfat is 34-year-old married woman from Gaza; she has five kids who are in school. Erfat owns a mini-market. She started this small project on the 1st of January 2011; she hopes to get this loan in order to buy shelves and a refrigerator, which will allow her to increase her supplies, leading to increased profit and income.

loans.use: to buy shelves and a refrigerator

loans.name: Loan

texts.en:
Loan, 40, is married with a son. She and her husband earn a living by sewing clothes. They have been involved in this business for over four years. They live in Ho Chi Minh City. 

She would like to take out a loan to expand her business. With the loan, she intends to buy sewing machines and materials that will enable her to make better quality clothes for customers. She hopes that this will generate more income and that she can save money for her child to go to school.

loans.use: To buy sewing machines and materials that will enable her to make better quality clothes for her customers.

loans.name: Bewdi Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de crédit GPF Bewdi  regroupe 5 femmes qui se sont réunis parce appartenant à la même famille. Il se compose des dames : Mariètou, Lobé Sogui, Hawa Alassane, Mairam Cheikh et Kardiatou qui est la présidente. Leur activité consiste à faire du commerce.
Kardiatou, qui dirige le groupe, s’identifie par sa position debout sur la photo, exerce cette activité depuis 8 ans. Elle fait de la vente d’habits prêt à porter. Elle fait ce métier pour aider son mari dans la gestion de la dépense quotidienne du foyer. Elle a comme ambition d’ouvrir une boutique de produits cosmétiques avec l’appui des préteurs.
texts.en:
The GPF Bewdi loan group is composed of five women who joined forces as they belong to the same family: Mariètou, Lobé Sogui, Hawa Alassane, Mairam Cheikh and Kardiatou, who is the president. They all have trading activities. 

Kardiatou, who is in charge of the group, is the one standing in the photo, and she has been running her business for the past eight yers. She sells ready-to-wear clothing and does this to help out her husband with the daily household expenses. She has an ambition to open a cosmetics shop with the help of lenders.

loans.use: to buy ready-to-wear clothing for resale

loans.name: Mariam

texts.fr:
Madame Mariam a 56 ans,  mariée et mère de 8 enfants, elle  vit dans une famille polygame dans la ville  de koutiala. 
Dû à des problèmes de famille, Mariam  n’as pas pu continuer les études primaires raisons pour laquelle elle s’est vite rabattue sur les activités génératrices de revenus en apprenant le tricotage de la laine. Elle excelle dans cette activité de tricotage et vente de laine depuis 15 ans  qu’elle  a appris  auprès des sœurs  catholiques. Actuellement elle exerce à son domicile et sa notoriété est bonne car elle reçoit beaucoup de commandes de napperon, écharpe et layette dans le mois. 
Pour la bonne satisfaction de ses clients, Mariam n’as pas pris du temps pour rejoindre l’institution Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant 4 ans. Après 5 prêts solidaires (prêts de groupe) et 2 prêts individuels tous remboursés correctement, elle est à sont 3 eme prêt. 
Elle s’approvisionne à Koutiala et compte acheter 3 cartons de laine auprès des commerçants détaillants. Elle vend ses articles  dans la ville de Koutiala   à une clientèle constituée  de femmes à crédit et au comptant. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 100.000FCFA par mois qu’elle envisage utiliser pour rembourser les intérêts du prêt et participer aux dépenses quotidiennes de sa famille, elle compte sur les financements de Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
