Mariam is 56 years old, married, and mother of eight children. She lives in a polygamous family in the city of Koutiala.

Due to family problems, Mariam was not able to continue her primary school studies. That is why she quickly fell back on income-generating activities by learning how to knit wool. She has been excelling in this business of knitting and selling wool, which she learned from catholic nuns, for 15 years now. She currently works at home, and she has a good reputation because she receives many orders for mats, scarves, and baby clothes each month.

To ensure that her customers are well satisfied, Miriam did not hesitate in deciding to join the institution, Soro Yiriwaso, four years ago. After five solidarity loans (group loans) and two individual loans that were all correctly repaid, she is now on her third loan.

She stocks up in Koutiala and plans to buy three boxes of wool from retail sellers. She sells her wares for cash or credit in the city of Koutiala to a customer base made up of women. She expects to earn a monthly profit of 100,000 FCFA, which she plans to use to pay back the interest on the loan and contribute to covering her family's daily expenses. She counts on financing from Soro Yiriwaso.

loans.use: to buy wool

loans.name: Yamoussa

texts.fr:
Yamoussa  a environs  35  ans, mariée père d’ un enfant, il est polygame et vit dans une grande famille  avec ses épouses et ses parents dans  la ville de Koutiala (Région de Sikasso). 
Yamoussa a fréquenté l’école, mais il n’a pas pu continuer les études, ce qui justifie son intégration dans  le monde de la couture qu’il a apprit auprès d’un chef d’atelier depuis son abandon à l’école  il y a 15 ans. Sa notoriété est bonne, car il est très bien sollicité par ses clients.  
Pour augmenter  son fonds de roulement, la taille de son activité et satisfaire sa clientèle, Yamoussa  a décidé de rejoindre  l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso pour  contracter un prêt . Il est à son  premier prêt individuel et compte l’utiliser pour acheter de fournitures : glaceur, bouton, fil, aiguille, papiers  de couture. Il s’approvisionne au Burkina Faso, à Bamako et effectue son activité dans la ville de Koutiala à une clientèle de femmes et d’ hommes au comptant et souvent il envoie ses tissus cousus à son frère en France pour la vente. Il   envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 150.000FCFA qu’il utilisera pour le remboursement de son échéance, satisfaire aux besoins de sa   famille et investir le reste dans son activité .
texts.en:
Yamoussa is around 35 years old, married and father to one child. He is polygamous and lives in a large family with his wives and parents in the town of Koutiala (in the Sikasso region).

Yamoussa went to school but was not able to continue his studies. For this reason he went into the sewing field and learnt his trade with the boss of a workshop when he left school 15 years ago. He has a good repuration as he is in great demand from his customers. 

In order to increase his working capital and business volume and to satisfy customer demand, Yamoussa decided to join the microfinance institution, Soro Yiriwaso, to obtain a loan. He is on his first individual loan and is planning to use it to buy equipment: glazer, buttons, thread, needles, sewing paper. He gets his supplies in Burkina Faso and Bamako, and carries out his business in the town of Koutiala for a customer base of women and men, for cash; often he sends his sewn fabrics to his brother in France for sale there. He is expecting to make a monthly profit of 150,000FCFA, which he will use to repay his loans and satisfy his family's needs; the balance will be invested in his business.

loans.use: to buy sewing equipment

loans.name: Malkhaz

texts.en:
Malkhaz is 31 years old. He is unmarried and lives in a small village of Terjola District with his parents. Malkhaz’s parents are retired. The only source of the income for the family is agriculture. They have three milk cows. Malkhaz’s mother makes cheese and sells it on the local open market. Also the family owns a vineyard with 1,500 vine trees and a plot of land where maize is grown. Malkhaz produces wine and sells it in the village; maize is sold in the village as well. Total average monthly income of the family is 450 GEL, including pensions of Malkhaz’s parents. 

Malkhaz requested credit for financing seasonal agricultural works. In particular, he will rent a tractor for tilling the land and purchase fertilizers. After properly completed seasonal works, Malkhaz will get a good harvest, which will be sold for a convenient price. The family will get income and use it for satisfying their daily needs.

loans.use: to rent a tractor for tilling the land and purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Thoa

texts.en:
Thoa, 50, is married and has three children: one son and two daughters. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband earns an income selling handbags. 

Thoa supports her family by selling garlic and onions. She started this business 5 years ago. She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying a greater variety of garlic and onions to sell to her customers at more competitive prices.

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety of garlic and onions to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Mahamadou

texts.fr:
MAHAMADOU, ce mécanicien  et vendeur de pièces détachées est âgé de  33 ans,  marié à une épouse et père de 5 enfants il vit chez son père avec sa famille, dans la préfecture de Koutiala   (Région de Sikasso).  
Dû à des raisons sociales, il n’a pas pu continuer les études primaires alors il s’intéressa aux activités génératrices de revenus depuis son jeune âge, qu’il apprit  auprès de son frère.  Cette activités est très rentable et  lui procure assez de revenus, il reçoit beaucoup de commande dans le mois.  
Pour la bonne satisfaction de sa clientèle et l’élargissement de son activité,  MAHAMADOU a fait recours à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso pour l’atteinte de ses objectifs . Il est à  son premier  prêt  individuel.  Ce prêt servira à acquérir des pièces détachées de rechanges pour motos.  Il s’approvisionne  au grand marché de Koutiala  et effectue ses ventes à son lieu de prestation de mécanicien dans la ville de Koutiala, à une clientèle composée de femmes et  d’hommes au comptant et à crédit.  MAHAMADOU compte réaliser un  bénéfice de 100 000 FCFA par mois qu’il utilisera pour le remboursement des taux d’intérêts prendre en charge les besoins de sa famille et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Mahamadou, a mechanic and spare parts salesman, is 33 years old, married and the father of 5 children. He lives with his family in his father's home, located in the prefecture of Koutiala (Sikasso region). He was unable to continue his primary education due to social reasons, and instead became interested in revenue-generating activities from an early age, learning from his brother. His business is very profitable and generates enough income for him. He gets many orders per month.

Mahamadou has turned to the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to be able to meet his goals of satisfying customer demand and developing his business. This is his first individual loan and it will be used to buy spare parts for motorcycles. He gets his supplies at the Grand Market of Koutiala, and resells them at his place of work as a mechanic in the town of Koutiala, to a clientele of women and men, for cash or credit.

Mahamadou expects to make a profit of 100 000 francs per month, which he will use to make some interest payments, take care of his family's needs and reinvest in his business.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for motorcycles.

loans.name: Tram

texts.en:
Tram is 57 years old. She lives in her own house with her husband and two children in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband works as an insurance salesman. 

Tram supports her family by earning income selling sugarcane juice and noodles. She started her stall 3 years ago. She intends to take a loan to increase the size of her current business by buying a greater quantity of sugarcane and noodles to sell from her stall. 

She hopes that through the loan she can earn more money and can save enough money for family emergencies.

loans.use: to buy more sugarcane and noodles to sell from her stall.

loans.name: Yen

texts.en:
Yen is a 48-year-old married woman. She lives with four children and her husband in Ho Chi Minh City. For 23 years, she and her husband have been raising and selling dairy cows to earn a living.

Yen would like a loan to buy animal feed for her young dairy cows and she would also like to use a part of her loan to cover her children's school fees. She hopes that through her loan she will be able to increase her income and save money for any future difficulties facing her family.

loans.use: to buy animal feed for her young dairy cows and to pay her children's school fees.

loans.name: Hang

texts.en:
Hang is 44 years old and is widowed. She has two children and lives with them in Ho Chi Minh City.

Hang supports her family by growing and selling vegetables, which she has done for 9 years. She is confident that her business will continue to run smoothly and will enable her to improve her family's living conditions and save money for her children's future education. But now Hang requires a loan to pay for her children's school fees. She hopes that through the loan that her children will receive the schooling that they need to secure a better future.

loans.use: to pay for her children's school fees.

loans.name: Oumar

texts.fr:
Agé de 28 ans, célibataire et père  d’un enfant, Monsieur Oumar vit avec ses parents  dans la ville de Koutiala (Région de Sikasso). 
Dû à des raisons sociales, il n’a pas pu continuer les études alors il a embrassé les activités génératrices de revenus auprès de son père depuis son jeune  âge et l’exerce pour lui-même il y’a  maintenant 4 ans.  Il est très sollicité par ses clients,  car le portable est une nécessité majeure de nos jours. 
Pour la bonne satisfaction de sa clientèle, Monsieur Oumar a fait recours à   l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il n’ y a  3 ans, il est à son quatrième  prêt individuel  et  les trois précédents furent tous remboursés par anticipation.  Avec ce financement  il compte acheter 15 téléphones portables et des pièces de rechange à Bamako, il effectue sa vente dans son kiosque à Koutiala, à une clientèle mixte en espèce. Avec ce financement, il compte sur un bénéfice mensuel de 90 000 FCFA qu’il utilisera pour subvenir à ses besoins et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Oumar is 28 years old, single and the father of one child. He lives with his parents in the town of Kotiala (Sikasso region). He was unable to go on with his studies due to social reasons, so instead took up revenue-generating activities, working alongside his father from an early age. He has been working for himself for the past 4 years. He is very much in demand by his customers, as mobile phones have now become a major necessity.

In order to be able to satisfy his customers, Oumar turned to the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso nearly 3 years ago and is now on his 4th individual loan. The 3 previous loans were all repaid in advance. He plans to use this loan to buy 15 mobile phones and some spare parts in Bamako. He sells his merchandise from his kiosk in Koutiala, to all sorts of customers. With this loan, he expects to earn a monthly profit of 90 000 francs which he will use to support himself and to reinvest in his business.

loans.use: to buy mobile phones and spare parts.

loans.name: Adidjatou Coubourat

texts.fr: Adidjatou coubourat est âgée de 38 ans et est mariée à un certain Jean de Dieu. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. La famille vit ensemble. Adidjatou coubourat assure ensemble avec son mari les diverses charges familiales. Adidjatou coubourat a arrêté l’école au niveau secondaire. Pour subvenir à ses différents besoins, Adidjatou coubourat vend depuis une dizaine d’année, divers articles de mercerie à son domicile. Adidjatou coubourat s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. En vue de renforcer davantage son activité par l’augmentation du stock de ses produits, afin de mieux satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle, Adidjatou coubourat sollicite pour une troisième fois l'appui financier de ALIDé. Les crédits consentis antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
Adidjatou Coubourat is 38 years old. She is married to a man named Jean de Dieu, and the couple have three dependent children who all go to school. The whole family live together. Adidjatou Coubourat and her husband handle together the various household responsibilities. 

Adidjatou Coubourat quit school at the secondary level. In order to support herself, she started to sell haberdashery items from her home about ten years ago. She buys her merchandise at a market in Benin. 

Adidjatou Coubourat is seeking a third loan from ALIDé to strengthen her activity. She will replenish her stock of products to better meet customer demand. All previous loans were repaid without incident.

loans.use: to buy haberdashery items for resale.

loans.name: El Nance Group

texts.es: Doña Berta es miembro del Grupo Solidario El Nance, tiene 60 años de edad, es madre soltera,  solo vive con su nieto siendo que su único hijo murió hace 15 años y le toco hacerse cargo de su nietecito, ella es una mujer sola que con el esfuerzo de su trabajo a podido salir adelante. Doña Berta desde hace 5 años se dedica a la venta de comida, ella es una persona muy luchadora ya que con los ahorros de su trabajo pudo comenzar su negocio y comprar su casa. Su horario de atención inicia a partir de las 5:00 a.m y culmina a las 7:00 p.m, su mayor ventaja es que tiene muy poca competencia. El préstamo lo necesita para surtir su negocio de productos como ser: refrescos, arroz, azúcar, carnes, pollo, aceite, entre otros. Ella espera que con el apoyo de este préstamo pueda tener su negocio mas surtido y así poder seguir sosteniendo a su nieto. Una de sus metas es tener un comedor mas grande para ofrecer comida bufet y darle un mejor servicio a sus clientes. Este es el primer financiamiento que obtiene doña Berta en FAMA y espera cumplir puntualmente con el pago de sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Berta is a member of the communal bank El Nance. She is 60 years old and a single mother. She lives alone with her grandson since her only son died 15 years ago, and she took over caring for her little grandson. She is a woman on her own who, with through hard work, has been able to get ahead. 

For 5 years Berta has been selling food. She is a very hard working woman since, with the savings from her work, she was able to start a business and buy a house. Her work day begins at 5:00 am and ends at 7:00 pm. Her biggest advantage is that she has little competition. 

She needs the loan to stock her business with products like: drinks, rice, sugar, meat, chicken, oil, etc. She hopes that, with this loan’s help, she can have a better stocked business and also be able to continue supporting her grandson. One of her goals is to have a larger eatery to offer buffet food and provide her customers with better service. This is the first loan Berta’s gotten with FAMA, and she expects to comply with the loan’s terms in a punctual manner.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, meat, chicken, oil, and drinks.

loans.name: La Gloire De Dieu Group

texts.fr: Le groupe LA GLOIRE DE DIEU est formé de trois personnes qui habitent dans le même quartier. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Félicienne, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. C’est la quatrième fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Félicienne est âgée de 55 ans et a arrêté l’école au niveau secondaire. Félicienne est mariée à un certain Paul. Le couple a cinq enfants, tous scolarisés et sont à leur charge. Félicienne vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari et subvient ensemble aux divers besoins du ménage. Pour faire face à ses différentes charges, Félicienne vend de repas et de façon secondaire la vente d’akassa (pâte faite à base de maïs) dans une ville du Benin depuis près de trois ans. Félicienne s’approvisionne dans un marché du Benin. Dans le souci de renforcer davantage son activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle, Félicienne désire augmenter le stock de ses produits. Pour ce faire, Félicienne sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe LA GLOIRE DE DIEU, un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits consentis antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The La Gloire De Dieu group is made up of 3 people who live in the same area. The group's representative, Félicienne, is the one with her hand raised in the picture. This is the 4th time that the group asks for ALIDé's financial help, with the aim of increasing their business activities.

Félicienne is 55 years old and left school during her secondary education. She is married to Paul and the couple have 5 dependent children, all of whom go to school. Félicienne lives together with her husband and children, and together they meet the household's needs. In order to be able to meet her different obligations, Félicienne has been selling meals and, as a sideline business, akassa (a corn-based paste), in a town in Benin for nearly 3 years. She gets her supplies in a market in Benin.

With a view to strengthening her business and better meeting customer demand, Félicienne would like to increase her stock of products. So that she can do this, Félicienne, together with the other members of the La Gloire De Dieu group, is requesting a 4th loan from ALIDé. The previously agreed loans have all been correctly repaid.

loans.use: to buy produce and condiments.

loans.name: Eilyn

texts.es:
Perfil de Eilyn
350000
Eilyn tiene 26 años es madre de 2 hijos menores de edad y actualmente está separada del padre de los niños; vive con ellos en una pequeña casa en la zona de San Pedro de Poas, pueblo ubicado en las faldas del Volcán Poas en la zona rural del Valle Central de Costa Rica. Ante esta situación renunció a su trabajo en una fábrica de manufactura local para poder cuidar a sus dos pequeños, por esta razón desea emprender el proyecto de compra de 2 maquinas de coser y materia prima para la elaboración de juegos de baño y cortinas, trabajar desde su casa, cuidar a sus hijos y vender en la comunidad para ofrecer un ingreso adicional a la pequeña pensión de 80.000 colones (156 dólares mensuales) para el pago de un lugar donde vivir y la comida para su familia.

Ella empieza su día a las 6 de la mañana alistando a su hija de 6 años para ir a la escuela, regresa y hace los quehaceres de la casa, la recoge a las 10:30 am y durante ese tiempo tiene a su hijo pequeño, alista el almuerzo  ya con los 2 niños en la casa inicia su labor en la tarde y proyecta trabajar, dependiendo de los pedidos, hasta las 9:30 pm.

Con este dinero espera solventar gastos de la casa, desarrollarse como persona emprendedora y madre y para su familia desea una vida mejor, que vivan bien y lo más importante es estar cerca de ellos todo el día. En este momento ha tenido problemas económicos, razón por la cual la familia (su padre y madre) la han impulsado a desarrollar este proyecto y así salir adelante económicamente.
texts.en:
Eilyn is 26 years old. She has two young children, and right now she is separated from the children’s father. She lives with them in a small house in the San Pedro de Poas area, a town located on the slopes of the Poas Volcano in the rural area of the Central Valley of Costa Rica. Previously she quit her job at a local manufacturing factory in order to care for her two young ones. For this reason she wants to start a business, buying two sewing machines and raw materials for making curtains and bath sets. She works from home, cares for her kids, and sells locally to add a little income to her small monthly child support of 80,000 colones ($156 dollars a month) in order to pay for a place to live and for her family’s food. 

She begins her day at 6:00 in the morning, getting her 6 year old daughter ready to go to school. She comes back and does the housework. She picks her daughter up at 10:30 am, and during that time she has her little son. She gets lunch ready since, with two children in the house, she begins her work in the afternoon, and she plans to work, depending on orders, until 9:30 pm. 

With this money she hopes to pay household expenses, developing herself as an entrepreneur and a mother. She wants a better life for her family so that they can live well, and most importantly, so that she can be close to her children during the day. Right now she’s having money problems which is the reason the family (her father and mother) have prompted her to develop of this business and get ahead financially.

loans.use: to buy two sewing machines to make curtains and bath sets.

loans.name: Iris Carolina

texts.es: Iris Carolina de treinta años de edad vive con su compañero de vida y sus hijos en casa propia. Ella posee una sala de belleza en una zona muy concurrida de personas, ya tiene mucha clientela y últimamente ha aumentado su demanda pues los cortes, planchados, maquillajes, entre otros que ella realiza, claro de muy  buena calidad y a precios accesibles además el servicio es excelente; Iris es una mujer trabajadora e independiente, siempre le ha gustado aprovechar todas las oportunidades que se le presentan, su más grande secreto es la dedicación a la labor, quiere ver crecer su negocio por eso le solita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar, herramienta de trabajo, cosméticos, cremas etc. Iris Carolina tiene la confianza que así podrá darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Iris Carolina, who is thirty years old, lives with her life partner and their children in her own home.  She owns a beauty shop in a zone with many people and already has a lot of clients.  Recently, the demand has increased for hair cuts, straightenings, styles, make-overs, among other good quality services that she offers at accessable prices.  Moreover, her service is excellent.  Iris is a hard-working and independent woman, who has always enjoyed taking advantage of all the opportunities that present themselves.  Her greatest secret is her dedication to her work.  She wants to see her business grow and it is for this reason, she requests INTEGRAL for a loan that will allow her to purchase tools for her work, cosmetics, creams, etc.  Iris Carolina is confident that in this way, she will be able to give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase tools for work, cosmetics, creams, etc.

loans.name: Thao

texts.en:
Thao is a 35-year-old married woman with two sons. She and her husband have been raising dairy cows for ten years. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. 

Thao would like to take out a loan to buy more cows and animal feed to increase the size of her business. She hopes that this will enable her to earn a higher income, improve her family's living conditions, and cover the education costs of her children.

loans.use: To buy more cows and animal feed to increase the size of her business.

loans.name: Phuong

texts.en:
Phuong is 40 years old. She has 3 children and lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. 

She and her husband have been making money by cattle raising for five years. They have requested a loan to invest in their business by buying and raising more cattle.

She hope their business runs smoothly and will help her to improve her income and living conditions.

loans.use: To buy cattle to raise and sell

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina lives in Yei. She sells charcoal, and has been in business for one year. She is 29 years old, married, and has two children both of whom are still in school. 
Amina heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer this is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 SDG in order purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.,

loans.name: Ayidote 2 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe AYIDOTE 2 est formé de trois personnes qui habitent dans le même quartier. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Chantale, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. C’est la troisième fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Chantale est âgée de 36 ans et a arrêté l’école au niveau primaire. Chantale est mariée à un certain Thomas. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Chantale vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari et subvient ensemble aux divers besoins du ménage. Pour faire face à ses différentes charges, Chantale vend de chaussures et de façon secondaire des noix de coco dans une ville du Benin depuis près de cinq ans. Chantale s’approvisionne dans une région du Benin. Dans le souci de renforcer davantage son activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle, Chantale désire augmenter le stock de ses produits. Pour ce faire, Chantale sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe AYIDOTE, un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits consentis antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The Ayidote 2 group is composed of three individuals living in the same neighborhood. The group’s representative, by the name of Chantale, is the one raising her hand in the photo. It is the third time that the group asks for financial support from ALIDé, with the goal of expanding their business. Chantale is 36 years old. She ended her formal education at the primary school level. Her husband’s name is Thomas. They have three children, all in school and in their care. Chantale lives together with her husband and children. The spouses jointly provide for various household needs. In order to meet her expenses, for the last five year Chantale has been selling shoes, and, as a secondary activity, coconuts, in a town of Benin. Chantale stocks up in a region  of Benin. 

Wishing to strengthen her business and better meet customer demand, Chantale would like to expand her stock of goods. In order to do so, Chantale, together with the other members of the Ayidote group, is seeking her third loan from ALIDé. All previously approved loans have been duly repaid.

loans.use: to buy shoes and coconuts.

loans.name: Manana

texts.en:
Manana is from a small village in the  Terjola District. She is 42 years old. Manana is widow and lives with her 22 years old daughter and two sons (20 and 6 years old). Though she works hard, the family still lives in poverty. They receive a pension from the government. 

Manana leads the agricultural business of the family. They have 2 milk cows. Manana produces cheese and sells it to local dairy products retailers. Also she has a pig and sells on average 12 piglets per year. Along with the above mentioned businesses, the family owns a vineyard with 300 vine-trees. Manana produces wine and sells it in the village. Total average monthly income of the family is about $270. 

Manana has requested a loan for renovation of the house. The house where Manana lives with her children is very old and extremely uncomfortable. With the borrowed amount Manana will repair all necessary parts of the house, to create a bit of comfort there.

loans.use: to purchase materials for house renovation

loans.name: Leticia

texts.es:
Leticia tiene 40 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene una hija de 22 años de edad, y vive con ella en el Municipio de Choloma, Cortes.
Doña Leticia es una señora humilde y muy trabajadora. Hace 4 años se motivo a establecer un negocio de  venta de  refrescos, galletas, jugos en lata, chicles, churros, periódicos y recargas telefónicas. Este negocio lo tiene ubicado en punto de las afueras de los parques industriales de la ciudad, por lo tanto sus ventas aumentan favorablemente, proporcionándole buenas ganancias de las cuales a reinvertido y ha logrado establecer  otro puesto de venta del mismo producto  que es administrado  por su hija en otro punto de la ciudad.  Logrando su objetivo en trabajar lo propio. Leticia atiende a los clientes desde las 6.00am hasta las 7.00pm.
Ella solicita su primer financiamiento con ODEF de 5,000 lempiras para invertir en surtir su negocio en productos como Jugos de lata, refrescos de botella y bebidas energéticas. Para vender variedad de producto a los clientes.
Su meta es seguir trabajando para ayudar a su hija a preparse mejor en los estudios y pueda seguir  su ejemplo en trabajar en su propio negocio.
texts.en:
Leticia, 40, is a single mother; she has a 22 year old daughter she lives with in the town of Choloma, Cortes.

Leticia is a humble, very hardworking lady.  Four years ago she motivated herself to start a business selling soft-drinks, cookies, canned juice, chewing gum, snacks, newspapers and phone recharge cards.  Her business is located outside the city’s industrial parks so her sales increase favorably producing good profits that she has reinvested into opening a second stand in a different location in the city that her daughter runs selling the same sort of things.  Reaching her goal of working for herself, Leticia tends to customers from 6am until 7pm.

She is asking ODEF for her first, 5000 lempira, loan to buy merchandise to stock her business like canned juice, bottled soft-drinks and energy drinks to sell a variety of products to her customers.

Her goal is to stay in business to help her daughter better prepare herself in her studies and follow her example and work in a business of her own.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to stock her store.

loans.name: Irina

texts.ru:
Ирина смогла пополнить необходимый запас товара за счет последнего кредита от КИВА и получила дополнительную прибыль, что благотворно отразилось на условиях проживания ее семьи. 
Ирина запланировала пополнить ассортимент джинсовой женской одежды к весне, поэтому и обращается снова за кредитной помощью в кредиторам КИВА.
texts.en: Irina used her last loan from Kiva for needed supplements to her inventory, and the additional income she earned has positively impacted her family's living conditions. Irina has planned to expand her inventory of women's denim clothing for spring, and so is again seeking credit assistance from Kiva's lenders.

loans.use: supplement her inventory of women's denim clothing for spring

loans.name: Lilias

texts.en:
Lilias lives in Yei. She sells clothes, and has been in business for two years. She is 35 year old, married, and has five children,  three of whom are still in school. 
Lilias heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 SDG in order purchase clothes. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for sale.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
Maria Elena tiene 41 años de edad, es casada y tiene 5 hijos de 26, 24, 22, 19 y 16 años de edad, de los cuales solo el de 16 y 19 estudian, vive en San Juan Pueblo, Atlántida.
Doña Maria tiene un negocio de venta de ropa, zapatos, útiles escolares (cuadernos, mochilas etc.) y refrescos. Ella inicio este negocio viéndose en la necesidad de obtener otro ingreso económico que le ayudara  a suplir algunas necesidades, como la educación de sus hijos. Desde entonces trabaja mucho obteniendo buenas utilidades con las cuales ha podido hacer crecer su negocio. Trabaja tiempo completo vendiendo su mercadería. 
Maria lleva varios financiamientos con ODEF en el cual manifiesta le han ayudado mucho en la estabilidad de su negocio, ahora solicita otro de 10,000 lempiras para surtir su tienda con mercadería como ropa,  cuadernos y bolsones escolares.
Su meta es seguir trabajando para darles a sus hijos la estabilidad económica para sus estudios.
texts.en:
María Elena, 41, is married and has five children who are 26, 24, 22, 19 and 16 years old; only the 16-year-old and the 19-year-old attend school.  She lives in San Juan Pueblo, Atlántida.

María has a business selling clothes, shoes, school supplies (notebooks, book bags, etc.) and soft-drinks.  She started the business seeing that she needed another source of income that would help her cover some needs like her children’s education.  Since then she’s worked hard earning good profits that have helped her business to grow.  She works full time selling her merchandise.

María has had several ODEF loans and she states that they have helped her very much with her business’ stability.  She’s now asking for another, 10,000 lempira, loan to stock her store with merchandise like clothes, notebooks and book bags.  Her goal is to stay in business to give her children economic stability for their schooling.

loans.use: to buy clothes, notebooks and book bags to stock her store.

loans.name: Amapolas Group

texts.es: Este grupo solidario se llama Amapolas está conformado por las señoras Floriberta Lucila y Maricela van a comprar con su préstamo harina, pintura, aceite, diurex, bolsa, la señora Mónica Yudith va a comprar cacahuate por carga, la señora, la señora Celia va a comprar Obleas, la señora Margarita va a comprar harina, leche, arroz, canela, azúcar y leña. La señora Margarita tiene 57 años de edad, ella es casada, ella tiene 3 hijas, 2 no estudian y una estudia la normal, ella vende empanadas rellenas de arroz, donas azucaradas y cubiertas de chocolate ella solicito su préstamo para comprar harina, arroz, azúcar, leña, gas, leche, canela, chocolate,  ella inicio su negocio hace 34 años su esposo aprendia a elaborarlas y le enseño como elaborar las empanadas, ellos salen a vender sus productos caminando por las calles de su comunidad a sus clientes les gustan por su buen sabor, su esposo le ayuda a preparar las empanadas, su negocio es importante porque sale a vender y tiene dinero del diario, a ella le gusta elaborar las donas y las empanadas, ella se siente orgullosa que gracias a Dios tiene este negocio que le ayuda con los gastos su hija en la escuela, compra la materia prima para seguir trabajando y para la comida. Sus sueños y esperanzas son que su taller este mas grande, tener más producción de empanadas y que sus hijas sigan adelante, termine su carrera de maestra y tenga trabajo. Las integrantes del grupo quieren decirle a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad “les agradecemos sus préstamos nos ayudan a crecer los negocios y a vivir mejor con la familia, les deseamos muchas felicitaciones, salud y alegria”.
texts.en:
This solidarity group is called “Amapolas” (Poppies).  With this loan, 2 members, Floriberta Lucila and Maricela, will buy wheat, coloring, cooking oil, sticky tape, and bags. Monica Yudith will purchase peanuts by the bag; Celia will buy wafers; Margarita will buy wheat, milk, rice, cinnamon, sugar and firewood.

Margarita is 57 years old, married, and has 3 daughters; 1 studies in normal school while the other 2 aren't in school. Margarita sells buns stuffed with rice and sugared and chocolate-covered donuts. She is requesting a loan to buy wheat, rice, sugar, firewood, gas, milk, cinnamon, and chocolate. Margarita began her business some 34 years ago. Her husband learned how to make these products and taught her to make stuffed buns. 

They sell their products in the streets of their community and the customers like the flavor. Her husband helps prepare the stuffed buns. Margarita's business is important because they must make sales to have money daily. She likes to make  the donuts and stuffed buns and feels proud and thanks God for having this business, which helps cover the costs of her daughter's schooling and buying basic materials to continue working and making their products.

Margarita's dreams and hopes are that their working area might expand to produce more stuffed buns, and that their daughter continue ahead, finishing her teaching training and finding employment.  

The group members wish to say to Kiva and the Fundacion Realidad “we are grateful for the loans that help us grow our businesses and to live better with our families, and we wish you much success, health and happiness.”

loans.use: buy wheat, rice, sugar, milk, cinnamon, chocolate, firewood, and cooking gas for making stuffed buns and donuts to sell.

loans.name: Virgen De Guadalupe Group

texts.es: La Alcancía Comunal “Virgen De Guadalupe” es un grupo conformado por 08 socios responsables, la cual tienen un mismo propósito el seguir progresando cada día siendo   Felicitas una de las integrantes, ella tiene 49 años de edad es madre soltera de 03 hijos, la cual sigue apoyando a 01 de ellos. Felicitas empezó vendiendo golosinas ambulatoriamente, con los deseos de superarse y de brindar una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos decide emprender otro negocio  la cual le brinde mayores ingresos, actualmente se dedica a la venta de comida al paso como alitas, pollos, anticuchos etc. gracias a su arduo trabajo Felicitas a podido brindarles educación a sus hijos y mejorar su vivienda. Su siguiente meta es de instalar una tienda donde ofrezca productos de primera necesidad. Con el crédito que solicito comprara insumos para su negocio como aceite, pollo, papas y algunos arreglos para su hogar. Felicitas está ubicada al lado izquierdo en la parte posterior ella viste polo color celeste.
texts.en:
The communal bank “Virgen De Guadalupe” comprises a group of 8 responsible members, who have the same goal to keep making progress each day. Felicitas is one of the members. She is 49 years old and the single mother of 3 children, one of whom she continues to support. 

Felicitas began as a street vendor of sweets. Wishing to improve herself and offer a better life to her children, she decides to open another business where she could earn more income. Now she sells fast food like wings, chicken, skewered grilled meats, etc. With her hard work, Felicitas has been able to educate her children and improve their house.

Her next goal is to set up a shop offering consumer staples. With the loan she requested, she would buy supplies for her business, such as oil, chicken, potatoes, and some household items. Felicitas appears on the left side in the back. She is wearing a blue shirt.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as oil, chicken, and potatoes

loans.name: Olga

texts.ru:
Предыдущий кредит от КИВА помог Ольге получить дополнительную прибыль, которую она смогла использовать для приобретения детских товаров для 2-х годовалой внучки, которую она, как и каждая бабушка, так любить баловать.
Ольге понадобился следующий кредит для закупки товара к весеннему сезону. Она планирует закупить женские блузы, кофты, комнатную обувь, а также полотенца и подарочные наборы для последующей реализации на рынке.
texts.en:
Olga's last loan from Kiva helped her earn additional income which she used to buy children's goods for her 2-year-old granddaughter. She, like every grandmother, loves to spoil her granddaughter. 

Olga needs this loan to buy products for the spring season. She plans to buy women’s shirts, jackets, and indoor footwear, as well as towels and gift selections for future sales at the market.

loans.use: buy women's shirts, jackets, and indoor footwear, as well as towels and gift selections for future sales at the market.

loans.name: María Eugenia

texts.es:
Perfil de María Eugenia
600000
María Eugenia tiene 26 años es soltera y actualmente está estudiando Ingeniería Industrial en una universidad en la Ciudad de Alajuela, en el Valle Central de Costa Rica;  ella llegó a la zona procedente de Limón en la costa del Caribe,  viene de una familia de escasos recursos pero con muchos deseos de superación razón por la que se ha acercado a Fundación Mujer para apoyar a su pequeño negocio con capital de trabajo.

Ella inició un bazar librería con la liquidación que obtuvo al salir de su trabajo, además esta por terminar su carrera universitaria, conocimiento que desea poner en práctica para  apoyar su microempresa de una mejor manera. María Eugenia vive sola,  se levanta a las 5 de la mañana y prepara su comida ya que a las 7 am llega a su negocio para limpiar y ordenar el trabajo del día, a las 8 am abre las puertas al público y cierra a las 7 pm para ir la Universidad hasta las 10 de la noche. Está llevando el último curso y espera iniciar en el segundo semestre el proyecto de graduación. El estudio le ha ayudado a administrar su microempresa y ha ido creciendo en casi un año de trabajo.

La inversión le va a permitir ampliar la oferta de producto para aumentar sus ingresos y desea crecer personal y profesionalmente para retribuir a sus padres un poco de lo que le han dado para desarrollar su vida.

El trabajo ha sido muy duro y difícil pero ha mejorado su punto de venta, razón por la cual necesita aumentar su inventario, ella dedica su esfuerzo y dedicación a mejorar cada día y ha aprendido a administrar su dinero, ya que está sola en este lugar. Su actitud y dedicación son dignas de mencionar y con el apoyo de Fundación Mujer y los inversores de KIVA esperar crecer y tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
María Eugenia’s Profile
600000

María Eugenia, 26, is single and studying Industrial Engineering at a university in the city of Alajuela in Costa Rica’s Central Valley.  She arrived in the area from Limón on the Caribbean coast.  She’s from a family of scarce resources but with a strong wish to get ahead which is why she approached Fundación Mujer for working capital support for her small business.

She started her stationery shop and general store with severance pay she got when she left her job.  She’s about to finish her university training and wants to put her knowledge to use in supporting her micro business in a better way.

María Eugenia lives alone.  She gets up at 5am and prepares her food because she arrives at her business at 7am to clean and straighten up for the day’s work; she opens to the public at 8am and closes at 7pm to go to classes at the University until 10pm.  She’s in the final course and hopes to start her graduation project in the second semester.  Her studies have helped her run her micro business and it’s grown in the almost one year it’s been in operation.

The investment will allow her to expand stock on offer and increase income.  She wants to grow both personally and professionally to pay back her parents a little of what they’ve given her in order to develop her life.

The work has been very hard and difficult but she’s improved her sales point which is why she needs to increase inventory.  She aims her dedication and effort toward improving every day and has learned how to administer her money since she’s alone in this place.  Her attitude and dedication are worth mentioning and with support from Fundación Mujer and Kiva lenders she hopes to grow and have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to stock her store.

loans.name: Georginah

texts.en:
Georginah is a 38 year old lady married to Tom. They have two children aged five and twelve.

Georginah operates an automobile spare parts sales business. She has been doing this for the last five years, making a monthly income of KES 20,000. She is taking her second loan which she will use to buy automobile spare parts. Her profits will be used to expand the stock capacity.

Her dream is to own a big spare parts shop.

loans.use: to buy automobile spare parts.

loans.name: Gervin Alonso

texts.es:
El  Señor Gervín es  una   persona  dedicado  100% a su negocio propio, el tiene un negocio de venta  de   celulares, recargas  y tarjetas. Actividad   que  realiza  en  Namasigue,   Choluteca   desde  hace mas  de 6 años, Gervin   es  padre  de  2  hijos  corta  edad sus hijos van a  la  escuela  de  de  su  comunidad . También  cuenta  con  la  ayuda    de    su  familia  y  esposa  que  se  también  le ayuda  en  el negocio  y  cuidar  su casa  y  a  sus  hijos.
Gervin sueña que pueda aumentar su negocio para que su familia tenga mayores oportunidades y sus hijos puedan estudiar y graduarse de una universidad. Gervin dedica su tiempo libre  a  visitar  sus parientes que viven en comunidades cercanas.

Choluteca, Honduras – Febrero 2012.
texts.en:
Gervín is a person who is 100% dedicated to his own business; he has had a business selling mobile phones, chargers and phone cards in Namasigue, Choluteca for over six years.

Gervín is the father of two young children who attend the local school in the community.  He also gets support from his family and his wife who helps him in the business and to care for his house and children.

Gervín dreams with enlarging the business so that his family will have greater opportunities and his children can attend school and graduate from a university.

Gervín spends his free time visiting relatives that live in nearby communities.

Choluteca, Honduras - February 1012.

loans.use: to buy mobile phones, cards and chargers.

loans.name: Las Limas Group

texts.es: Este grupo solidario se llama Las Limas, está conformado por las señoras Maribel Maximina, Sabina y Rosario van a comprar con su préstamo leña, pintura y barro, la señora Esther va a comprar pollo vivo, alimento de crecimiento, vitaminas y antibióticos. La señora Rosario tiene 43 años de edad, ella es casada su esposo  elabora comales, ella tiene 4 hijas mujeres ya se casaron, ella se dedica a la alfarería elabora comales de barro, ella solicito su préstamo para comprar leña, pintura y barro para surtirse de material e ir trabajando, ella inicio su negocio hace 25 años por necesidad y por falta de recursos económicos para darles alimentacion a sus hijas,  su negocio es importante porque tiene ingresos para la alimentación, ella se siente orgullosa de saber elaborar los comales y le gusta hacerlos y ver que todos salieron bien, en su comunidad todos hacen comales los distinguen por el sello del gallito,  ella distribuye las ganancias una parte para comprar leña y barro, otra para la alimentación. Sus sueños y esperanzas son llegar a tener una tienda de abarrotes o una papelería y que todos estén bien de salud para seguir en el trabajo. Las integrantes del grupo quieren decirle a Kiva y a Fundación realidad. “muchas gracia por sus prestamos esperamos no fallar en los pagos para que nos sigan prestando, y que sigan ayudando a las personas que más lo necesitan”.
texts.en: This community bank is named Las Limas.  It is made up of señoras Maribel Maximina, Sabina, and Rosario, who are going to use their loan to buy firewood, paint, and clay.  Señora Esther is going to buy live chickens, feed, vitamins, and antibiotics.  Señora Rosario is 43 and married.  Her husband makes "comales," ceramic dishes used to make tortillas.  She has 4 adult daughters who are already married.  She makes pottery such as clay comales.  She requested her loan to buy firewood, paint, and clay to stock up on mateirals to do her work.  She started her business 25 years ago out of necessity and because of the lack of economic resources to feed her daughters.  Her business is important because she now has income for food.  She is proud to know how to make comales, and she likes to make them and see that all of them come out well.  In her community, everyone that makes comales distinguishes them by the seal of a little rooster.  She uses part of her earnings to buy firewood and clay and the other part to buy food.  Her hopes and dreams are to have a grocery store or an office supply store and that everyone stays healthy so they can keep working.  The members of the group want to tell Kiva and the Foundation, "Thank you very much for your loans.  We hope not to fail in making payments so you will keep loaning to us and that you will keep helping the people who need it most."

loans.use: to buy firewood, paint, and clay to make "comales" (ceramic dishes for cooking tortillas)

loans.name: Pulot

texts.ru: Пулот женат и на воспитании имеет четверых детей. Жена занимается домохозяйством. Более 20 лет Пулот занимается купле- продажей скота, а также выращиванием сельхозпродукции. Отходы от выращивания культур идут на корм скота. Пулот хочет расширить свой бизнес и получить хорошую прибыль, чтобы отремонтировать свой дом и улучшить благосостояние семьи. Пулот запрашивает займ для покупки трех голов крупного рогатого скота.
texts.en: Pulot is married and has four children to raise. His wife is a housewife. For over 20 years Pulot has been buying and selling livestock, as well as farming. The waste from his agricultural producion goes to feeding the livestock. Pulot wants to expand his buisness and earn a good income so that he can make repairs to his house and improve his family's quality of life. Pulot is asking for a loan to buy three head of cattle.

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora lives in Yambio. She is 33 years old and married with four children. All of her children are still in school. 

Nora sells food at a stall. She has been in this business for three years. She heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of SDG 2000 in order to purchase beans and rice. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase beans and rice for sale.

loans.name: Carolyn

texts.en: Carolyn, a 35-year-old single mother of three children between the ages of 8 and 14 years, lives in the town of  Kisumu where she has operated a hair salon for the last 10 years, earning a monthly income of KES 10,000. Now requesting her first loan from KADET LTD to buy a stock of shampoo, blow dryers and hair braids, she will use the new profits to educate her children. Carolyn's dream is to own a big salon business.

loans.use: to buy a stock of shampoo, blow dryers and hair braids.

loans.name: Buenos Aires Group

texts.es: Doña Abade es miembro del Grupo Solidario Buenos Aires, es madre soltera, tiene 40 años de edad, tiene cinco hijos de los cuales tres son estudiantes y aun dependen de ella. Doña Abade se dedica a la elaboración y venta de tortillas desde hace siete años, inicio su negocio sola ahora tiene una pequeña tortillera, que atiende ella y mas de sus cuatro empleados desde las 3 am hasta las 12 pm. Su ventaja es que tiene una muy buena clientela, el único problema es que tiene que pagar alquiler y lo que le queda en ganancias le ayuda para cubrir el pago del local. Abade esta solicitando el préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de maseca y leña. Con el apoyo de este préstamo seguirá teniendo una actividad económica que le permita cubrir los gastos para la manutención de su familia y una fuente de ingresos para sus empleados. Su sueño es tener su propia casa y ayudar a sus hijos a realizarse profesionalmente. Tiene 5 años de recibir el apoyo de FAMA y ha cancelado sus cuotas de manera puntual y los préstamos obtenidos le han ayudado a mejorar su condición de vida y su negocio.
texts.en:
Abade is a member of the “Buenos Aires” communal bank.  She’s a 40 year old single mother and has five children of which three are students and still dependent on her.

Abade has been making tortillas to sell for the last seven years.  She started her business by herself and now has a small tortilla shop that she and her four employees tend to from 3am until noon.  Her advantage is that she has a good clientele but the only problem is that she has to pay rent and what she earns in profits helps her cover the rental cost.

Abade is asking for the loan to buy Maseca [brand of corn flour] and firewood.  With support from the loan she’ll be able to continue to have an economic activity that will make it possible for her to cover costs of supporting her family and provide a source of employment for her employees.  Her dream is to have a house of her own and to help her children develop professionally.

She’s been getting support from FAMA for five years and has made her installment payments punctually; loans obtained have helped her improve her living conditions and her business.

loans.use: to buy Maseca and firewood.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Esly Karina

texts.es:
Elsy tiene 27 años de edad, es soltera y vive con una tía y su prima en Puerto Cortes.
Elsy es una joven muy trabajadora, tiene un negocio de una pequeña pulpería que logro establecer hace 1 años, viéndose sin una oportunidad de empleo que le solventara las necesidades económicas del hogar. Tiene también un negocio de venta de comida como baleada, pastelitos de maíz y harina rellenos de carne, almuerzos y cenas. Manifiesta que le ha ido muy bien ya que ha sabido administrar bien su inversión. Dedicándose a trabajar todo día.
Es su primer préstamo con ODEF, el cual invertirá en comprar productos alimenticios (granos básicos)para surtir su pulpería y también en comprar  insumos para la elaboración de los alimentos para la venta. Con esto piensa aumentar sus ingresos y obtener buenas ganancias mejorando la calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Elsy, 27, is single and lives with her aunt and cousin in Puerto Cortes.

Elsy is a very hardworking young woman.  She has a small grocery store that she managed to open a year ago since she had no job opportunities that would cover household economic needs.  She also sells food like “baleada” [a wheat flour tortilla, often quite thick, folded in half and filled with mashed fried beans], corn and flour cakes filled with meat, lunches and dinners.  She states that she’s done very well and has known how to administer her investment well working all day.

This is her first ODEF loan and she will use it to buy foodstuffs (basic grains) to stock her grocery store and also to buy ingredients to make the food she sells.  She intends to increase income and earn good profits this way improving her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store and ingredients to cook her dishes.

loans.name: Arnest

texts.en:
Arnest is a 38 year old man from Kisumu City. He is married to Jenipher. They have 3 kids aged 10-14 years.

Arnest operates a retail stall selling various items such as clothing like belts and purses and other assorted items. This kind of business is locally known as Malimali. He has been in this business for the last 20 years making a monthly income of KES 10,000. 

He is taking his first loan from KADET LTD, which he will use to buy a stock of  belts, purses, photo albums, and calculators for sale. The profits will be used to buy more retail stock. His dream is to own a big business.

loans.use: To buy a stock of belts, purses, photo albums, and calculators.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is 33 year old gentleman from Kisumu city. He is married to Vivian. They have three children aged four, six, and eight years.

James operates a movie and music discs business. He has been doing this for the last four years making a monthly income of KES 10,000. He is taking his first loan which he will use to buy movie and music CDs and DVDs. He will use his profits to add stock.

His dream is to have a big movie selling business in Kisumu.

loans.use: To buy movie and music CDS and DVDs.

loans.name: Sitienei

texts.en:
Sitienei, a resident of Litein, in South Rift Kenya, is a 38-year-old married father of four children ranging in age from eight years to eight months. He has been a dairy farmer for 15 years and is helped by one farmhand to produce milk which he sells to the local market. He gets additional income from his teaching employment.

Sitienei has requested a loan of 60,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy a dairy cow at 40,000 KES and construct a dairy unit with the remaining 20,000 KES. He says the farming income will help him improve his family's living standards. While lamenting the poor local markets, he thanks Juhudi Kilimo for offering grace periods in their loan services.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow and construct a dairy unit.

loans.name: Los Angeles De Vitarte Group

texts.es: La alcancía comunal “Los Angeles de Vitarte” conformado por 8 socias los cuales radican en la zona de los  distrito de Ate Vitarte de ahí el nombre del grupo, ya que todas viven en la misma zona; es un grupo nuevo que tienen todas las ganas de trabajar con Edaprospo para que les apoyen en el negocio que cada una vienen realizando. Nuestras socias hacen un gran sacrificio entre los quehaceres del hogar y sus negocios, en el caso de la Srta. Reyna (Presidenta), con  39 años de edad lleva adelante el negocio de venta de productos de bellezhace 5 años, a su vez por las tardes vende zapatillas asus clientes de confianza el presente préstamo lo invertirá en comnpras de porductos de belleza para el negocio y en continuar sus ventas de calzado. Cabe mencionar el entusiasmo y el deseo de seguir saliendo adelante con esfuerzo y dedicación hacia un bienestar y mejora de cada una de las integrantes de la alcancía comunal.
texts.en:
The “Los Ángeles de Vitarte” communal bank has 8 members who live in Ate Vitarte thus the group’s name since they all live in the same zone.  It’s a new group that very much wants to work with Edaprospo so that it will support the businesses that each one of them has.  Our members make a big sacrifice between household chores and their businesses.

In the case of Reyna, 39, (President) she’s been selling beauty products for five years and during the afternoons she sells sandals to her best customers.  She will use the present loan to buy beauty products for her business and to continue with her footwear sales.

It’s worth pointing out the enthusiasm and wish to continue moving forward with effort and dedication toward wellbeing and improvement for each one of the communal bank’s members.

loans.use: to buy beauty products.

loans.name: Belfar David

texts.es: EL Sr. Belfar tiene 37 años  es casado pero no tiene  hijos, el se dedica al servicio de  alquiler de amplificación a distintos acontecimientos sociales, como ser bautizos, matrimonios y toda clase de acontecimientos,  solicito este  préstamo para arreglo de vehículo ya que  esto le permitirá transportar sus amplificadores ya que son muy pesados y tiene que transportar a los distintos acontecimientos,  Belfar  enfrenta retos en su negocio que son competencia y  utilizara los beneficios para mejorar sus bienes y sueña  con  ampliar su amplificación, es una persona emprendedora con ganas de superación se siente feliz y agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Belfar, 37, is married but does not have children.  He has a business renting sound equipment to a variety of social functions, such as baptisms, weddings and other types of social events.  He is requesting a loan to fix his vehicle, because this will allow him to transport his amplifiers.  These amplifiers are very heavy, and he has to transport them to different events.  Belfar faces challenges in his business, including the competition.  He will use the profits from his business to improve his equipment, as he dreams of having more sound equipment.  He is an enterprising person who has a strong desire to excel.  He is happy and grateful to this institution for the support provided.

loans.use: to fix his vehicle so that he can transport his sound equipment

loans.name: Rahama

texts.en:
Rahama lives in Yambio where she has been operating a food stall for the past year. She is 27 years old, married, and has four children, all of them in school.

Rahama, who learned about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer, is requesting her first loan from BRAC for 400 SDG in order to purchase onions and oil for resale. She will use the resulting extra income to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase onions and oil for resale.

loans.name: Faraj

texts.en: Faraj, a 26-year-old single man from Gaza, works in agriculture selling sheep. Now requesting this loan in order to buy sheep for his farm, Faraj hopes the loan will improve his business and increase his income.

loans.use: to buy sheep for his farm.

loans.name: Ilyos

texts.ru: Ильёс парень 30 лет, женат имеет одного ребёнка. Он занимается профессиональной съёмкой и монтажом свадебных мероприятий, а также имеет точку по продаже DVD дисков. Ильес ответственно относится к своей работе и поэтому качество его видеосъёмок на высоком уровне. На его съемку очень хороший спрос и у него много заказов. На получаемый кредит Ильес собирается приобрести партию DVD дисков.
texts.en: Ilyos is a 30 year-old guy who is married and has one child. He is a professional cameraman and editor of wedding videos, and also has a retail outlet where he sells DVDs. Ilyos has a very responsible attitude towards his work, which is why his videos are of the highest quality. There is a lot of demand for his work and he has many orders. Using this loan, Ilyos would like to purchase a shipment of DVDs.

loans.use: to buy a shipment of DVDs

loans.name: Jaime Gonzalo

texts.es:
Jaime, de oficio comerciante se dedica a las ventas de CD de música, lleva 10 años realizando esta actividad en la ciudad de Estelí. Este negocio lo empezó cuando tenía 20 años de edad, lo puso con capital que tenia ahorrado de su antiguo trabajo, el trabajaba en tiendas de supermercado pero un día decidió emprender su propio negocio.  El tenia muy poca mercadería vendía muy poco CDs de música ahora vender además de eso gafas de sol, bolsos para celulares, limas. Así poco a poco ha ido surtiendo su negocio. 
El realizo el crédito para comprar CDs, gafas, cartucheras de celular. Su idea es ir variando los productos que vende y que son de uso popular. Lograr tener una tienda de mercadería en general y  tener capital para darle un techo digno a su familia.
texts.en:
Jaime, whose business is selling music CDs, has been working this way for ten years in the city of Estelí. He began this business when he was twenty years old. He started out with capital he had saved from his previous job, working in a supermarket. One day he decided to start his own business. He had very little merchandise and sold few music CDs. Now, in addition to CDs he sells sunglasses, cellphone cases, and shirts. Little by little, he has supplied his business this way.
He has requested the loan to purchase CDs, sunglasses, and cellphone cases. His idea is to continue varying the products he sells which are currently popular. He hopes to have a general merchandise store and have the capital to provide his family with a roof over its head.

loans.use: to purchase CDs, sunglasses, and cellphone cases.

loans.name: El Charquito Group

texts.es:
La señora Edith tiene  treinta y seis años de edad, ella pertenece a una localidad llamada El charquito un lugar bonito donde hay un rió hermoso donde las personas van a bañarse  y pasar un lindo fin de semana con su familia.
Doña Edith nos cuenta que esta orgullosa de la comunidad donde vive y de sus paisanos ya que son personas trabajadoras y honestas que se dedican a diversas actividades económicas.
Doña Edi como mejor la conocen sus compañeras de grupo  se dedica a la venta de comida como son: caldos de pollo, caldo de res con verduras, tacos blanditos de cecina, carne enchilada, tripa, empanadas de pollo y quesillo y a la venta de refrescos, sabritas y yogurt.
Esta felizmente casada con el señor Antonio un señor trabajador y honesto que se dedica al trabajo de campo como es la siembra de maíz.
Tiene la cantidad de  cuatro hijos Everardo, Karen Arlet, Yamilet e Ingrid Yaret ellos son el motivo por el cual cada día se levanta con fuerzas para trabajar y superarse para que sus hijos estén orgullosos  de su madre.
Ella nos cuenta una de las experiencias mas lindas de su negocio: "hace dos años  solamente vendía tacos de tripa y de cecina y  decidí acudir a Fundación  para recibir un préstamo", gracias al préstamo compró mas carnes y verduras y unas mesas y así trabajar mas tiempo ya que también decidió vender cenas y con el paso del tiempo decidió vender almuerzos, comidas y cenas, y con sus ganancias comprar jugos, refrescos y sabritas, yogurt y verduras chile carne y un refrigerador grande, y al final remodelo su negocio para que estuviera mas amplio y llame la atención y den ganas de sentarse a comer en lugar limpio con una  comida bien sabrosa y con tortillas ellas a manos.
Lo que mas la llena de alegría a  Doña Edith es saber que con el apoyo de fundacion ha podido hacer crecer su negocio y mejorar la vida de sus hijos para que con el  paso del tiempo  puedan tenerlos recursos para cumplir sus sueños.
Doña Edith Utilizo su préstamo para la compra de más ingredientes para la elaboraron de comida como es: chiles verdes, chiles secos, cebolla, verduras, carne de res, carne de pollo, quesos y  más refrescos para la venta.
Ella nos dice que esta contenta por todo lo que le ha dado como haber conocido a fundacion ya que es como su familia por que le ayudo a ser realidad sus sueños que  es tener su taqueria.
Las otras integrantes del grupo son: 
Teodora-quien se dedica a la venta de pollos.
Adelina- se dedica a la venta de tacos.
Catalina-quien se dedica a la venta de ropa.
Rosa-quien se dedica a la venta de ropa.
Virginia- quien se dedica a la venta de ropa.
Hortensia-quien se dedica a la venta de antojitos mexicanos.
Ángela Rutila -quien se dedica a la venta de materias primas.
Antonia-quien se dedica a la venta de ropa.
Argelia –quien se dedica a la venta de ropa.
Ana Maria-quien se dedica a la venta de tacos.
Dominoza-quien se dedica a la venta de antojitos mexicanos.
Teodora Marina -quien se dedica a la venta de pan.
Evodía-quien se dedica a la venta de pollo.
Le dan las gracias a fundacion por el apoyo que les ha dado  para que puedan hacer crecer su negocio y mejorar sus vidas y su comunidad tenga mas comercios.
texts.en:
Señora Edith is 36.  She belongs to a town called El Charquito in a nice place where there is a beautiful river where people go swimming and spend nice weekends with their families.  Doña Edith tells us that she is proud of the community where she lives, and her compatriots are hard-working and honest people that are dedicated to various economic activities.

Doña Edi, as her group members call her, sells food like: chicken soup, beef and vegetable soup, soft tacos with cured meat, enchilada meat, intestines, and cheese and chicken empanadas.  She also sells soft drinks, Sabrita-brand snacks, and yogurt.

She is happily married to señor Antonio, a hard-working and honest man who works in the field harvesting corn.  She has four children:  Everardo, Karen Arlet, Yamilet, and Ingrid Yaret.  They are the reason she gets up every day with strength to work and improve herself so her children will be proud of their mother.

She told us one of her best experiences with her business:  "Two years ago, I only sold tacos made with intestines or cured meat.  I decided to approach the Fundación to receive a loan."  Thanks to the loan, she bought more meat and vegetables and some tables to work more.  She also decided to sell cured meat, and with time, she started selling lunches, meals, and dinners.  With what she earned, she bought juices, soft drinks, Sabrita-brand snacks, yogurt, vegetables, hot peppers, meat, and a large refrigerator.  She finally remodeled her business so that it was bigger and to call attention to it so people would want to sit down to eat in a clean place with very delicious food and hand-made tortillas.

What most fills Doña Edith with happiness is knowing that with the support of the Fundación, she has been able to grow her business and improve the life of her children so that as time passes, they will have the resources they need to fulfill their dreams.

Doña Edith used her loan to buy more ingredients to make food like:  green chilis, dried chilis, onions, vegetables, beef, chicken, cheeses, and more soft drinks to sell.

She tells us that she is happy for everything that has been given to her like becoming familiar with the Fundación, which is like her family because it helped her make her dreams a reality, which was to have her own taco business.

The other members of the group are:

Teodora - who sells chickens
Adelina - who sells tacos
Catalina - who sells clothing
Rosa - who sells clothing
Virginia - who sells clothing
Hortensia - who sells Mexican comfort food
Ángela Rutila - who sells raw matierals
Antonia - who sells clothing
Argelia –who sells clothing
Ana Maria - who sells tacos
Dominoza - who sells Mexican comfort food
Teodora Marina - who sells bread
Evodía - who sells chickens

They are thankful to the Funcación for the support it has given them so they can grow their businesses and improve their lives and so their community will have more businesses.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make food.

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora lives in Yambio. She is 35 years old and married. She has four children; all of them are still in school. 

Nora sells fuel. She has been in business for three years. She heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. She has requested a loan of SDG 3000 in order to purchase fuel. She will use the extra income from this loan to pay her children's school fees. This is her forth loan from BRAC.

loans.use: to purchase fuel for sale.

loans.name: Abdurazak

texts.ru: Абдуразаку 46  лет, женат,имеет 4 детей. Он добрый,трудолюбивый,отзывчивый человек.Уже 20 лет занимается производством национальных лепешек.У него много клиентов.Он мастер своего дела.Среди населения имеет свой авторитет.Это деятельность осталась ему от отца.Он очень любит свою работу и гордится выпечкой вкусных лепешек. Он кредитуется в МДО "Арванд" уже 4 года и благодарен нашей организации. На полученный кредит Абдуразак хочет закупить муку так как цена на муку снизилась.
texts.en: Abdurazak is 46 years old, married, and has 4 children. He is a kind, hard-working and compassionate person. For 20 years he has been making traditional flat-breads. Abdurazak is a master of his trade, has many clients, and is highly regarded by the populace. He inherited this occupation from his father. Abdurazak loves his work and is proud of making delicious flat-breads. He has been a client of MDO Arvand, LLC for 4 years, and is grateful for their support. Using this loan, Abdurazak would like to purchase flour as its price has recently dropped.

loans.use: to purchase flour for his bakery

loans.name: Rajaboi

texts.ru: Рачабой добрый и порядочный человек, который имеет хорошую дружную семью и троих детей. Более 11 лет занимается купле- продажей скота и одновременно занимается выращиванием сельхозкультур. Отходы от выращивания культур идут на корм скота. В бизнесе помогает жена. Рачабой запрашивает займ для покупки двух голов крупного и мелкого рогатого скота. А также на остальную сумму хочет купить семена пшеницы и ячменя. Рачабой надеется на вашу помощь и доброту.
texts.en: Rajaboi is a kind and decent man who has a nice loving family with three children. For over 11 years, he has been raising livestock and growing crops. Rajaboi uses the waste from crops to feed his animals. His wife helps him with the business. Rajaboi is requesting this loan to purchase two new animals for his herd. Using the remaining money, he would like to buy wheat and barley seeds. Rajaboi hopes for your help and kindness.

loans.use: to buy livestock and seeds

loans.name: Reforma Group

texts.es:
Flora cuenta con 57 años de edad, es casada, tiene un hijo y un sobrino los cuales están a su cargo su hijo tiene 11 años y esta en 6° de primaria mientras que el sobrino llamado Marcial  ya es mayor de edad y pronto contraerá matrimonio con su novia, el esposo de Flora se llama Calixto y es policía munipal y la apoya en el negocio.
Ella es comerciante venta de frutas y verduras ya tiene 34 años con el negocio lo cual dice que le va muy bien con el negocio pues ella ya tiene experiencia en su negocio y espera que el préstamo le ayude así para sacar adelante el negocio ya que le gustaría incrementar mas el negocio ya que es un buen negocio le esta echando todas las ganas trabajando día a día para sacarlo adelante. Ella da las gracias por el apoyo brindado que le fue de gran utilidad.
Flora pertenece al grupo Reforma cuyo nombre es por la colonia de donde viven el grupo esta compuesto por 11 personas todas mujeres trabajadoras a continuación eran mencionadas: Eulogia, Luz María, Rosa, Yazmín, Alejandra, Olga, Feliciana, Juana, Cirila, Dianaleydi, todas realizan actividades comercial como son: carnicería, ropa, venta de productos por catalogo, perfumes, frutas y verduras, artículos de bisutería, productos de abarrotes, etc.
texts.en:
Flora, 57, is married and has a child and a nephew who are in her care.  Her son is 11, and is in 6th grade, while her nephew, Marcial, is an adult and will soon marry his fiancee.  Flora's husband is named Calixto.  He is a policeman and he also helps her with her business.

Flora is a merchant who has been selling fruits and vegetables for 34 years.  She says that her business is going very well.  She already has experience with her business and she expects that this loan will help her to get ahead with her business, as she would like to grow the business more.  Because it is a good business, she is always giving it her best each day so that she can make progress with it.  Flora gives her thanks for the support provided, which has been very helpful to her.

Flora belongs to the communal bank "Reforma," which is named after the neighborhood where the members live.  This group has 11 members, who are all hardworking women.  The group includes: Eulogia, Luz María, Rosa, Yazmín, Alejandra, Olga, Feliciana, Juana, Cirila, and Dianaleydi.  They all work as merchants, selling items such as: meat, clothing, products through a catalog, perfumes, fruits and vegetables, accessories and costume jewelry, groceries, etc.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables such as: apples, oranges, beans, chilis, and tomatoes

loans.name: Grupo Guasaule 4 Group

texts.es:
Doña  Luz  es  un  señora muy trabajadora  dedicado  a su trabajo,  madre soltera, ella tiene 2  hijos   mayores  de  edad y   le  ayudan  en  la  parte  económica.  Doña Luz tiene su negocio   en  la  aduana  de  Guasaule, en  el  sur  de  Honduras.  Desde hace  mas  de  15  años se  dedica   a  Lo que  es  la  venta  de  comida y pollo  frito.  Doña  Luz  el  préstamo lo necesita   Para  la  compra  de  pollo, canes, lácteos y  condimentos. Este crédito  le  ayudara   ya  que  tendrá  capital  fresco para invertir   ya  que  trabaja  con algunos clientes y les da  crédito, Doña Luz sueña   con comprar un  micro bus  para  a si tener  mejores  ingresos  para  bienestar  de  sus  hijos.
Kenia,  se  dedica  a la  venta  de  comida  en la  aduana  de  Guasaule  desde  hace  mas  de  3  años y  actualmente    vive  con  su  esposo.
Mirna, se  dedica  a la  venta  de  ropa  nueva   desde hace  mas  de   4  años, es madre  de  2  hijos  y  actualmente  vive  con su  esposo.



Choluteca, Honduras - Marzo 2012
texts.en:
Luz is a very hardworking woman who is dedicated to her work. She is a single mother with two adult children who help her financially. Luz has her business in the border town of Guasaule, in southern Honduras. For more than fifteen years she has sold fried chicken and other foods. Luz is requesting the loan to purchase chicken, sugar, dairy products, and condiments. This loan will help her to have fresh capital to invest since she already works with some clients who provide her with credit. Luz dreams of purchasing a microbus to earn more revenue and provide for her children’s well-being.
Kenia, who has worked for more than three years selling food in the border town of Guasaule, currently lives with her husband.
Mirna, who has worked for more than four years selling new clothing, is the mother of two children and currently lives with her husband.

Choluteca, Honduras – March 2012

loans.use: to purchase soda pop, beef, chicken, pork, and condiments for her business.

loans.name: Vianca Maribel

texts.es:
Vianca tiene 27 años de edad, es soltera, y vive junto a su familia en el distrito de Mochumí, ubicado a 40 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital del departamento de Lambayeque.

Se dedica desde hace dos años a la crianza y venta de animales, el cría aves de corral y animales menores en la parte posterior de su domicilio, cuando ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta a los negociantes que visitan con frecuencia la zona. Esta actividad le provee de una fuente estable de ingresos con los cuales saca adelante a su joven familia. Adicionalmente tiene una bodega donde ofrece abarrotes y productos de primera necesidad y ropa.

Vianca desea mejorar la crianza de sus animales adquiriendo alimento balanceado de modo que puedan ser vendidos a un mejor precio, además de comprar alimento balanceado para sus animales.  Y, para lograr su objetivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Vianca is 27 and single.  She lives with her family in the district of Mochumí, which is located 40 minutes from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the department of Lambayeque.

She has raised and sold animals for two years.  She raises poultry and small animals behind her home.  When they have reached a good level of development, she sells them to businesspeople that frequent the area.  This work has proven to be a stable source of income for her and helps her young family get ahead.  She also has a small bodega where she sells groceries, basic goods, and clothing.

Vianca hopes to improve on raising her animals by acquiring nutritious food for them so she can sell them at a better price.  To accomplish her goal, she saw it necessary to request her first loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1,500 PEN.

loans.use: to buy groceries to stock her store and to buy nutritious food for her livestock.

loans.name: Halimajon

texts.ru: Халимачон 1951 года рождения, имеет 2 сыновей. Она реализует оптом пластиковые сетки и другие хозяйственные товары. Практически у нее круглый год реализация и сезонность. Ее лавка находиться на центральном рынке города. Халимачон сотрудничает с нашей организации с 2009 года. Стаж торговли на рынке почти 15 лет. Она очень была рада сотрудничеству с нашей организацией и  благодарна за финансовую поддержку
texts.en: Halimajon was born in 1951. She has 2 sons. She is engaged in bulk sales of plastic netting and other household goods. Halimajon makes sales virtually year-round, and stocks seasonal products. Her shop is located at the city's central market. Halimajon has been a client of MDO Arvand, LLC since 2009, and has almost 15 years of experience selling goods at the market. She has been glad to work with MDO Arvand, LLC and is grateful for their financial support.

loans.use: to increase her working capital

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa lives in Yambio. She sells clothes, and has been in business for 3 years. She is 38 years old, married, and has four children; all of them are still in school. 

Teresa heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her fifth loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 2500 SDG in order to purchase clothes. She will use the extra income from this loan to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for sale.

loans.name: Nicholas

texts.en:
Nicholas is a 39-year-old man from the Nyamusi area and is married to Bethsheba. They have four children aged 6 to 18 years.
